original: @62a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @62a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'a lo ka m'a la hri d'a nandza na n'i t'i ka n'a ma /
analyzed: a'a lo ka m'a la hri d'a nandza na n'i t'i ka n'a ma /
translated: Ālokamālāhrīdānanandana-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: snang ba'i phreng ba'i 'grel pa yid dga' ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: snang ba'i phreng ba'i 'grel pa yid dga' ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Commentary on the Garland of Light, called “Producing Delight in the Mind”

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽gsung gi mchog tu sad mdzad pa //🔽gzigs dbang mgon la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo // gsung gi mchog tu sad mdzad pa // gzigs dbang mgon la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.🔽Having paid homage to the lord of vision,

original: snang ba'i phreng ba gsal ba yi //
analyzed: snang ba'i phreng ba gsal ba yi //
translated: the protector who awakens to supreme speech,

original: don ni rnam par nges par bya //
analyzed: don ni rnam par nges par bya //
translated: I will ascertain the meaning🔽of the Garland of Light.

original: mi shes gsum ni spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mi shes gsum ni spang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon the three ignorances,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'brel pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams bstan te /
translated: and so on. By this, the connection, the subject matter, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose of this chapter are taught.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa la sogs pa ma bstan na rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams thos pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa la sogs pa ma bstan na rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams thos pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the connection and so on are not taught, those who proceed with prior understanding will not engage in listening and so on.

original: 'dir sems tsam nyid du rab tu byed pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sems tsam nyid du rab tu byed pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ni brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, since it is to be established that this is mind only, that is to be expressed.

original: mi shes pa gsum spangs pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa gsum spangs pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: The elimination of the three kinds of nescience is the purpose.

original: mi shes pa gsum spangs nas gdul bya rnams sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa gsum spangs nas gdul bya rnams sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa yin no //
translated: The attainment of Buddhahood by disciples after the elimination of the three kinds of nescience is the purpose of the purpose.

original: sems tsam nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sems tsam nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: Mind only is to be established.

original: rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang brjod par bya ba thabs dang thabs @62b las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa ni thabs yin pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa dang brjod par bya ba thabs dang thabs @62b las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Since the treatise is the means, the treatise and what is to be expressed have the nature of means and that which arises from the means, and this is the connection.

original: de dag ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni re zhig bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the summarized meaning.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the branches should be stated.

original: gang gis sems tsam du gsungs pa //
analyzed: gang gis sems tsam du gsungs pa //
translated: The one who taught mind only

original: thub dbang de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thub dbang de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to that Muni, the Lord.

original: zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pas na thub pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pas na thub pa ste /
translated: The Muni is the one who has realized.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa ste /
translated: The śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi dbang po ni thub dbang ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbang po ni thub dbang ste /
translated: The lord of the sages is their lord.

original: thub pa'i mchog rje btsun sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thub pa'i mchog rje btsun sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the venerable Bhagavān Buddha, the supreme sage.

original: sems tsam ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /🔽smras pa / rang bzhin gsum ni bsgoms pa yis//
analyzed: sems tsam ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na / smras pa / rang bzhin gsum ni bsgoms pa yis//
translated: What is the mind-only that is so?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:🔽By cultivating the three natures.

original: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gsum mo //
analyzed: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gsum mo //
translated: The imagined, the dependent, and the perfected are the three natures.

original: rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo gang bsgoms pa de gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo ni sems tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo gang bsgoms pa de gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo ni sems tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cultivation of the essence of the three natures is the essence of the three natures, which is mind-only. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir / rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo sgom zhe na //🔽mi shes gsum ni spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir / rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo sgom zhe na // mi shes gsum ni spang ba'i phyir //
translated: Why cultivate the essence of the three natures?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said:🔽In order to abandon the three ignorances.

original: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i yul la gang mi shes pa byis pa rnams la yod pa de spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags dang / gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i yul la gang mi shes pa byis pa rnams la yod pa de spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “in order to abandon” is that which is present in the childish who do not know the objects of the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: 'di ltar gang dag kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa rnams la de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag ni kun brtags pa'i yul mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gzugs la sogs pa rnams la de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa de dag ni kun brtags pa'i yul mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus, those who are attached to the imagined nature, such as form, etc., as reality, do not know the object of the imagined.

original: de bzhin du gang dag 'du byed kyi bag chags kyi rgyu las skye ba'i sems la yang rgyu med pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag ni gzhan gyi dbang gi yul mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag 'du byed kyi bag chags kyi rgyu las skye ba'i sems la yang rgyu med pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag ni gzhan gyi dbang gi yul mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, those who assert that the mind arises from the cause of the habitual propensities of the formative forces is without a cause do not know the object of the dependent.

original: de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pa la gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni yongs su grub pa'i yul mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo med pa la gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor sgro 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni yongs su grub pa'i yul mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, those who superimpose the natures of the grasped and the grasper upon the non-existent natures of the grasped and the grasper do not know the object of the perfected.

original: mi shes pa gsum po de yang mdo gzhan dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: mi shes pa gsum po de yang mdo gzhan dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One has also refuted these three kinds of ignorance in other sūtras.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: blo yis rnam par gzhig na ni //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhig na ni //
translated: When destroyed by the mind,

original: gzhan dbang med cing kun brtags med //
analyzed: gzhan dbang med cing kun brtags med //
translated: the dependent is not, nor is the imagined.

original: yongs su grub pa'ang yod min ni //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'ang yod min ni //
translated: The perfected also does not exist,

original: ji ltar blo yis rnam par brtag //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar blo yis rnam par brtag // ces gsungs so //
translated: so how can the mind imagine it?

original: chos can bkag pa nyid kyis chos rnams bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can bkag pa nyid kyis chos rnams bkag pa yin te /
translated: By refuting the possessor of attributes, the attributes are also refuted.

original: de yang slob dpon gyis yang gzhung de'i rjes su 'brang nas don de nyid rab tu byed pa 'dis @63a * //
analyzed: de yang slob dpon gyis yang gzhung de'i rjes su 'brang nas don de nyid rab tu byed pa 'dis @63a * //
translated: Moreover, the master, following that text, has established that very meaning in this chapter.

original: gtan la phab ste /
analyzed: gtan la phab ste /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'di ltar / ming dang rigs stsogs yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ming dang rigs stsogs yon tan no //
translated: Name, type, and so on, and qualities.

original: chos rnams brdzun pa gang mthong ba //
analyzed: chos rnams brdzun pa gang mthong ba //
translated: Those who see phenomena as false

original: mkha' la ri mo 'dri ba ltar //
analyzed: mkha' la ri mo 'dri ba ltar //
translated: are like one drawing a picture in the sky.

original: phyin ci log gis dub pa yin //
analyzed: phyin ci log gis dub pa yin //
translated: They are exhausted by error.

original: zhes bya ba des ni kun brtags pa'i yul mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba des ni kun brtags pa'i yul mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
translated: This refutes the ignorance of the object of imagination.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: kha las sgra ni ci phyir dang // rdza rnga las ni yang 'byung ba //
analyzed: kha las sgra ni ci phyir dang // rdza rnga las ni yang 'byung ba //
translated: and again from the clay drum?

original: tha dad pa yi rgyu 'di las //
analyzed: tha dad pa yi rgyu 'di las //
translated: From this cause, which is different,

original: dngos po dngos po med par snang //
analyzed: dngos po dngos po med par snang //
translated: things appear as things and non-things.🔽By this verse, the non-cognizing of the dependent is eliminated.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan dbang gi yul la mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan dbang gi yul la mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
translated: Thus:

original: 'di ltar / 'dir ni phyi nang cung zad med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dir ni phyi nang cung zad med //
translated: Here there is nothing external or internal at all.

original: phan tshun ltos pas grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pas grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of mutual dependence,

original: bar na ma yin med min te //
analyzed: bar na ma yin med min te //
translated: it is not in between, nor is it not.

original: sems tsam du ni gnas phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni gnas phyir ro //
translated: It is established as mind-only.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis yongs su grub pa'i yul mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis yongs su grub pa'i yul mi shes pa spong ba yin no //
translated: By this verse, the non-cognizing of the perfected is eliminated.

original: de bas na 'di ltar sems tsam du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyi ma lta bus mun pa'i tshogs lta bu'i mi shes pa gsum ma lus pa ring du spangs pas 'gro ba rnams nges par legs pa thob par mdzad par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar sems tsam du gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyi ma lta bus mun pa'i tshogs lta bu'i mi shes pa gsum ma lus pa ring du spangs pas 'gro ba rnams nges par legs pa thob par mdzad par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One, like the sun, has spoken of mind-only. By completely abandoning the three kinds of non-cognizing, which are like a mass of darkness, he has caused beings to attain definite goodness.

original: don to // sems tsam nyid gcig pu yin na ji ltar rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer na /
analyzed: don to // sems tsam nyid gcig pu yin na ji ltar rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer na /
translated: The meaning is this: if mind-only is the sole reality, how can it not be the case that the convention of the three natures is not tenable?

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: gang gi phyir bum pa gcig rim pa bzhin ldog pa'i dbye bas yod pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa gcig rim pa bzhin ldog pa'i dbye bas yod pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: because a single pot is taught to be existent, impermanent, and produced, by the divisions of its successive negations.

original: de bzhin du sems tsam la ngo bo gsum yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tsam la ngo bo gsum yin te /
translated: In the same way, mind-only has three natures.

original: 'di ltar sems gnyis su med pa las ldog pa yang 'khrul pa'i bag chags rjes su 'brel ba'i kun brtags bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phyi'i don nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems gnyis su med pa las ldog pa yang 'khrul pa'i bag chags rjes su 'brel ba'i kun brtags bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phyi'i don nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Thus, from the nondual mind, the imagined, which is the appearance of external objects such as pots and cloth, is the connection with the latent potentialities of error.

original: gzhan yang ma yin pa'i don las ldog pa las gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin pa'i don las ldog pa las gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid de bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the dependent nature is the negation of the nonexistence of objects.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa las ldog pa de kho na nyid khong du chud pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yongs su ma grub pa las ldog pa de kho na nyid khong du chud pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the thoroughly established nature is clear, because of the realization of reality, which is the opposite of the non-establishment of the natures of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: mi shes pa gsum spangs pas kun brtags la sogs pa med par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa gsum spangs pas kun brtags la sogs pa med par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the knowledge of the non-existence of the imagined and so forth is due to the abandonment of the three non-knowledges.

original: gos kyi dri ma bkrus pa ni dri ma med pas gos med par rtogs pa yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gos kyi dri ma bkrus pa ni dri ma med pas gos med par rtogs pa yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t the knowledge of the non-existence of the cloth due to the washing of the stains of the cloth?

original: de'i phyir yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the imagined nature would exist.

original: de snyam du dgongs nas slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: de snyam du dgongs nas slob dpon gyis /
translated: Thinking of that, the Acarya said:

original: srid gsum mtha' @63b ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: srid gsum mtha' @63b ru zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Having gone to the end of the three existences…”

original: 'di ltar kun brtags la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun brtags la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni spros pa'o //
translated: Thus, whatever is imagined and so forth is conceptual elaboration.

original: srid gsum mtha' ru byon ni 'dod pa dang // gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa gsum po de dag mthar mdzad pas na srid gsum mtha' ru byon no //
analyzed: srid gsum mtha' ru byon ni 'dod pa dang // gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa gsum po de dag mthar mdzad pas na srid gsum mtha' ru byon no //
translated: “Having gone to the end of the three existences” means that he has gone to the end of the three existences of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: srid pa gsum gyi mtha' ru byon pa des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod do //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi mtha' ru byon pa des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod do //
translated: He has gone to the end of the three worlds, and so is called the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: de la bsdus nas te /
analyzed: de la bsdus nas te /
translated: In brief,

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i rjes su 'brangs na sems kyi rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid du rtogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i rjes su 'brangs na sems kyi rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid du rtogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: following the analysis, he has realized that all things are mere conceptual thoughts, and not that they have an intrinsic reality.🔽If they have completely abandoned

original: gal te de dag sems las ma lus spangs //🔽zhes bya ba ni gal te ni brgya la'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag sems las ma lus spangs // zhes bya ba ni gal te ni brgya la'o //
translated: If they have completely abandoned,🔽If they have completely abandoned, they have completely abandoned, that is, they have removed,🔽all conceptual thoughts,

original: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa tsam mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa tsam mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: all conceptual thoughts, that is, all conceptual thoughts that are the highest.

original: gal te de dag sems las ni shes pa las so //
analyzed: gal te de dag sems las ni shes pa las so //
translated: If they have completely abandoned from the mind, from consciousness,

original: ma lus pa ni thams cad de bag chags dang bcas pa'o //🔽spangs pa ni bsal bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus pa ni thams cad de bag chags dang bcas pa'o // spangs pa ni bsal bar gyur pa ste /
translated: all, that is, everything, together with the latent tendencies.

original: de'i tshe de /
analyzed: de'i tshe de /
translated: At that time,

original: yang srid 'ching ba'i skye ba yod ma yin //🔽zhes smos te ;
analyzed: yang srid 'ching ba'i skye ba yod ma yin // zhes smos te ;
translated: there is no birth that binds to existence.🔽There is no birth that binds to existence.

original: skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not cling to things that do not exist, such as birth.

original: yang srid par 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang srid par 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not bind to existence.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: Nevertheless,

original: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par //
translated: apart from conceptualization,

original: 'khor ba zhes bya yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya yod ma yin //
translated: there is no so-called saṃsāra.

original: des na rnam par mi rtog pas //
analyzed: des na rnam par mi rtog pas //
translated: Therefore, through non-conceptualization,

original: rtag tu khyod ni mya ngan 'das //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu khyod ni mya ngan 'das // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: you are always in nirvāṇa.

original: da ni srid pa thar pa dag ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par 'byung ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni srid pa thar pa dag ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par 'byung ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to teach that existence and liberation arise correctly just as they are, it is said:

original: srid dang thar pa yongs shes pas //
analyzed: srid dang thar pa yongs shes pas //
translated: By fully understanding existence and liberation,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: srid dang thar pa ni srid pa dang thar pa'o //
analyzed: srid dang thar pa ni srid pa dang thar pa'o //
translated: Existence and liberation are existence and liberation.

original: de dag yongs su shes pa ni srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su shes pa ni srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Fully understanding them is fully understanding existence and liberation.

original: de'i phyir srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the result arises from the cause of fully understanding existence and liberation.

original: 'bras bu ji lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ji lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of result arises?

original: de spangs thob pa'i 'bras bu 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de spangs thob pa'i 'bras bu 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The result of abandoning and attaining arises.

original: de zhes bya bas ni srid pa dang thar pa bzung ngo ;
analyzed: de zhes bya bas ni srid pa dang thar pa bzung ngo ;
translated: The phrase “that” refers to existence and liberation.

original: / de ltar na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: / de ltar na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: srid pa ni dor bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'byung la /
analyzed: srid pa ni dor bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'byung la /
translated: Since existence is to be abandoned, the effect that is characterized by abandonment arises.

original: thar pa ni blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba zhes bya'o //🔽yongs su shes pa de yang ji srid 'bad pa mchog gis @64a * //
analyzed: thar pa ni blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu 'byung ba zhes bya'o // yongs su shes pa de yang ji srid 'bad pa mchog gis @64a * //
translated: Since liberation is to be adopted, the effect that is characterized by attainment arises.

original: rig pa rtogs par byas na /
analyzed: rig pa rtogs par byas na /
translated: Moreover, that understanding does not arise as long as one is engaged in the highest effort to understand knowledge.

original: de srid srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de srid srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: As long as that is the case, the understanding of existence and liberation does not arise.

original: yongs su shes pa med pas de spangs pa 'thob pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa med pas de spangs pa 'thob pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no understanding, the effect that is the attainment of the abandonment of that does not arise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /🔽blo gros bzang po thams cad ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / blo gros bzang po thams cad ni //
translated: For that very reason,🔽it is said:

original: nang sems pa la brtson pa yin /🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nang sems pa la brtson pa yin / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “O Subhūti, all of this is the effort of the inner mind.”

original: blo gros bzang po gang la yod pa de ni blo gros bzang po'o //
analyzed: blo gros bzang po gang la yod pa de ni blo gros bzang po'o //
translated: Subhūti is one who has good intellect.

original: blo gros bzang po de dag thams cad nang gi bdag nyid sems la brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: blo gros bzang po de dag thams cad nang gi bdag nyid sems la brtson pa yin no //
translated: All of these, O Good Intellect, are mental exertions in the nature of the internal.

original: nang gi sgra ni nang rig pa la bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi sgra ni nang rig pa la bya'o //
translated: The internal sound is to be understood as the internal knowledge.

original: de thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: de thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: The hearing, reflection, and meditation are the mental exertions.

original: brtson pa ni de'i don du brtson pa ste /
analyzed: brtson pa ni de'i don du brtson pa ste /
translated: The exertion is the effort for that, i.e., for the internal knowledge.

original: gang goms pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang goms pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cultivation.

original: de ltar byas na srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa phyin ci ma log par de dag 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar byas na srid pa dang thar pa yongs su shes pa phyin ci ma log par de dag 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, there is the non-erroneous thorough knowledge of existence and liberation.

original: da ni 'khor ba dang thar pa dag lung gi rjes su 'brangs te bsdus nas mdo'i gnas kyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: da ni 'khor ba dang thar pa dag lung gi rjes su 'brangs te bsdus nas mdo'i gnas kyi mtshan nyid /
translated: Now, after the scriptures, the characteristics of the stations of the sutras are summarized in the verse:

original: 'dod chags la sogs drir bcas sems //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs drir bcas sems // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The mind with passion, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang por gang dag la yod pa de ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang por gang dag la yod pa de ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Here, passion is that which exists first.

original: stsogs pa smos pas zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa rnams bzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa rnams bzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes hatred, delusion, etc.

original: bag chags kyi dbang gis de dang de dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas bsgos pa'i sems la 'khor ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang gis de dang de dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri mas bsgos pa'i sems la 'khor ba zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Due to the power of habitual tendencies, the mind that is tainted by the defilements of attachment, etc. is called “saṃsāra.”

original: sems de nyid las lam bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pas dben pa nyid de dag mdor bsdus pa ni rgya che ba ma yin par thar pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: sems de nyid las lam bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pas dben pa nyid de dag mdor bsdus pa ni rgya che ba ma yin par thar pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: It is said that liberation is the very mind itself, free from attachment, etc., through the cultivation of the path. It is not extensive, but is a summary.

original: gang gis gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gis gsungs she na /
translated: By whom was it said?

original: sgrib pa spangs pa'i rgyal ba yis //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa'i rgyal ba yis // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Victor, who has abandoned the obscurations.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gang dag la spangs pa mnga' ba de dag ni sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gang dag la spangs pa mnga' ba de dag ni sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Those who have abandoned the afflictive and the cognitive obscurations are “those who have abandoned the obscurations.”

original: de lta bu des gsungs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu des gsungs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of “by such a one was it said.”

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams don dam par yod pa yin no zhes 'ba' zhig nges par 'gyur bas de ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams don dam par yod pa yin no zhes 'ba' zhig nges par 'gyur bas de ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is certain that attachment, etc. exist ultimately, in order to refute that, it is said:

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug ni //
translated: Attachment, aversion, delusion,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: lus can ni lus dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: lus can ni lus dang ldan pa rnams te /
translated: “Embodied beings” are those who have bodies.

original: 'dod chags pa zhe sdang dang gti mug gang yin pa de dag ni sems kyi kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi ngo bor rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa zhe sdang dang gti mug gang yin pa de dag ni sems kyi kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi ngo bor rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Attachment, aversion, and delusion should be understood as having the nature of mere mental constructions.

original: de bas na de dag don dam par yod pa ni ma @64b yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag don dam par yod pa ni ma @64b yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not exist ultimately.

original: gal te gang dag 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi yul du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag kyang tha dad pas don dam par yod pa'i phyir sems tsam nyid mi 'grub bo zhe na /🔽gang gis chos ni gzhan dag kyang //
analyzed: gal te gang dag 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi yul du gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag kyang tha dad pas don dam par yod pa'i phyir sems tsam nyid mi 'grub bo zhe na / gang gis chos ni gzhan dag kyang //
translated: If you say that the mental objects of attachment, etc., the phenomena of form, etc., are established as existing ultimately because they are different from mind, then you should listen to the following.🔽The verse says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “By what means are the other phenomena . . . ”

original: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word “also” includes other phenomena.

original: 'dod chags pa 'ba' zhig sems kyi kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi ngo bo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags pa 'ba' zhig sems kyi kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi ngo bo ma yin gyi /
translated: Not only attachment is the nature of mere mental construction,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang ci srid pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang ci srid pa'o //
translated: but whatever phenomena there are, such as form, etc.

original: byis pa ni mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa ni mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: “The childish” are the unskilled.

original: brdzun bdag nyid ni log par lta bas yongs su bzung ba rnams te /
analyzed: brdzun bdag nyid ni log par lta bas yongs su bzung ba rnams te /
translated: “False nature” is that which is grasped by wrong views.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis brtags pa de dag kyang sems kyi kun rtog pa tsam gyi ngo bor blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis brtags pa de dag kyang sems kyi kun rtog pa tsam gyi ngo bor blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those imputed by desire, hatred, and ignorance should be seen as the nature of mere mental conceptualization.

original: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par dpyad na dri za'i grong khyer lta bur don dam pa'i ngo bor mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par dpyad na dri za'i grong khyer lta bur don dam pa'i ngo bor mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because, when analyzed by way of the nature of one and many, they are not suitable as the nature of the ultimate, like a city of gandharvas.

original: de bzhin so so'i bdag nyid yod pa rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin so so'i bdag nyid yod pa rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, individual natures are not found.

original: de bas na kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are imputed natures.

original: kun brtags pa de yang rtag tu med pa'i phyir de dag tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par don dam par gang zhig las 'gyur /
analyzed: kun brtags pa de yang rtag tu med pa'i phyir de dag tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par don dam par gang zhig las 'gyur /
translated: Because those imputations are always nonexistent, how could they be ultimately different or not different?

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin par rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin par rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas med par bstan nas /
translated: In the same way, desire and so on and phenomena such as form are taught to be nonexistent through the door of analysis of their nature as conceptualization.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang 'brel ba med pas gcig tu rnam par dag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang 'brel ba med pas gcig tu rnam par dag pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that ultimate truth is completely pure, because it is not related to any conceptual thought,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: it is said:

original: dam pa'i don gyi rtog pa la'ang //
analyzed: dam pa'i don gyi rtog pa la'ang //
translated: “Even in the ultimate thought,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.”

original: 'dir yang 'ang gi sgra ni bsdus pa yin /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'ang gi sgra ni bsdus pa yin /
translated: Here, the word “even” is inclusive.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa don dam par med pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad slob dpon gyis bkag gi 'ba' gzhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa don dam par med pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad slob dpon gyis bkag gi 'ba' gzhig ni ma yin no //
translated: Since attachment, etc. and form, etc. do not exist ultimately, the master refutes all conceptual thoughts, not just some.

original: ji srid don dam pa la'ang thob pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad shin tu med pa'i phyir dgag pa nyid brjod par bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: ji srid don dam pa la'ang thob pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad shin tu med pa'i phyir dgag pa nyid brjod par bzhed pa yin te /
translated: As long as there is the ultimate, all conceptual thoughts characterized by attainment, analysis, etc. do not exist at all. Therefore, he intends to express just their negation.

original: don dam pa bdag gis rtogs zin to //🔽bdag gis rtogs so //
analyzed: don dam pa bdag gis rtogs zin to // bdag gis rtogs so //
translated: “I have realized the ultimate!”🔽“I have realized it!”

original: bdag gis rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gis rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “I will realize it!”

original: 'di ltar rtogs par bya ba dang / rig pa dang / rig par byed pa la sogs pa mtha' yas pa rnam par rtog pa'i zhen pa ni @65a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par bya ba dang / rig pa dang / rig par byed pa la sogs pa mtha' yas pa rnam par rtog pa'i zhen pa ni @65a * //
translated: Thus, the endless conceptual attachments to what is to be realized, to the knower, the known, and so on,

original: don dam pa rig pa'i mkhas pas mtha' yas pa'i chags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgyur yang rtogs so //
analyzed: don dam pa rig pa'i mkhas pas mtha' yas pa'i chags pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgyur yang rtogs so //
translated: are understood by the wise who know the ultimate to be the cause of endless attachment and thus the cause of cyclic existence.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bas na don dam pa rig pas gnas par mi bya chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bas na don dam pa rig pas gnas par mi bya chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the verse is that one should not abide in or be attached to the ultimate.

original: gang gi phyir dge ba'i don la yang rtogs pa'i don gyis 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba'i don la yang rtogs pa'i don gyis 'khor ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: Because even the meaning of virtue becomes the cause of cyclic existence through the meaning of conceptualization,

original: mi dge ba yang rnam pa de bzhin du yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang rnam pa de bzhin du yin no //
translated: and even the meaning of nonvirtue is the same.

original: rtog la bye brag ci zhig yod //
analyzed: rtog la bye brag ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the difference between the two?

original: ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i yul lam don dam pa ma yin pa'i yul du rtog pa de la'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i yul lam don dam pa ma yin pa'i yul du rtog pa de la'o //
translated: This refers to conceptualization in regard to the object of the ultimate or the object that is not the ultimate.

original: gnyi ga la yang lam mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang lam mthun pa yin te /
translated: Both are similar in being paths,

original: brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are merely conceptualizations.

original: da ni sngar gsungs pa'i don dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sngar gsungs pa'i don dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to illustrate the meaning of what was said above, he says:

original: rten gyi dbye ba la brten pa'i //
analyzed: rten gyi dbye ba la brten pa'i //
translated: Based on the division of the basis,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: me'i bsreg pa'i mtshan nyid ni bud shing yin mod kyi /
analyzed: me'i bsreg pa'i mtshan nyid ni bud shing yin mod kyi /
translated: The characteristic of being burned by fire is indeed fuel,

original: rtsa ba dang lo ma'i dbye bas de'i sreg pa nyid du ni bye brag med do //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang lo ma'i dbye bas de'i sreg pa nyid du ni bye brag med do //
translated: but in terms of the division of roots and leaves, there is no distinction in its being burned.

original: bsil ba'i ngo bo tsan dan gyi me 'dis kyang reg pa tsam gyis te /
analyzed: bsil ba'i ngo bo tsan dan gyi me 'dis kyang reg pa tsam gyis te /
translated: This sandalwood fire, which has the nature of coolness, also burns merely by contact,

original: reg pa'i spyod yul du gyur pas sreg pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i spyod yul du gyur pas sreg pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it becomes the object of contact.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa'i yul gyi rtog pa la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa'i yul gyi rtog pa la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood in the case of ultimate conceptualization as well.

original: yang ci'i phyir don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang zhen par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang zhen par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Again, why should one not cling even to ultimate conceptualization?

original: thams cad nyid du spang bar bya //
analyzed: thams cad nyid du spang bar bya //
translated: He says: Everything should be abandoned,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: Everything means without exception.

original: 'di ltar 'khor ba'i rnam par rtog pa rags pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor ba'i rnam par rtog pa rags pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is not only coarse conceptualization of cyclic existence,🔽but also the subtle one.

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa thob pa'am /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa thob pa'am /
translated: It is the attainment of the conceptual thought that is the extreme of the🔽ultimate.

original: mi 'thob pa'i rgyu mtshan phra mo ji snyed pa'ang spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa'i rgyu mtshan phra mo ji snyed pa'ang spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should abandon all the subtle reasons for attaining or not attaining the conceptual thoughts that are fixated on the nature of the ultimate.

original: rtog pa ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /🔽'khrul pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na / 'khrul pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What kind of conceptual thought is it?🔽It is the nature of delusion.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of an illusion.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: sems ni mngon par bslad pa yin //
analyzed: sems ni mngon par bslad pa yin //
translated: the mind is thoroughly confused.

original: zhes pa ni de kho na nyid la gegs byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de kho na nyid la gegs byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it becomes an obstacle to reality.

original: gal te de lta yin na 'khrul pa'i ngo bo ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na 'khrul pa'i ngo bo ji lta bu yin /
translated: If that is so, what is the nature of delusion?

original: gang gi phyir de rtog pa dang mtshungs pa de'i phyir dgag pa'i dpes de'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rtog pa dang mtshungs pa de'i phyir dgag pa'i dpes de'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is similar to conceptual thought, in order to teach its nature by way of an example of negation, he says

original: 'khrul pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: delusion also, etc.

original: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word also has the meaning of inclusion.

original: des na 'khrul pa ma dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa ma dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because delusion is impure,

original: mig 'phrul gyi ni rnam 'phrul yin //
analyzed: mig 'phrul gyi ni rnam 'phrul yin //
translated: It is a magical creation.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig @65b 'phrul gyi spros pa lta bur snang ba yin no /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig @65b 'phrul gyi spros pa lta bur snang ba yin no /
translated: It appears like a magical creation.

original: / rnam 'phrul ni yang dag par byung ba'o //
analyzed: / rnam 'phrul ni yang dag par byung ba'o //
translated: A magical creation is a real occurrence.

original: ji ltar mig 'phrul mkhan gyis de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i sa la sogs pa'i dngos po glang po la sogs pa'i dngos por snang ba de bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyang 'khrul pa'i dbang gis gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ba 'byung po
analyzed: ji ltar mig 'phrul mkhan gyis de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i sa la sogs pa'i dngos po glang po la sogs pa'i dngos por snang ba de bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyang 'khrul pa'i dbang gis gnyis kyi ngo bor snang ba 'byung po
translated: Just as a magician causes an entity such as earth to appear as an entity such as an elephant, which it is not, in the same way, the mind, which is nondual by nature, appears as a duality due to the power of error.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: da ni mig 'phrul gyi ngo bo de shin tu yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽mig 'phrul yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ni mig 'phrul gyi ngo bo de shin tu yod pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir / mig 'phrul yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the nature of a magical creation is utterly non-existent, he says:🔽A magical creation is also a mere error of mind.

original: mig 'phrul yang sems 'khrul pa tsam du shes par bya ste khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul yang sems 'khrul pa tsam du shes par bya ste khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: A magical creation should be understood to be a mere error of mind.

original: yang mig 'phrul zhes bya ba dngos po chung zad kyang med de gang gi phyir de'i ngo bo rnam pa dpyad pa'i sgo nas shin tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang mig 'phrul zhes bya ba dngos po chung zad kyang med de gang gi phyir de'i ngo bo rnam pa dpyad pa'i sgo nas shin tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, what is called an “illusion” is not even a slight entity, because its nature is not at all existent from the perspective of analysis.

original: da ni 'khrul pa bkag nas sems kyi yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'khrul pa bkag nas sems kyi yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of the mind’s perfect [nature] by refuting delusion, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de phyir sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Therefore, the mind’s . . .” and so on.

original: de'i phyir ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: “Therefore” refers to the previously explained [nature].

original: rang bzhin med pa'i 'khrul pa dang sems kyi rang rig tsam lhan cig gnyis su med par blta'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i 'khrul pa dang sems kyi rang rig tsam lhan cig gnyis su med par blta'o //
translated: The absence of nature and the delusion of the mind’s mere self-awareness should be seen as nondual.

original: ji ltar 'khrul pa shin tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa de bas na sems kyi de dang de gnyis su mi rigs pa'i phyir gnyis su med par blta'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul pa shin tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa de bas na sems kyi de dang de gnyis su mi rigs pa'i phyir gnyis su med par blta'o //
translated: Since delusion is not at all existent, it is non-entity. Therefore, since it is not reasonable that the mind is that [delusion], it should be seen as nondual.

original: 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems nyid gcig tu grub po //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir sems nyid gcig tu grub po //
translated: Since delusion is not observed, the mind is established as singular.

original: 'di ltar mo gsham gyi bu dang ri bong gi rva gnyis las mo gsham gyi bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir mo gsham rang nyid gcig pu kho na grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar mo gsham gyi bu dang ri bong gi rva gnyis las mo gsham gyi bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir mo gsham rang nyid gcig pu kho na grub po //
translated: Thus, since the son of a barren woman is not observed, only the barren woman herself is established as existing.

original: de ltar ri bong gi rva mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir rva dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo rvas dben pa rang nyid gcig pu grub po //
analyzed: de ltar ri bong gi rva mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir rva dang 'brel pa med pa'i ngo bo rvas dben pa rang nyid gcig pu grub po //
translated: And since the horn of a rabbit is not observed, only the rabbit itself is established as existing, which is devoid of a horn, the nature of which is not connected with a horn.

original: de bzhin du 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes pa gcig pu nyid grub po //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khrul pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes pa gcig pu nyid grub po //
translated: In the same way, only consciousness is established as existing, because error is not observed.

original: gnyis su med pa ni de'i dang tshul du lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni de'i dang tshul du lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Nonduality should be understood in the same way.

original: de ltar 'khrul pa dgag par byas nas sems kyi yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pa dgag par byas nas sems kyi yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted error, in order to teach the nature of the mind’s perfect [nature], he says,

original: dbu ma'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dbu ma'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “The middle path.”

original: de nyid du gnyis su med par bstan te /
analyzed: de nyid du gnyis su med par bstan te /
translated: It is taught to be nondual with that.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa ni dbu ma'i lam du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa ni dbu ma'i lam du shes par bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of superimposition and denial should be understood as the middle path.

original: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid yang phyi'i don gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid yang phyi'i don gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du lhag par sgro 'dogs pa ni sgro btags pa'o //
translated: Thus, the superimposition of the nature of the non-existent self as external objects, apprehended and apprehender, is reification.

original: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa khas mi len pa ni skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa khas mi len pa ni skur pa 'debs pa yin no //
translated: The denial of non-dual cognition is deprecation.

original: gang gnyis po de dag dang bral @66a * //
analyzed: gang gnyis po de dag dang bral @66a * //
translated: That which is free from those two

original: ba ni dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba ni dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the middle path.

original: de nyid gnyis su med par lta ba sems kyi gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo mthong ba ni chos nyid de chos kyi bdag nyid med pa phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su med par lta ba sems kyi gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo mthong ba ni chos nyid de chos kyi bdag nyid med pa phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The view of non-duality, the seeing of the non-dual nature of mind, is the reality, the absence of self-nature of phenomena, the meaning of which is the selflessness of phenomena such as the aggregates, sense bases, and elements.

original: de ltar yang dag tu 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag tu 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to reverse the grasping of reality,

original: phung po khams la sogs pa bstan //
analyzed: phung po khams la sogs pa bstan //
translated: the aggregates, elements, and so on are taught.

original: de yang bzlog nas skal ldan la //
analyzed: de yang bzlog nas skal ldan la //
translated: And having reversed that,

original: sems tsam du ni rnam par gzhag //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni rnam par gzhag //
translated: the fortunate are established in mind-only.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: yang dag pa dang bden pa'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang bden pa'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The limit of reality is the ultimate.

original: de bas na de la yang dag pa'i mthar zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de la yang dag pa'i mthar zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is called the limit of reality.

original: de nyid las gzhan med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid las gzhan med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is thusness because there is nothing other than that.

original: de nyid gnyis kyis stong pas na stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid gnyis kyis stong pas na stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is emptiness because it is empty of duality.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Similarly, it is sameness because of the sameness of all phenomena.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pas nges par grol ba ni grol ba yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pas nges par grol ba ni grol ba yin no //
translated: Liberation is the liberation of yogins and yoginis who possess serenity and insight.

original: de nyid rnam par rig tsam nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rig tsam nyid ni /
translated: That itself is mere representation.

original: phyi rol gyi don bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don bkag pa yin no //
translated: External objects are refuted.

original: de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ring ba dang nye ba bkag pa'i sgo nas thob pa dang mthong ba bstan  pa'i phyir /🔽chos kun nang du chud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ring ba dang nye ba bkag pa'i sgo nas thob pa dang mthong ba bstan  pa'i phyir / chos kun nang du chud pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the attainment and vision of suchness as it is in reality, through the negation of distance and proximity,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said that all phenomena are included within it.

original: gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid de bzhin nyid kyi sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid de bzhin nyid kyi sgrar brjod do //
translated: The nondual mind itself is expressed by the term suchness.

original: de gnyis kyis dben pa nyid kyis chos thams cad nang du chud pa'i phyir de'i nang du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis dben pa nyid kyis chos thams cad nang du chud pa'i phyir de'i nang du chud pa yin no //
translated: Since all things are included in the emptiness of both, they are included in that.

original: de'i phyir ring ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ring ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not far,

original: ring ba na nas par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ring ba na nas par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not far away.

original: 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i skye bo rnams kyis yongs su ma shes pa phyir thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i skye bo rnams kyis yongs su ma shes pa phyir thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it is not attained because it is not fully understood by people who are not yogis.

original: gang gi tshe dga' ba chen pos de'i zag pa rnams zad pas sangs rgyas par gyur pa de'i tshe nye ba ma yin pas nye ba'ang min no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dga' ba chen pos de'i zag pa rnams zad pas sangs rgyas par gyur pa de'i tshe nye ba ma yin pas nye ba'ang min no //
translated: When, through the destruction of the defilements by the great joy, one becomes a Buddha, then it is not near, because it is not near.

original: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo de nyid la gnyis kyi rnam par byis pa rnams 'khrul pas ngo bo dpyad par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo de nyid la gnyis kyi rnam par byis pa rnams 'khrul pas ngo bo dpyad par mi nus te /
translated: Thus, that nondual nature cannot be analyzed by fools who are confused about duality.

original: nges pa nyid du mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa nyid du mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It cannot be ascertained, that is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir 'di byis pa rnams kyis thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di byis pa rnams kyis thob par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not attained by fools, that is the meaning.

original: 'o na su zhig gis de rang gis rig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na su zhig gis de rang gis rig ce na /
translated: Well, who knows it by himself?

original: rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The term “self-awareness” is used.🔽

original: phra ba gzigs pa ni thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi spyan gyis dngos po phra ba rnams gzugs te /
analyzed: phra ba gzigs pa ni thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi spyan gyis dngos po phra ba rnams gzugs te /
translated: The phrase “the subtle vision of self-awareness” refers to the fact that the buddhas have a vision of subtle things with the eye of unobstructed gnosis.

original: de dag gis de rang gis rig pa @66b yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis de rang gis rig pa @66b yin no //
translated: That vision is self-awareness.

original: rang la gnas pa ni yang rang gi sems la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang la gnas pa ni yang rang gi sems la gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “abiding in oneself” means that it abides in one’s own mind.

original: bdag 'dra ba shes rab rtsings  pas mthong ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag 'dra ba shes rab rtsings  pas mthong ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “those like me” refers to those who, because of their coarse intelligence, do not have that vision.

original: yang ltar sangs rgyas de rnams kyis rang gis rig ce na /
analyzed: yang ltar sangs rgyas de rnams kyis rang gis rig ce na /
translated: If one asks, “Do the buddhas themselves have that vision?”

original: phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “Because it is subtle.”

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas de dag gi rang bzhin phra ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas de dag gi rang bzhin phra ba yin te /
translated: The nature of the buddhas is subtle.

original: de lta bas na phra ba nyid rang gis rig par rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na phra ba nyid rang gis rig par rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that it is self-awareness.

original: zag pa rnams zad pas gnyis su med pa de bzhin nyid shin tu phra ba nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul du gyur pas dbang po las 'das pa gzigs kyi /
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pas gnyis su med pa de bzhin nyid shin tu phra ba nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul du gyur pas dbang po las 'das pa gzigs kyi /
translated: The buddhas see the subtle suchness that is nondual because of the exhaustion of the defilements.

original: phyi rol gzigs pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gzigs pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no external object.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams thar pa thob pa dka'o snyam du brgya la sogs pa de bsal ba'i phyir nam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams thar pa thob pa dka'o snyam du brgya la sogs pa de bsal ba'i phyir nam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to dispel the thought that liberation is difficult to attain, the yogi or yoginni might think, “At some point, I will attain liberation,” the phrase “never” is stated.

original: rnal 'byor rig pas na rnal 'byor rig pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas na rnal 'byor rig pa'o //
translated: The one who is aware of yoga is the yogi or yoginni.

original: des nam yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu yang thar pa ring po na gnas par 'gyur snyam mi bsam mo //
analyzed: des nam yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu yang thar pa ring po na gnas par 'gyur snyam mi bsam mo //
translated: By that, one should never think, “At some point, in some way, liberation will be far away.”

original: 'di ltar sems de nyid kun tu brtags pa'i chos kyis dben pa ma yin pa ni 'khor ba nyid du shes la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems de nyid kun tu brtags pa'i chos kyis dben pa ma yin pa ni 'khor ba nyid du shes la /
translated: Thus, the mind itself, which is not isolated from the phenomena of imagination, is known as samsara.

original: chos de dag nyid kyis stong pa ni mya ngan las 'das par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag nyid kyis stong pa ni mya ngan las 'das par shes pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of those phenomena is known as nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir rang dngos nyid des mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang dngos nyid des mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Because of that, seeing one’s own nature is nirvana.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: sems de nyid dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i bye brag gis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par bzhag gi / de las ma gtogs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'ga' yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems de nyid dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i bye brag gis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par bzhag gi / de las ma gtogs par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa 'ga' yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is by the distinction of that very mind as being with stains and without stains that cyclic existence and nirvana are posited, but apart from that, no cyclic existence and no nirvana are observed at all.

original: 'khrul pa tha dad pa kun tu brtags pa ji srid rigs pa dang lung gis dgag par ma byas pa de srid du ;
analyzed: 'khrul pa tha dad pa kun tu brtags pa ji srid rigs pa dang lung gis dgag par ma byas pa de srid du ;
translated: As long as the various errors of imagination are not refuted by reasoning and scripture,

original: sems gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo ji ltar 'grub /
analyzed: sems gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo ji ltar 'grub /
translated: how can the nature of the nonduality of mind be established?

original: de lta bas na dang por rgya cher de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na dang por rgya cher de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that imagination in the beginning,

original: nyi chu rab rib ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyi chu rab rib ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Mirage, water, eye disease,” and so on.

original: nyi chu'i sgra ni smig rgyu'i chu la bya'o //
analyzed: nyi chu'i sgra ni smig rgyu'i chu la bya'o //
translated: The word “mirage” refers to the water of a mirage.

original: lhag ma ni khong du chud par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni khong du chud par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: nyi chu rab rib la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i dpe 'di dag gis 'khrul pa tha dad pa kun brtags pa dgag pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa sems tsam du smra ba rnams la dgos par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nyi chu rab rib la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa'i dpe 'di dag gis 'khrul pa tha dad pa kun brtags pa dgag pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa sems tsam du smra ba rnams la dgos par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: These examples of error, such as the water of a mirage, are needed for those who maintain that mind only is nondual to refute the imagined, which is the error of difference.

original: 'di ltar de'i rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the reasoning should be stated as follows:

original: snang ba tsam nyid du brtags pa'i don 'grub par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: snang ba tsam nyid du brtags pa'i don 'grub par ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to establish the existence of an object that is merely an appearance.

original: gzhan du na nyi chu rab rib la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa @67a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na nyi chu rab rib la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa @67a * //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that errors such as the water of a mirage

original: rnams yong pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams yong pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: would exist.

original: 'di ltar snang ba'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the reason for appearance is the same.

original: rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan can la bye brag cung zad mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan can la bye brag cung zad mi dmigs so //
translated: No difference whatsoever is observed in the reason for the same reason.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa la yang don du snang mod kyi de la don yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa la yang don du snang mod kyi de la don yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, although objects appear in dreams and so on, they do not exist there.

original: de lta bas na snang ba tsam gyi phyi'i don yod par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na snang ba tsam gyi phyi'i don yod par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, external objects do not exist because of mere appearance.

original: 'khrul pa gzhan kun brtags dang 'khrul pa rnams khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag gis 'khrul pa gzhan kun brtags pa ji ltar dgag par rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'khrul pa gzhan kun brtags dang 'khrul pa rnams khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag gis 'khrul pa gzhan kun brtags pa ji ltar dgag par rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since all other errors are imagined, how can it be right to refute them?

original: mo gsham gyi bus ri bong gi rva dgag par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bus ri bong gi rva dgag par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: The son of a barren woman cannot refute the horns of a rabbit.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis sems bslad pas khyad par med pa'i ngo bo mi snang gi 'on kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i khyad par du'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa'i dug gis sems bslad pas khyad par med pa'i ngo bo mi snang gi 'on kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i khyad par du'o //
translated: It is not so, because the mind is polluted by the poison of attachment to external objects, and so the undifferentiated nature does not appear, but rather the difference between entity and nonentity.

original: de'i phyir byis pa de rnams kyi dngos por 'dzin pa de dag gis sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byis pa de rnams kyi dngos por 'dzin pa de dag gis sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who grasp entities as entities refute them.

original: gal te de lta yin na des kyang sel bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na des kyang sel bar mi rigs te /
translated: If that is so, it is not right that they should refute,

original: 'khrul pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / med pa bya ba byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / med pa bya ba byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because error is non-entity and the non-existent does not appear to perform a function.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: 'di ni mthong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba kho na ste /
translated: because this is seen.

original: 'di ltar pha med pas bu shi'o zhes bya ba dang / char med pas 'bru nyams zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha med pas bu shi'o zhes bya ba dang / char med pas 'bru nyams zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, “The son died because his father died,” and “The grain was ruined because there was no rain.”🔽If objects are false, why do external objects appear to fools?

original: don rnams brdzun pa yin na byis pa rnams la ci'i phyir phyi'i don snang zhe na /
analyzed: don rnams brdzun pa yin na byis pa rnams la ci'i phyir phyi'i don snang zhe na /
translated: The mind is disturbed by the imagination of what is not real,

original: yul du kun brtags de dang des //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽de dang des ni rnam pa du ma thog ma med pa'i dus su goms pa'i yul du kun tu rtog pas gzugs la sogs pa'i kun brtags pas sems 'khrugs pas da ltar yang de'i bag chags kyi shugs te bag chags kyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yul du kun brtags de dang des // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de dang des ni rnam pa du ma thog ma med pa'i dus su goms pa'i yul du kun tu rtog pas gzugs la sogs pa'i kun brtags pas sems 'khrugs pas da ltar yang de'i bag chags kyi shugs te bag chags kyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: and the power of the latent impressions of that arises as objects.

original: rmi lam gtan pa med pa la don du snang ba de dag la skye'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gtan pa med pa la don du snang ba de dag la skye'o //
translated: The mind is disturbed by the imagination of what is not real, such as form, etc., by the imagination of the object in various ways, by the various imaginations, since beginningless time. The power of the latent impressions of that, i.e., the latent impressions of the imagination of what is not real, arises as objects, i.e., as the appearances of objects, in dreams, which are without basis.

original: yang ci nyin par sad pa'i gnas skabs na skye ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: yang ci nyin par sad pa'i gnas skabs na skye ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to speak of their arising in the waking state?

original: de lta bas na de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mi bzad pa yi bag chags dug / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi bzad pa yi bag chags dug / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The poison of the latent impressions is hard to bear.

original: 'di ltar dug zin pa 'ga' zhig la ser po'i dngos po med kyang ser po'i dngos por snang ba skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dug zin pa 'ga' zhig la ser po'i dngos po med kyang ser po'i dngos por snang ba skye'o //
translated: Thus, for some who are poisoned, yellow things arise as appearances of yellow things, even though yellow things do not exist.

original: de bzhin du bag chags kyi dug gis zin pas phyi'i don med kyang der snang ba skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bag chags kyi dug gis zin pas phyi'i don med kyang der snang ba skye ba nyid do //
translated: In the same way, for those who are poisoned by the poison of the latent impressions, external things do not exist, but they arise as appearances of those.

original: 'on kyang 'di tsam gyi khyad par yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di tsam gyi khyad par yod de /
translated: However, there is this much difference.

original: dug gis zin pa ni sngags la sogs pas dug zhig par nus kyi /
analyzed: dug gis zin pa ni sngags la sogs pas dug zhig par nus kyi /
translated: Those who are poisoned by poison can be cured by mantras and so on.

original: @67b lam sgom pa la mi phyogs pas ni bag chags kyi dug zhi bar mi nus so //
analyzed: @67b lam sgom pa la mi phyogs pas ni bag chags kyi dug zhi bar mi nus so //
translated: But those who are not inclined to meditate on the path cannot be cured of the poison of the latent impressions.

original: de lta bas na dug snga ma las dug 'di ni mi bzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dug snga ma las dug 'di ni mi bzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this poison is more intense than the former poison.

original: da ni phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa rnams ni shes par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa rnams ni shes par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the object for those who are attached to external objects, he says:

original: ae ma'o brdzun pa'i rnam rtog gi //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ae ma'o brdzun pa'i rnam rtog gi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Amazing! The false imagination🔽Of the world arises from the latent impressions.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: Amazing! means “astonishing!”

original: brdzun ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: False means the appearance of the imagination of form and so on.

original: rgyun ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: Stream means engagement.

original: stug po ni mthug po nyid do //
analyzed: stug po ni mthug po nyid do //
translated: “Dense” means thick.

original: gang gi phyir de'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems can rnams la /
translated: Because of that, for sentient beings who are under its influence,

original: rmi lam las kyang rmi lam gzhan gyi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam las kyang rmi lam gzhan gyi rtog pa ste /
translated: dreams within a dream are conceptual.

original: mi shes pa gnyid kyis log pa'i 'jig rten rnams la med pa'i don snang ba nyid ni rmi lam yin par grag go //
analyzed: mi shes pa gnyid kyis log pa'i 'jig rten rnams la med pa'i don snang ba nyid ni rmi lam yin par grag go //
translated: The appearance of objects that do not exist for worldly people who are asleep in the sleep of ignorance is said to be a dream.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas pa de la yang rmi lam gzhan gyi rtog pa gang brten pa de rnams ni shin tu mi brtan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas pa de la yang rmi lam gzhan gyi rtog pa gang brten pa de rnams ni shin tu mi brtan pa nyid do //
translated: Even in that state of dreaming, other dreams that are based on conceptual thoughts are extremely unstable.

original: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this example,

original: chu bur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chu bur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says “blisters” and so on.

original: 'di ltar chu bur gyi steng du chu bur gnyis bas gnod pa'i bdag nyid can de bzhin du rmi lam gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar chu bur gyi steng du chu bur gnyis bas gnod pa'i bdag nyid can de bzhin du rmi lam gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as blisters on blisters are by nature harmful, so it is with other dreams. This is the meaning.

original: rmi lam snga ma med na rmi lam phyi ma ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam snga ma med na rmi lam phyi ma ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the previous dream does not exist, how can the subsequent dream be established?

original: gang gi phyir rmi lam lta bu'i rmi lam mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rmi lam lta bu'i rmi lam mo //
translated: Because it is like a dream within a dream.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: don med pa snang ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa snang ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is like the appearance of what is nonexistent.

original: 'dra ba yang gnyis la gnas par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba yang gnyis la gnas par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: And the similarity would be based on two things,

original: ba lang dang ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang dang ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: like a cow and a horse.

original: des kyang rmi lam gzhan med pas 'dra ba med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i dngos po mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des kyang rmi lam gzhan med pas 'dra ba med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i dngos po mi 'grub po //
translated: And because of the nonexistence of another dream, the similarity does not exist. Therefore the desired object is not established.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Thus the Lord has said:

original: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu yin gyi rmi lam ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu yin gyi rmi lam ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: “All things are like a dream, but they are not a dream.”

original: de bas na dgongs pa ni 'dir 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dgongs pa ni 'dir 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the intended meaning here:

original: gang gis dpe nyid du rmi lam bstan pa de dag gi gzhung mi 'dod pa 'grub pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis dpe nyid du rmi lam bstan pa de dag gi gzhung mi 'dod pa 'grub pa med do //
translated: Those who teach a dream as an example do not establish the nonexistence of the scriptures.

original: yang gang dag phyi'i don bzhin du rmi lam du mthong ba'i don yang yod pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag la rmi lam gzhan gyis gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gang dag phyi'i don bzhin du rmi lam du mthong ba'i don yang yod pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag la rmi lam gzhan gyis gnod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, those who assert that the object seen in a dream exists like an external object are harmed by another dream,

original: chu bur gyi steng du chu bur bzhin no ;
analyzed: chu bur gyi steng du chu bur bzhin no ;
translated: like a water bubble on top of a water bubble.

original: / de ltar yang slob dpon gyis //
analyzed: / de ltar yang slob dpon gyis //
translated: Thus the Master has said:

original: rmi lam du mthong yod yin la //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong yod yin la //
translated: “The existence seen in a dream

original: dngos po bzung ba'i stobs yin na //
analyzed: dngos po bzung ba'i stobs yin na //
translated: If it is the power of the object that is grasped,

original: gzhon nu ma sbrum bu thob pa //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma sbrum bu thob pa //
translated: then a virgin would give birth to a child,🔽because of the appearance of the child.

original: snang phyir 'di ni mi rigs so //🔽zhes byis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang phyir 'di ni mi rigs so // zhes byis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: byis pa rnams la med bzhin du snang ba skye ba ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽yang dag @68a * //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la med bzhin du snang ba skye ba ci'i phyir zhe na / yang dag @68a * //
translated: Why is it that the appearance of the non-existent arises for the childish?

original: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, “due to the power of unreal imagination.”

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis de dag la med pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis de dag la med pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to the power of ignorance, the non-existent appears to them.

original: yang dag pa ni yang gnyis med pa'i don dam pa bsgribs nas gnas te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni yang gnyis med pa'i don dam pa bsgribs nas gnas te /
translated: The real is obscured and remains covered,

original: de 'gebs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'gebs par byed pa yin no //
translated: because it is covered.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don bskyed pa nyid ni brdzun pa nyid de snang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don bskyed pa nyid ni brdzun pa nyid de snang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, ignorance, which produces the unreal object, is itself false, and it is what causes the appearance.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?
