original: mig ser zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mig ser zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “like a jaundiced person.”

original: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pas dung dkar po la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ser po'i dngos po nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pas dung dkar po la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ser po'i dngos po nyid du snang ngo //
translated: For example, a person with jaundice sees a white conch as having the nature of an unreal object, namely, yellow.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rgyus 'di yin gyi phyi'i don ni med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rgyus 'di yin gyi phyi'i don ni med do //
translated: In the same way, there is no external object that is the cause of ignorance.

original: phyi'i don tha dad pa med kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis sems nyid don gyi rnam par snang ba zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa pa smra bas /
analyzed: phyi'i don tha dad pa med kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis sems nyid don gyi rnam par snang ba zhes rnal 'byor spyod pa pa smra bas /
translated: The Yogācāra say that external objects do not exist separately, but the mind itself appears in the aspect of an object due to the power of habitual tendencies.

original: de bas na de'i gzhung gis dogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de'i gzhung gis dogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to summarize the doubts of their system,

original: tha dad min pa'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad min pa'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Nor is it non-different,” and so on.

original: tha dad min pa'ang ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo'i yang sems bag chags kyi dbang gis tha dad de /
analyzed: tha dad min pa'ang ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo'i yang sems bag chags kyi dbang gis tha dad de /
translated: Nor is it non-different, because the mind, which is of an undifferentiated nature, appears as different due to the power of habitual tendencies.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag tu gsal bar snang ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag tu gsal bar snang ngo //
translated: It appears clearly as the distinction between object and subject.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol min pa'ang phyi'i dngos po nyid rnam pa du ma sngon po'i ngo bo la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dri mas bsgribs par snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol min pa'ang phyi'i dngos po nyid rnam pa du ma sngon po'i ngo bo la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dri mas bsgribs par snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, nor is it non-external, because external things themselves appear as various aspects, obscured by the stains of aspects such as the nature of blue. This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas sems gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas sems gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the nature of mind is twofold, in terms of the division between the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: phyi'i don mngon sum du dmigs pa ji ltar med pa bzhin du gnas ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi'i don mngon sum du dmigs pa ji ltar med pa bzhin du gnas ma yin nam /
translated: How is it that the direct perception of external objects does not exist, as it were?

original: gang gi phyir nyi ma la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa 'di ji ltar de dag med pa yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyi ma la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa 'di ji ltar de dag med pa yin snyam pa la /
translated: Since the direct perception of external things such as the sun does exist, how can they be nonexistent?

original: nyi ma zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states: The sun, the moon, the stars, the planets, the mountains, the oceans, the continents, the houses,

original: nyi ma la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po ni ma yin te /
translated: The sun and so forth are not external things.

original: 'on kyang 'di dag sems kyi sprul pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems nyid de'i rnam par snang gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag sems kyi sprul pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems nyid de'i rnam par snang gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Rather, they are emanations of the mind, because the mind itself appears in that form, not as external objects.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Not only the sun and so forth,

original: khams gsum po 'di dag par ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ; gzugs med pa'i khams gsum ni khams gsum po'o //
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di dag par ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ; gzugs med pa'i khams gsum ni khams gsum po'o //
translated: but also the three realms, the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm,🔽are not external things.

original: de dag gi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the extent of those three realms?

original: srid pa'i rtse mos zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mos zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text says, “up to the peak of existence.”

original: srid pa'i rtse mos yongs su gcad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mos yongs su gcad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The peak of existence is the highest level of the three realms.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what it says.

original: 'du shes yod min med min gyi bar 'di dag thams cad sems can dang @68b sems can ma yin pa'i grangs ji ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'du shes yod min med min gyi bar 'di dag thams cad sems can dang @68b sems can ma yin pa'i grangs ji ltar snang ba ste /
translated: All of these, up to the level where there is neither conception nor non-conception, appear to be sentient and non-sentient beings.

original: dmigs pa 'di thams cad /
analyzed: dmigs pa 'di thams cad /
translated: All of these objects

original: rnam shes dug gi thig le yin //
analyzed: rnam shes dug gi thig le yin //
translated: are the poison-like drops of consciousness.

original: thig le dang 'dra bar khyab ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: thig le dang 'dra bar khyab ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “pervading like drops” is that they are like drops.

original: dug gi sgra smos pa ni slob dpon rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung mi bzhed par zur gyis ston pa'i don to //🔽da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa la spyi'i don du smra bas /
analyzed: dug gi sgra smos pa ni slob dpon rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung mi bzhed par zur gyis ston pa'i don to // da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa la spyi'i don du smra bas /
translated: The word “poison” is used to indirectly indicate that the master does not accept the Yogācāra scriptures.

original: gal te snang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gal te snang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Now, the Yogācāra who advocates the general meaning says, “If it appears . . .”

original: gal te rnam par shes pa nyid la don gyi rnam pa snang bar khas len na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa nyid la don gyi rnam pa snang bar khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the aspect of an object appears to consciousness,

original: phyi'i don med do zhes de ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: phyi'i don med do zhes de ji ltar rtogs /
translated: how do you know that there are no external objects?

original: ji srid phyi'i don gyi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa ma bskyed pa de srid de'i rnam pa ji ltar snang /
analyzed: ji srid phyi'i don gyi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa ma bskyed pa de srid de'i rnam pa ji ltar snang /
translated: As long as the consciousness of an external object does not generate a form, how could the form appear?

original: rnam pa ma bskyed par de'i rnam pa nyid mi rigs kyi gang gi tshe yang don nye ba na gnas pa de'i rnam pa nyid rnam par shes pa la 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam pa ma bskyed par de'i rnam pa nyid mi rigs kyi gang gi tshe yang don nye ba na gnas pa de'i rnam pa nyid rnam par shes pa la 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: If the form is not generated, it is not reasonable that it is the form itself. But when the form itself arises in consciousness, then external objects are established as existing.

original: phyi'i don yod pa nyid du grub po zhes zer zhes grag go //
analyzed: phyi'i don yod pa nyid du grub po zhes zer zhes grag go //
translated: This is what is widely believed.

original: gzhan du don la ltos pa med par gal te don gyi rnam pa 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan du don la ltos pa med par gal te don gyi rnam pa 'byung ba'am /
translated: Otherwise, if the form of an object arises or does not arise without depending on an external object,

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be the form of an external object.

original: de lta bu sems la bsdogs nas gal te phyi'i don snang na ji ltar med de /
analyzed: de lta bu sems la bsdogs nas gal te phyi'i don snang na ji ltar med de /
translated: If the form of an external object appears to the mind, how could it be nonexistent?

original: ci ltar med pa nyid de rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ltar med pa nyid de rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be understood to be nonexistent?

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the horns of a rabbit and so on do not appear.

original: snang ba yang yod pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: snang ba yang yod pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Appearance is necessarily existent.

original: med pa'i bdag nyid snang bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: med pa'i bdag nyid snang bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the nature of a nonexistent appears.

original: de ltar phyi'i don du smra ba rgol ba la rnal 'byor spyod pa la lan 'debs te /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i don du smra ba rgol ba la rnal 'byor spyod pa la lan 'debs te /
translated: Thus, the Yogācāra respond to the opponent who advocates external objects.

original: snang ba'i phyir don yod pa nyid snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir don yod pa nyid snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: An object does not exist because it appears,

original: de ni ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not ascertained.🔽In this way,

original: 'di ltar / ci ga rmi lam mi snang ngam //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ci ga rmi lam mi snang ngam //
translated: Do you not see dreams?

original: don du snang mod kyi de las yang don yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: don du snang mod kyi de las yang don yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: Although objects appear, they do not exist as objects.

original: med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “do not exist” is that they do not exist as objects.

original: don nye bar gnas pas don gyi rnam pa rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don nye bar gnas pas don gyi rnam pa rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: A consciousness does not arise in the aspect of an object because an object is present.

original: 'di ltar rab rib dang ldan pas don med kyang skra shad kyi rnam pa rnam par shes pa la 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rab rib dang ldan pas don med kyang skra shad kyi rnam pa rnam par shes pa la 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: In this way, although a nonexistent hair appears in the consciousness of a hair to one who has eye disease,

original: de lta bas na bag chags kyi mthus rnam par shes pa la don gyi rnam pa snang gi phyi'i don yod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bag chags kyi mthus rnam par shes pa la don gyi rnam pa snang gi phyi'i don yod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of an object appears in consciousness through the power of habitual tendencies, not because an external object exists.

original: yang ji ltar sems gzhan gyi ngo bor snang zhe na /🔽lhag pa'i dri ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sems gzhan gyi ngo bor snang zhe na /🔽lhag pa'i dri ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, how does the aspect of another mind appear?🔽He says, “The appearance of another’s mind is like the appearance of an object.”

original: gang gi phyir bag chags kyi mthus lhag pa'i dri mas blo rtogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bsgribs par gyur pas de'i phyir @69a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bag chags kyi mthus lhag pa'i dri mas blo rtogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bsgribs par gyur pas de'i phyir @69a * //
translated: Because the mind is obscured by the power of the latent impressions of the adventitious defilements, which are of the nature of the mind itself,

original: blo gzhan gyi ngo bor snang ba yin no //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyi ngo bor snang ba yin no //
translated: therefore, it appears as the nature of something else.

original: blo'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: blo'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The word “mind” is a synonym for consciousness.

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa nyid snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa nyid snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, consciousness itself is what appears.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: shel dang 'dra ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shel dang 'dra ba yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “like a crystal.”

original: ji ltar na nor bu shel lhag pa'i dri mas rang gi ngo bo bsgribs gzhan gyi ngo bor snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar na nor bu shel lhag pa'i dri mas rang gi ngo bo bsgribs gzhan gyi ngo bor snang ngo //
translated: Just as a crystal is obscured by the adventitious defilements, which are of the nature of the crystal itself, and appears as the nature of something else,

original: rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: so it is with consciousness. This is the meaning.

original: lhag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis nor bu shel gzhan gyi dngos por snang ba mngon sum gyis dmigs na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ma dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar /
analyzed: lhag pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis nor bu shel gzhan gyi dngos por snang ba mngon sum gyis dmigs na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ma dmigs pa'i phyir ji ltar /
translated: Even though the appearance of the crystal as something else is perceived by direct perception because of the adventitious cause, how is it that the cause of consciousness is not perceived?

original: gzhan gyi dngos por snang zhes bya //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por snang zhes bya //
translated: How is it that it appears as something else?

original: rang bzhin nyid ni mi snang ba //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni mi snang ba // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The nature itself does not appear.🔽Here, the nature itself does not appear because of the generality of the conceptualization of form, etc.

original: gal te yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spyi nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin nyid ni mi snang ba'ang de dag kyang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bag chags bsgos pa dang 'dra bas bstsags thob pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo lta bu thob cing de rnam par rtog pa la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spyi nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin nyid ni mi snang ba'ang de dag kyang bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i bag chags bsgos pa dang 'dra bas bstsags thob pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo lta bu thob cing de rnam par rtog pa la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: But they are like the acquisition of the essential nature of the accumulation of the latent impressions of merit, demerit, and immobility.

original: mthong ba'i spyod yul nyid thob pa lta bu mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i spyod yul nyid thob pa lta bu mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic is like the acquisition of the domain of seeing.

original: de bas na sems gzhan gyi ngo bo thob pa ni bag chags kyi rgyu mtshan yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na sems gzhan gyi ngo bo thob pa ni bag chags kyi rgyu mtshan yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the acquisition of the nature of another mind is the causal sign of the latent impressions.

original: sems gcig ji ltar gnyis su snang ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems gcig ji ltar gnyis su snang ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can one mind appear as two?

original: sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The mind,” etc.

original: gal te yang sems gcig nyid de bzhin du yang rnam par blang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te yang sems gcig nyid de bzhin du yang rnam par blang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Even though it is one mind, it appears as two because of the acquisition of that nature.

original: rnam par 'khrul pas so //
analyzed: rnam par 'khrul pas so //
translated: Because of error.

original: yang bag chags dang thabs la mkhas pa 'ga' zhig gis gzung ba'i cha dang 'dzin pa'i cha'i dbye bas gnyis su snang ba ni gnyis su dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang bag chags dang thabs la mkhas pa 'ga' zhig gis gzung ba'i cha dang 'dzin pa'i cha'i dbye bas gnyis su snang ba ni gnyis su dmigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the appearance of duality due to the differentiation of the apprehended aspect and the apprehending aspect, by some habitual tendencies and skill in means, is the meaning of the apprehension of duality.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo mi shes pa de bas na de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo mi shes pa de bas na de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since one does not know the nature of the apprehended and apprehender, in order to teach their characteristics,

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The aspect of the apprehended,” and so on.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa mi g-yo ba'i phyir ni 'gul ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa mi g-yo ba'i phyir ni 'gul ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the aspect of the apprehended is unmoving, it is motionless.

original: phyi rol lta bu nyid du gnas pa ni phyi rol lta bur snang ba'o /
analyzed: phyi rol lta bu nyid du gnas pa ni phyi rol lta bur snang ba'o /
translated: The appearance as external is the appearance as if external.🔽The apprehender is also moving because it has life, it is moving because it has activity.

original: 'dzin pa'ang srog dang bcas pa'i phyir ni g-yo bar bcas pa'i phyir nang ni de bya ba dang bcas pa lta bur mtshon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'ang srog dang bcas pa'i phyir ni g-yo bar bcas pa'i phyir nang ni de bya ba dang bcas pa lta bur mtshon zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “the internal is indicated as if it has activity.”

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: @69b don ni gzung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: @69b don ni gzung ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the consciousness of the apprehended is the apprehender.

original: da ni slob dpon gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dgag pa sngon du 'gro bas phyi'i don du smra ba'i gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dgag pa sngon du 'gro bas phyi'i don du smra ba'i gzhung dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, the master [Nāgārjuna] refutes the texts of the proponents of external objects by first refuting the nature of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: 'dir ni phyi nang cung zad med //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir ni phyi nang cung zad med // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, there is not the slightest external or internal.

original: 'dir ni cung zad de phyi'i gzung ba'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa dang / nang gi 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni cung zad de phyi'i gzung ba'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa dang / nang gi 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yang ma yin no //
translated: Here, there is not the slightest external nature of the apprehended nor is there an internal nature of the apprehender.

original: rig pa po ma gtogs par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: rig pa po ma gtogs par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo gzhan ni med do //
translated: Apart from the knower, there is no other nature of the apprehended or apprehender.

original: de yang gnyi ga skad cig gcig la skye ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang gnyi ga skad cig gcig la skye ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: Moreover, it is illogical for both to arise in a single moment.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med na gzhan gyis //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang / de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med na gzhan gyis //
translated: If there is no connection of identity or origination, they are not related.

original: gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not related as possessor and possessed.

original: 'dzin pa ni gzung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni gzung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The apprehender does not have the nature of the apprehended,

original: tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are accepted as different.

original: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they originate from that,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise simultaneously.

original: gang gi phyir de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba nyid yin na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba nyid yin na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'grub bo //
translated: Because it is of that nature, it arises from that, and so is established as the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gcig la gcig ltos pas grub pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la gcig ltos pas grub pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, because they are established in mutual dependence.

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba ni kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir brtag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba ni kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir brtag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Because the apprehended object is non-existent by nature, since it is imagined.

original: de bas na ci zhig la ltos nas rnam par shes pa la 'dzin pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de bas na ci zhig la ltos nas rnam par shes pa la 'dzin pa zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on what is consciousness called the apprehending subject?

original: bar na ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bar na ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “It is not in between,”

original: dbang po dang yul gyi bar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyi bar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang med do //
translated: because there is not the slightest nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject in between the sense faculty and the object.

original: gzung ba log na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa nges par mi ldog go //
analyzed: gzung ba log na de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i 'dzin pa nges par mi ldog go //
translated: When the apprehended object is refuted, the apprehending subject, which is not its nature and is not its effect, is certainly refuted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir med min zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir med min zhes gsungs te /
translated: For this very reason, he says, “It is not non-existent,”

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis rnal ma'i don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis rnal ma'i don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: because the two negations express the meaning of reality.

original: des na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo las 'dzin pa med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo las 'dzin pa med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not that there is no consciousness that is the nature of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: 'on kyang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa nyid do //
translated: However, it does exist.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis sems la rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa gang smra ba de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis sems la rnam pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa gang smra ba de yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical for Yogācāras to say that the nature of aspects appears to the mind due to the power of ignorance.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa med pa ni rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid yin pas de dang 'brel pa med pa'i brdzun pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de la ji ltar snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa med pa ni rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid yin pas de dang 'brel pa med pa'i brdzun pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de la ji ltar snang bar 'gyur /
translated: Because the absence of aspects is the suchness of consciousness, how could that which is unrelated to it and has a false nature appear?

original: rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'brel pa med na gang zhig de'i stobs kyis rnam pa nyams su myong bar 'grub par 'gyur ba /🔽'di ltar rnam pa ni shes @70a * //
analyzed: rnam pa dang rnam par shes pa lhan cig 'brel pa med na gang zhig de'i stobs kyis rnam pa nyams su myong bar 'grub par 'gyur ba / 'di ltar rnam pa ni shes @70a * //
translated: If aspects and consciousness are not related, how could the experience of aspects be established by its power?

original: pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: In this way, aspects are not the nature of consciousness,

original: shes pa bzhin du yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that they would exist like consciousness.

original: 'on te shes pa'i rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin par 'dod na de'i tshe rnam pa bzhin du shes pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i rnam par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin par 'dod na de'i tshe rnam pa bzhin du shes pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you maintain that it is the nature of the cognition of the image, then it follows that, like the image, the cognition does not exist.

original: shes par rnam pa bskyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes par rnam pa bskyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the image produces the cognition,

original: gzugs med pas gzugs can bskyed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pas gzugs can bskyed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the formless cannot produce the form.

original: rnam pa las shes pa 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa las shes pa 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the cognition arise from the image,

original: rnam pa brdzun pa nyid kyis don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa brdzun pa nyid kyis don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the false image is devoid of the capacity to perform a function.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa ma gtogs pas 'brel pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa ma gtogs pas 'brel pa gzhan med do //
translated: Apart from the relation of identity and the relation of origination, there is no other relation.

original: yang de lta bas na gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa med pa de yang dag par rig de nges par mi rtogs te /
analyzed: yang de lta bas na gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa med pa de yang dag par rig de nges par mi rtogs te /
translated: And that which is not related to something else is not apprehended by the cognition of that thing,

original: 'di ltar shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: just as the son of a barren woman is not.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis po rnam par shes pa dang ; mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par bcas pa yang med pa ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis po rnam par shes pa dang ; mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par bcas pa yang med pa ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The two kinds of relations, the relation of identity and the relation of origination, do not exist, and the relation of the possessor of the form of the desired cognition does not exist. This is not a case of non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: de lta bas na kun brtags pa spangs pa'i phyir sems gnyis su med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun brtags pa spangs pa'i phyir sems gnyis su med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon the imagined, the non-duality of mind is established.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: sems tsam du ni gnas phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni gnas phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because of the existence of mind-only.

original: rtog pa'i dra bas thams cad spangs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i shes pa rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa shes pa nyid thar pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra bas thams cad spangs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i shes pa rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyi phyir gnyis su med pa shes pa nyid thar pa yin no //
translated: Because of the establishment of non-dual cognition, which is free from the net of conceptual thoughts, therefore, non-dual cognition itself is liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa thar pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa thar pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't liberation the abandonment of attachment and so forth through the cultivation of the four noble truths?

original: kun tu brtags pa'i 'khrul pa dang bral ba'i sems nyid ji ltar thar pa yin /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i 'khrul pa dang bral ba'i sems nyid ji ltar thar pa yin /
translated: How is the mind itself, which is free from the error of imagination, liberation?

original: 'di ni nyan thos kyi gzhung gi dogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos kyi gzhung gi dogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: This is said in order to collect the doubts of the śrāvaka texts.

original: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “ Attachment” and so on are mentioned.

original: la'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “la” has the meaning of “because.”

original: grong gi sgra ni tshogs kyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: grong gi sgra ni tshogs kyi rnam grangs so //
translated: The word “village” is a synonym for “collection.”

original: de la dbang po'i tshogs ni 'dod chags kyi gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dbang po'i tshogs ni 'dod chags kyi gnas ma yin te /
translated: Among them, the collection of faculties is not the abode of attachment.

original: de bas na dbang po rnams la mi gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po rnams la mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it does not reside in the faculties.

original: don rnams la min te /
analyzed: don rnams la min te /
translated: It is not in the objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ma yin no //
translated: It is not in form and so on.

original: sems la min te /
analyzed: sems la min te /
translated: It is not in the mind.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not in the six collections of consciousness.

original: bdag la gnas min gzhan gnas min //
analyzed: bdag la gnas min gzhan gnas min //
translated: It does not reside in the self, nor does it reside in another.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said.

original: bdag tshad mas @70b ma grub pa'i phyir bdag la mi gnas so //
analyzed: bdag tshad mas @70b ma grub pa'i phyir bdag la mi gnas so //
translated: Because the self is not established by valid knowledge, it does not reside in the self.

original: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes la /
analyzed: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes la /
translated: When the self is known, the other is known.

original: gang gi tshe bdag ma grub pa de'i tshe gzhan med pa'i phyir gzhan la mi gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag ma grub pa de'i tshe gzhan med pa'i phyir gzhan la mi gnas so //
translated: But when the self is not established, since the other does not exist, it does not reside in the other.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te yod pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te yod pa mi dmigs so //
translated: That does not exist, because existence is not observed.

original: gzhan du na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be completely apprehended by direct perception, like form and so on.

original: med pa'ang min ni sems las byung ba'i ngo bor kha cig gis brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'ang min ni sems las byung ba'i ngo bor kha cig gis brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because some imagine it to be the nature of mental factors.

original: 'o na sems can rnams la rgyu med par ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems can rnams la rgyu med par ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: If so, how do sentient beings arise without a cause?

original: ma brtags 'brel ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma brtags 'brel ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “From an unanalyzed connection,” and so on.

original: phyi rol med pa'i phyir yul rnams sgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol med pa'i phyir yul rnams sgyu ma yin te /
translated: Since external objects do not exist, objects are like illusions.

original: de bas na de'i dag las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i dag las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not arise from them.

original: kha cig sems 'khrul pa las yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig sems 'khrul pa las yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say that they arise from a confused mind.

original: de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: That is not so, because it is not a thing.

original: de bas na ma brtags pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu las 'dod chags 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na ma brtags pa'i 'brel pa'i rgyu las 'dod chags 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, attachment arises from an unanalyzed connected cause.

original: ga la yi yang ni bstan du med cing mi snang ba'i sprin gyi nang nas gnam lcags bzhin ni thog 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ga la yi yang ni bstan du med cing mi snang ba'i sprin gyi nang nas gnam lcags bzhin ni thog 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a lightning bolt that appears in the sky from a cloud that is invisible and unobservable.

original: de bas na de brtags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de brtags pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is just an imputation.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa gzhan yang dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa gzhan yang dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, in order to demonstrate that the other afflictions are also unreal, he says:

original: de bzhin zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: So too, hatred, etc.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dngos po med pa nyid du bstan pa de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gnyis kyang dngos po med pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dngos po med pa nyid du bstan pa de bzhin du zhe sdang dang gti mug gnyis kyang dngos po med pa nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Just as attachment is demonstrated to be unreal, so too hatred and delusion should be understood to be unreal.

original: de ltar 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: So too, not only attachment, hatred, and delusion,

original: nyon mongs pa'i rigs gzhan gang yin pa yang ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rigs gzhan gang yin pa yang ste /
translated: but also any other type of affliction,

original: nga rgyal dang lta ba dang the tshom la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang lta ba dang the tshom la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as pride, false views, and doubt.

original: khams gsum du ni khyab byed pa ni /
analyzed: khams gsum du ni khyab byed pa ni /
translated: They pervade the three realms,

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su khyab pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su khyab pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: de dag ni rtog pa'i dug las byung bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rtog pa'i dug las byung bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood to arise from the poison of conceptual thought,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo la ni ma yin no //
translated: not from the nature of things.

original: yang nyan thos pa 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: yang nyan thos pa 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: The Sravakas say this:

original: rtog pa yang ni zhe sdang la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang ni zhe sdang la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Conceptualization” refers to anger, etc.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa rtog pa las byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa rtog pa las byung ba yin na /
translated: If desire, etc., arise from conceptualization,

original: de lta na yang rtog pa ni de kho na nyid du gzhi med par mi srid de /
analyzed: de lta na yang rtog pa ni de kho na nyid du gzhi med par mi srid de /
translated: then conceptualization is not possible without a basis in reality.

original: me lce 'bar ba ni bud shing med par 'ga' zhig gis nam mkha' la mched par mthong ba med do //
analyzed: me lce 'bar ba ni bud shing med par 'ga' zhig gis nam mkha' la mched par mthong ba med do //
translated: No one ever sees a blazing flame without fuel in the sky.

original: de'i gzhi ni sems nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni sems nyid do //
translated: Its basis is the mind itself.

original: de lta bas na yang de sems dang 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las kun tu 'byung ba yin te /🔽de dag ji ltar @71a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang de sems dang 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las kun tu 'byung ba yin te / de dag ji ltar @71a * //
translated: Therefore, desire, etc., arise from the mind because they are connected with the mind.

original: rgyu med par 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: rgyu med par 'byung ba yin /
translated: How could they arise without a cause?

original: gal te rgyu las skye ba nyid kyang dngos po med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu las skye ba nyid kyang dngos po med pa yin na /
translated: If arising from a cause is itself unreal,

original: rgyu dang bcas pa de dag thams cad dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa de dag thams cad dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then all things that have a cause would be unreal.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dngos po nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dngos po nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, desire, etc., are established as real things.

original: yang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir de spangs pas thar pa yang grub bo //
analyzed: yang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir de spangs pas thar pa yang grub bo //
translated: And, since they are real entities, liberation is achieved by abandoning them.

original: don de lta bu ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don de lta bu ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: But this meaning is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po yod pa gnyis la rten dang brtan pa'i ngo bor rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po yod pa gnyis la rten dang brtan pa'i ngo bor rigs so //
translated: For it is reasonable that two real entities are the basis and the based.

original: gzhan du na ri bong yang rva'i rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ri bong yang rva'i rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even a rabbit’s horns would be the basis of a horn.

original: me lce dang bud shing gnyi ga yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me lce dang bud shing gnyi ga yang dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both a flame and fuel are real entities.

original: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dngos po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dngos po nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, attachment and so on are not real entities.

original: yang de dag 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: yang de dag 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: Again, they say this:

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dngos po med par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dngos po med par gyur pa yin na /
translated: If attachment and so on are not real entities,

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag gi gnyen po ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag gi gnyen po ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: how does the Bhagavān teach their antidotes?

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He mentions repulsiveness and so on.

original: thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa sgom pa la sogs pa 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa gang gsungs pa de dag tu zin dogs pa zhi ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mi sdug pa sgom pa la sogs pa 'dod chags pa'i gnyen por gyur pa gang gsungs pa de dag tu zin dogs pa zhi ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The Lord of Sages, the Buddha, the Blessed One, taught the meditation on foulness and so on as antidotes to attachment.

original: yang dngos po la gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no //🔽'di ltar dper 'ga' zhig dug gis zin pa'i dogs pa'i dug gis khyab pa dogs pa'i dug la mkhas pa 'ga' zhig gis brdzun gyi sngags bzlas pas dogs pa'i dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dngos po la gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no // 'di ltar dper 'ga' zhig dug gis zin pa'i dogs pa'i dug gis khyab pa dogs pa'i dug la mkhas pa 'ga' zhig gis brdzun gyi sngags bzlas pas dogs pa'i dug zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But he did not teach that they are real.🔽For example, when someone is bitten by a poisonous snake, the poison spreads throughout the body.

original: de bzhin du bud med nyid 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de lta bu'i dug gis yongs su zin pa'i byis pa gang yin pa de dag la mi sdug pa'i sgom pa gnyen por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med nyid 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa de lta bu'i dug gis yongs su zin pa'i byis pa gang yin pa de dag la mi sdug pa'i sgom pa gnyen por bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the meditation on foulness is taught as an antidote for the poison of attachment that spreads throughout the body of a child who is bitten by the poison of the idea that women are the cause of attachment.

original: yang bud med rnams 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang bud med rnams 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But women are not the cause of attachment.

original: gzhan du na bud med mthong ba de dag thams cad 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bud med mthong ba de dag thams cad 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, all those who see women would generate attachment.

original: de lta bas na 'ga' yang 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'ga' yang 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, no one would become free from attachment.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As is said:🔽The lustful are like dogs,

original: kun rgyu 'dod can khyi rnams ni //
analyzed: kun rgyu 'dod can khyi rnams ni //
translated: who,🔽licking their own genitals,

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: are not satisfied.

original: /'di nyid la rig pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir kun da zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: /'di nyid la rig pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir kun da zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach another example, he says “like a jasmine flower,” etc.

original: gang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin de'i dpe ni kun da dang / zla ba dang / padma la sogs pa med pa la gang gis 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir so dang / bzhin dang / mig gi dper sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin de'i dpe ni kun da dang / zla ba dang / padma la sogs pa med pa la gang gis 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir so dang / bzhin dang / mig gi dper sbyar ro //
translated: The example of the nature of non-entity is like a jasmine flower, moon, lotus, etc., which are non-existent, but which are applied as examples of teeth, face, and eyes, because attachment is generated toward them.

original: 'dod @71b chags dang bral ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod @71b chags dang bral ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate freedom from attachment,

original: bshad pa la sogs pa'i dpe sbyar ba lus kyi dper mi rung ste /
analyzed: bshad pa la sogs pa'i dpe sbyar ba lus kyi dper mi rung ste /
translated: the examples of explanation, etc., are applied. The body is not a suitable example,

original: gang gi phyir sad pa'i skabs kyi bud med kyi lus rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sad pa'i skabs kyi bud med kyi lus rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: because the body of a woman in the waking state should be understood to be like the body in the dream state.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi skabs brdzun pa de ltar sad pa'i skabs kyang brdzun par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi skabs brdzun pa de ltar sad pa'i skabs kyang brdzun par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as it is false in the dream state, so it is false in the waking state.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rgyu mtshan med par mthong bas rnal 'byor pas yul 'ga' la yang chags par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rgyu mtshan med par mthong bas rnal 'byor pas yul 'ga' la yang chags par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, since one sees that attachment and nonattachment are groundless, the yogi should not be attached to any object whatsoever,

original: 'dod chags dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Attachment and nonattachment,” and so on.

original: de ltar ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni bstan ma thag pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: “ In this way” refers to the manner just explained.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na bud med shes na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba gnyi ga brdzun zhing med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na bud med shes na 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba gnyi ga brdzun zhing med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, since the woman is not perceived in the dream state, both attachment and nonattachment are false and nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yang dngos po med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan yang dngos po med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, since the causal basis is not perceived, things are nonexistent,

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “No one,” and so on.

original: de la chang bas ni yul thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la chang bas ni yul thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, since the causal basis is not perceived, all objects are essentially nonexistent.

original: gang gi tshe phyogs gcig bud med rnams dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyogs gcig bud med rnams dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: When one part is taught to be a non-entity,

original: de phye bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de phye bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: chad pa phye ba'i gtan tshigs kyis yul gang dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chad pa phye ba'i gtan tshigs kyis yul gang dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the object is a non-entity due to the reason of the division of nihilism,

original: rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa /
translated: the yogi

original: chags pa ma yin chags med min //
analyzed: chags pa ma yin chags med min //
translated: is neither attached nor non-attached.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just this meaning,

original: gang zhig chags dang bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig chags dang bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Whoever is free from attachment,” and so on.

original: gang zhig dmigs pa dang ldan pas mi gtsang ba bsgoms pas yul rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba skye mod kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig dmigs pa dang ldan pas mi gtsang ba bsgoms pas yul rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba skye mod kyi /
translated: Whoever is endowed with observation and free from attachment to objects through cultivating impurity,

original: des de kho na nyid mthong ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: des de kho na nyid mthong ba ma yin pas /
translated: has not seen reality,

original: 'khor ba las nges par mi grol lo ;
analyzed: 'khor ba las nges par mi grol lo ;
translated: and is not liberated from cyclic existence.

original: / gang gi phyir chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las langs na chags pa skye bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: / gang gi phyir chags pa dang / chags pa dang bral ba phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las langs na chags pa skye bar the tshom med do //
translated: Because attachment and freedom from attachment are mutually dependent, there is no doubt that attachment arises when one rises from meditative concentration.

original: de'i phyir 'dod spong don gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod spong don gnyer ba ste /
translated: Therefore, one who is intent on abandoning desire

original: gang yin pa de chags bral la'ang ste /
analyzed: gang yin pa de chags bral la'ang ste /
translated: should also be free from attachment.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni 'dod chags la'ang bsten mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni 'dod chags la'ang bsten mi bya ste /
translated: The word “also” means that one should not rely on desire,

original: yid la mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, one should not pay attention to it.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i lam 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pas chos la bdag med pa'i lam 'di ni ngo mtshar dang bcas pas bsngags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i lam 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pas chos la bdag med pa'i lam 'di ni ngo mtshar dang bcas pas bsngags pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the path of the four noble truths is taught to be mistaken, this path of the selflessness of phenomena is praised with wonder.

original: ae ma'o 'jig rten las 'das pa'i //
analyzed: ae ma'o 'jig rten las 'das pa'i //
translated: “Oh, the supramundane!”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽ae ma'o @72a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ae ma'o @72a * //
translated: and so forth is stated.

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ro //
translated: “Oh” is a word of wonder.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i /
translated: “Supramundane” means “beyond the world.”

original: lam 'di rnam par dben pa nyid //
analyzed: lam 'di rnam par dben pa nyid //
translated: This path is “solitary.”

original: de brtags pa'i chos kyis dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: de brtags pa'i chos kyis dben pa nyid do //
translated: It is solitary because it is free from imputed phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because of that,

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi tshig bden na ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi tshig bden na ni /
translated: if the words of others are true,

original: nyan thos kyi theg par mi gtsang ba sgom pa la sogs pa'i tshig de nyid kho na bden pa theg pa chen po'i tshig 'di brdzun te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par mi gtsang ba sgom pa la sogs pa'i tshig de nyid kho na bden pa theg pa chen po'i tshig 'di brdzun te /
translated: The words of the Sravakayana, such as the meditation on impurity, are true, but the words of the Mahayana are false,

original: bden pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that they are not true.

original: gnyi ga yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But were they not both taught by the Lord?

original: ji ltar gcig ni brdzun la gzhan ni bden zhe na /🔽gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig ni brdzun la gzhan ni bden zhe na / gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How can one be false and the other true?🔽He says, “If they were both true, etc.

original: gal te yang bden par nyan thos kyi theg pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bden par gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te yang bden par nyan thos kyi theg pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bden par gsungs te /
translated: Even if the Sravakayana were true, the Lord taught it as true,

original: rab 'byor la sogs pa lam des mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor la sogs pa lam des mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because Subhuti and others attained nirvana by that path.

original: de lta mod kyi sems can thams cad kyi don la mi sbyor ba'i phyir brdzun pa nyid de mi bden par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sems can thams cad kyi don la mi sbyor ba'i phyir brdzun pa nyid de mi bden par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, it is false, should be understood as untrue, because it does not apply to the welfare of all beings.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang sems can gyi don la 'jug pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang sems can gyi don la 'jug pa ma mthong ste /
translated: And the Sravakas are not seen to engage in the welfare of beings,

original: de dag rang gi don 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rang gi don 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they seek their own welfare.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan dag las nyan thos kyi theg pa la dman pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan dag las nyan thos kyi theg pa la dman pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in other scriptures, such as the Perfection of Wisdom, it is said that the Śrāvaka Vehicle is inferior.

original: gzhan yang theg pa de dag bden pa dang brdzun par brtags pa ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa de dag bden pa dang brdzun par brtags pa ci zhig dgos /
translated: Moreover, what need is there to investigate whether these vehicles are true or false?

original: gang zhig gzhan don byed pa de bden par bdag gis rtogs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan don byed pa de bden par bdag gis rtogs te /
translated: I understand that which benefits others to be true.

original: de yang theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: That is the Great Vehicle.

original: gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams srog gtong bas kyang sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: gang la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams srog gtong bas kyang sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: Abiding in that, the bodhisattvas benefit sentient beings even at the cost of their lives.

original: 'di ltar sems can gyi don la nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa las theg pa chen po mchog nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gyi don la nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa las theg pa chen po mchog nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the superiority of the Great Vehicle over the Śrāvaka Vehicle by its application to the benefit of sentient beings,

original: da ni ye shes mchog nyid kyis de mchog nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ye shes mchog nyid kyis de mchog nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach its superiority by its supreme wisdom,

original: bden la bden pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bden la bden pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The truth of the truth of non-duality,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes theg pa chen po bden pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes theg pa chen po bden pa yin te /
translated: Because the non-dual wisdom of the Great Vehicle is the truth.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po bden la /
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po bden la /
translated: Therefore, the Great Vehicle is true.

original: bden pa yin par mkhas pa mchog rnams gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa yin par mkhas pa mchog rnams gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The supreme scholars have said that it is true.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor rtog pa'i bdag nyid 'khrul pa brdzun par gzigs te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de nyid kyis nyan thos kyi theg pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor rtog pa'i bdag nyid 'khrul pa brdzun par gzigs te /
translated: By means of that very nondual wisdom, the Listeners’ Vehicle is seen to be false, having the nature of the error of the conception of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de brdzun pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi @72b theg pa bden pa la ni gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de brdzun pa'i phyir nyan thos kyi @72b theg pa bden pa la ni gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Since it is false, one should not abide in the truth of the Listeners’ Vehicle.

original: mkhas pa bden par gsung pa zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: mkhas pa bden par gsung pa zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is related to the statement “The wise speak the truth.”

original: de ltar ye shes mchog nyid kyis theg pa chen po mchog nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes mchog nyid kyis theg pa chen po mchog nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the supremacy of the Great Vehicle by means of the supremacy of its wisdom,

original: da ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la brten pa'i tshig rnams mi bden par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la brten pa'i tshig rnams mi bden par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that the words based on the Listeners’ Vehicle are false,

original: byis pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byis pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says “The words of the childish worldly people,” and so on.

original: byis pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: byis pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyi tshig ste /
translated: These are the words of the childish worldly people.

original: ngag rnams kyi nang nas bden pa'i dag las brdzun pa'i ngag mchog ste /
analyzed: ngag rnams kyi nang nas bden pa'i dag las brdzun pa'i ngag mchog ste /
translated: Among all the words, the false words are the best.

original: phul du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phul du byung ba yin no //
translated: It is excellent.

original: gang gi phyir gang cung zad de dang 'brel ba'i ngag de dag thams cad mthar ni ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang cung zad de dang 'brel ba'i ngag de dag thams cad mthar ni ste /
translated: Because whatever is related to that, all of that speech is ultimately

original: de'i bdag nyid brdzun zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid brdzun zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: false. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi ngag rnams ni drang ba'i don du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi ngag rnams ni drang ba'i don du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Because those speeches are taught to have a provisional meaning,

original: gang zag dang phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they teach the person, the aggregates, the bases, and the elements.

original: gang zag la sogs pa rnams kyang yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag la sogs pa rnams kyang yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the person and so on do not exist,

original: nyi shu pa las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi shu pa las bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are refuted in the Twenty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yang mi shes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i dgongs pa yang mi shes te /
translated: They do not understand the intention of the teachings of the Bhagavat,

original: blo la rnam par dpyod pa'i nus pa med pas sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la rnam par dpyod pa'i nus pa med pas sgra ji bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they grasp literally without the ability to analyze the mind.

original: de bzhin du ji lta ba bzhin gyi sgra'i don mi shes pas sgra'i shes pa tshad mar ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji lta ba bzhin gyi sgra'i don mi shes pas sgra'i shes pa tshad mar ston par byed do //
translated: In the same way, because they do not understand the meaning of the words as they are, they teach that the consciousness of the words is valid knowledge.

original: sgra'i shes pa las don thob pa ni med de /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa las don thob pa ni med de /
translated: But the meaning of the words is not obtained from the consciousness of the words.

original: gang gi phyir sgra rnams dang ni phyi'i don 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra rnams dang ni phyi'i don 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection between words and external objects.

original: don la mi bslu ba yang tshad mar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don la mi bslu ba yang tshad mar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the cognition of attainment is not a valid cognition with regard to the object, he says:

original: thob blo de nyid min pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thob blo de nyid min pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the cognition of attainment is not that.

original: blo'i sgra ni sgra'i shes par bstan to //
analyzed: blo'i sgra ni sgra'i shes par bstan to //
translated: The word “cognition” indicates the cognition of sound.

original: de yang de nyid min te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de nyid min te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not that, because it is not real.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition.

original: thob par bya ba'i don la des thob med de /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i don la des thob med de /
translated: With regard to the object to be attained, there is no attainment by that,

original: spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a universal for its object.

original: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa brjod pa 'dis rang gi theg pa dman par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa brjod pa 'dis rang gi theg pa dman par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by this expression of the unreal, the lesser vehicle is taught.

original: theg pa chen pos bzlog pa'i don gyis mchog tu bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos bzlog pa'i don gyis mchog tu bstan to //
translated: The greater vehicle is taught as supreme by the meaning of the negation.

original: don de nyid rnam par spro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid rnam par spro ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that meaning, he says:

original: dngos po gang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po gang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Whatever thing, etc.

original: de dang de zhes bya bar bstan par rigs te /
analyzed: de dang de zhes bya bar bstan par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to teach that as “that and that.”

original: sdeb sbyor nyams pas ma brjod kyang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sdeb sbyor nyams pas ma brjod kyang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Even if it is not expressed due to the loss of meter, it should be understood.

original: rnam brtags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam brtags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is called imagined

original: gnyi ga la yang blta'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang blta'o //
translated: is to be seen in both.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /🔽sngar @73a * //
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te / sngar @73a * //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: bstan pa'i rnam pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i ye shes rnams blos brtags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / kun tu rtog pas rnam par brtags pa /
analyzed: bstan pa'i rnam pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i ye shes rnams blos brtags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / kun tu rtog pas rnam par brtags pa /
translated: The wisdoms of the Hearer Vehicle, as previously taught, are imagined by the mind as subject and object, and imagined by the imagination of the unreal.

original: de dag thams cad brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: de dag thams cad brdzun pa yin //
translated: All of those are false.

original: de bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bden pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not true.

original: sgras sgro btags pa kun tu rtogs pas brtags pa de dag thams cad brdzun zhes bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: sgras sgro btags pa kun tu rtogs pas brtags pa de dag thams cad brdzun zhes bya ba'i don du /
translated: The meaning of all of those being false is that they are imagined by the imagination of the unreal, which is a verbal superimposition.

original: de bden zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bden zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meaning of that is true is as follows.

original: 'dir yang gang dang gang brjod pa rig pas snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang dang gang brjod pa rig pas snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Here also, whatever is expressed should be connected with the previous [verse] by understanding.

original: gang zhig ma brtags zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ma brtags zhes bya ba yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: What is called not imagined is also as before.

original: de la don ni 'di yin to /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin to /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: theg pa chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de kho na nyid blos ma bcos pa rnam par rtog pas gang rnam par ma brtags pa de ni bden pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de kho na nyid blos ma bcos pa rnam par rtog pas gang rnam par ma brtags pa de ni bden pa yin no //
translated: The truth is the non-dual pristine consciousness of the Great Vehicle, the suchness that is not fabricated by the mind, and not at all analyzed by conceptuality.

original: yang gang gi sgras sgro btags pas rnam par ma brtags pa de ni yang dag mtha' yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gang gi sgras sgro btags pas rnam par ma brtags pa de ni yang dag mtha' yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of “that which is not analyzed by the word ‘is’” is the “limit of reality.”

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As such:

original: gang zhig blo yi yul min pa //
analyzed: gang zhig blo yi yul min pa //
translated: That which is not an object of the intellect

original: de la ngag brjod gal 'byung //
analyzed: de la ngag brjod gal 'byung //
translated: Is expressed by speech, but it does not arise.

original: zhes gsungs so //🔽da ni rtog ge pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // da ni rtog ge pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ae ma'o skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽ae ma'o skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: ae ma'o skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ae ma'o skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: Now, in consideration of logicians, it is said, “Amazing! The nature of beings…”🔽Amazing! Beings!

original: ae ma'o skyes bu'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o skyes bu'o //
translated: Amazing! Beings!

original: de ma dul ba ni  'bar ba'o //
analyzed: de ma dul ba ni  'bar ba'o //
translated: When they are not disciplined, they blaze.

original: de nyid phyir ni gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid phyir ni gnas med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they have no place,

original: 'ga' zhig lam de la gnas pa med pas gang dag de lta bur gyur pa'i byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig lam de la gnas pa med pas gang dag de lta bur gyur pa'i byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i don to //
translated: because no one abides in that path. The meaning is that childish beings imagine it to be that way.

original: sgrub pa dang ni sun 'byin pa'i //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang ni sun 'byin pa'i //
translated: Proof and refutation

original: rgyus yod pa ma yin pa yang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis ji ltar mos pa'i don du 'jog ste /
analyzed: rgyus yod pa ma yin pa yang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis ji ltar mos pa'i don du 'jog ste /
translated: And even if they are familiar with it, they posit it according to their own pride, for the sake of their own interest.

original: yod pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'jog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'jog ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they posit it as having an existent reality.

original: da ni theg pa chen po'i phan yon bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: da ni theg pa chen po'i phan yon bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, wishing to teach the benefits of the Mahayana, he says,

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ignorant of the Mahayana, etc.

original: theg pa chen po mi shes pa ni theg pa chen po'i ngo bo mi shes pa rnams las blun pa nyid de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po mi shes pa ni theg pa chen po'i ngo bo mi shes pa rnams las blun pa nyid de /
translated: Ignorance of the Mahayana is the stupidity of those who do not know the nature of the Mahayana.

original: rmongs pa nyid legs pa yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa nyid legs pa yin te /
translated: It is better, i.e., superior, to be ignorant, i.e., stupid,

original: mchog yin gyi byang chub chen po'i lam las ring bar byed pa'i lam ngan pa la shes rab rno ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mchog yin gyi byang chub chen po'i lam las ring bar byed pa'i lam ngan pa la shes rab rno ba ni ma yin no //
translated: than to be sharp in the bad path that makes one go far from the path to great enlightenment.

original: dper na lam nor ba las 'phye bo nyid ni 'phye bo'i rang bzhin can mchog yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na lam nor ba las 'phye bo nyid ni 'phye bo'i rang bzhin can mchog yin gyi /
translated: For example, it is better, i.e., superior, to be a cripple, i.e., one who has the nature of a cripple,

original: mgyogs pa ni mgyogs par 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mgyogs pa ni mgyogs par 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: than to be fast, i.e., one who goes fast,

original: gang gi phyir lam de ni ring ba ni yongs su chad pa med par phyin pas brlag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lam de ni ring ba ni yongs su chad pa med par phyin pas brlag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: on a wrong path, because one is destroyed, i.e., one does not arrive, by going a long way without interruption. This is the meaning.

original: da ni theg pa chen @73b po la gus pa dang gzhan pa'i phan yon dang smad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni theg pa chen @73b po la gus pa dang gzhan pa'i phan yon dang smad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate respect for the Great Vehicle and other benefits and deprecations,🔽

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the reverence for the Mahayana and the other benefits and condemnations, he says:

original: gang dag theg pa chen po shes shing theg pa chen po la gus pa de dag nyid don gyis bde bar gshegs pa par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag theg pa chen po shes shing theg pa chen po la gus pa de dag nyid don gyis bde bar gshegs pa par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Those who know the Mahayana and have reverence for the Mahayana are to be understood as the Sugatas themselves in fact.

original: rang sde ni gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi sde pa'o //
analyzed: rang sde ni gzhan dag bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi sde pa'o //
translated: The “own group” is the own group because others are disciples of the Lord.

original: lam min ni lam las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: lam min ni lam las nyams pa'o //
translated: “Not the path” is falling from the path.

original: de nyid g-yang sa ste lhung ba'i gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid g-yang sa ste lhung ba'i gnas lta bu'o //
translated: That itself is an abyss, like a place of falling.

original: der 'khor ba ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu la zhugs shing thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der 'khor ba ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu la zhugs shing thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Wandering there” means engaging in and attaining the cause of delusion.

original: da ni 'khor ba rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /🔽sems ni yang dag 'jug pa yi //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni 'khor ba rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir / sems ni yang dag 'jug pa yi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to analyze saṃsāra, he says:

original: sems ni yang dag par 'jug pa gang yin pa de la mkhas pas rnam par dpyod pa mi 'jug gi /
analyzed: sems ni yang dag par 'jug pa gang yin pa de la mkhas pas rnam par dpyod pa mi 'jug gi /
translated: The wise do not analyze that which is the correct engagement of mind.🔽Here, “the correct engagement of mind” is the engagement of mind in the correct meaning.🔽The wise do not analyze that.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po 'di dag la /🔽'khor ba rab tu spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po 'di dag la / 'khor ba rab tu spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of these things,🔽in order to abandon cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba rab tu spang ba la dmigs nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba rab tu spang ba la dmigs nas /
translated: Having observed the abandonment of cyclic existence,

original: thams cad blo ni mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad blo ni mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: all minds are the same.

original: de'i phyir blo tha dad med pa'i rgyus mkhas pa rnam par dpyad par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo tha dad med pa'i rgyus mkhas pa rnam par dpyad par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of a different mind, it is not reasonable for the wise to analyze.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: theg pa gnyis po la 'khor ba spong bar mi 'dod pa'i blo ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis po la 'khor ba spong bar mi 'dod pa'i blo ni gang yang med do //
translated: There is no mind at all that does not wish to abandon cyclic existence in the two vehicles.

original: yang 'khor ba rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa la 'jug pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang 'khor ba rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyod pa la 'jug pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that the analysis of cyclic existence in terms of arising, disintegration, and so on is itself generated,

original: rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “stream” and so on.

original: rgyun zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par skad cig gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyun 'jug ste /
analyzed: rgyun zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par skad cig gzhan dang gzhan gyi rgyun 'jug ste /
translated: “Stream” means the uninterrupted stream of other moments.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “impermanent” is that it is momentary.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is that?

original: thog mtha' med pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: It has the nature of being beginningless and endless.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: thog ma dang bral ba ni thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang bral ba ni thog ma med pa'o //
translated: Free from a beginning is beginningless.

original: gang gi tshe thog ma yod par gyur pa de'i tshe rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe thog ma yod par gyur pa de'i tshe rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is a beginning, then there is no cause.

original: de yang rgyu med pa nyid yin na rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyu med pa nyid yin na rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if that is causeless, then it is either eternally existent or eternally non-existent.

original: chos la bdag med par ma bsgoms pa'i tshul gyis mtha' ma med pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par ma bsgoms pa'i tshul gyis mtha' ma med pa'i bdag nyid can no //
