translated: It has no end, in the sense that one does not cultivate the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rang bzhin 'di ci zhes ni ci'i ngo bo nyid yin zhes 'khor ba rnam par dpyod pa la shes rab can te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di ci zhes ni ci'i ngo bo nyid yin zhes 'khor ba rnam par dpyod pa la shes rab can te /
translated: The wise one, who is skilled in the analysis of cyclic life, thinks, “What is this nature? What is its intrinsic reality?”

original: theg pa chen po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i mkhas pas blos yongs su tshol te 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rjes su 'brang ba'i mkhas pas blos yongs su tshol te 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wise one, who is skilled in the Mahayana, investigates with the mind, i.e., he engages in the investigation.

original: da ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dpyad pa'i sgo nas 'khor ba brtag pa'i @74a * //
analyzed: da ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dpyad pa'i sgo nas 'khor ba brtag pa'i @74a * //
translated: Now, in order to examine cyclic life from the point of view of origination and destruction, he says,

original: phyir ; sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyir ; sna tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The various, etc.

original: sna tshogs kyi sgra ni 'khor ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi sgra ni 'khor ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The word “various” is a synonym for cyclic life.

original: de lta na sna tshogs 'di dag gang las 'byung zhing gang du yang ni 'jig par 'gyur zhes rnam par dpyod pa la 'ga' zhig 'jug na rang gi bag chags sa bon zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta na sna tshogs 'di dag gang las 'byung zhing gang du yang ni 'jig par 'gyur zhes rnam par dpyod pa la 'ga' zhig 'jug na rang gi bag chags sa bon zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In that case, if someone engages in the analysis, “From what do these various things arise and into what do they cease?”🔽the response is “the seeds of one’s own habitual tendencies.”

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las sna tshogs pa 'byung zhing skyes so //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las sna tshogs pa 'byung zhing skyes so //
translated: Therefore, the various things arise and are born from the seeds of habitual tendencies that are present in the storehouse consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rang bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gsal bar rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rang bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gsal bar rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t the storehouse consciousness the nature of the active forms of consciousness? Isn’t it the case that the storehouse consciousness is not clearly realized?

original: de ji ltar yod par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yod par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be understood that it exists?

original: gnyid log ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyid log ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is “when one is asleep, etc.”

original: dper na gnyid log pa dang / brgyal ba dang / mi dran pa'i gnas skabs dang / de bzhin du 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: dper na gnyid log pa dang / brgyal ba dang / mi dran pa'i gnas skabs dang / de bzhin du 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: For example, when one is asleep, in a faint, in a state of unconsciousness, and similarly in the states of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags nas slar yang 'byung bar snang bas sa bon thams cad pa nges par 'grub /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'gags nas slar yang 'byung bar snang bas sa bon thams cad pa nges par 'grub /
translated: Since the active consciousnesses cease and then appear again, the consciousness that is the seed of all is definitely established.

original: sa bon thams cad pa'i sgra ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa'i sgra ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bya ste /
translated: The term “seed of all” refers to the storehouse consciousness.

original: 'di ltar sum cu pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar sum cu pa las /
translated: Thus, the Thirty Verses says:

original: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa //🔽zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa // zhes bstan to //
translated: The seed of all is the ripening.

original: sa bon thams cad pa nyid du yang de ji ltar khong du chud par bya /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa nyid du yang de ji ltar khong du chud par bya /
translated: How is it understood that it is the seed of all?

original: gang gi phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi sa bon gyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi sa bon gyi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the seeds of all active consciousnesses.

original: de grub pa ni nges par yod par grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de grub pa ni nges par yod par grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Its establishment is the establishment of its definite existence.

original: de lta bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba las rgyu rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba las rgyu rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cause of the active consciousnesses is inferred from the perception of their effects.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir gang rgyu yin pa de nyid kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu 'byung ba mi srid pa'i phyir gang rgyu yin pa de nyid kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is impossible for an effect to occur without a cause, that which is the cause is called the storehouse consciousness.

original: rang gang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa spangs nas rigs mi mthun pa las rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: rang gang gi nye bar len pa'i rgyu rnam par shes pa spangs nas rigs mi mthun pa las rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable for a consciousness to arise from a cause that is not of its own type, having abandoned the appropriating cause of consciousness.

original: dbang po rnams kyang nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma yin te ;
translated: The faculties are not the cause of appropriation,

original: shes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: shes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because it would follow that they are consciousness.

original: bdag tu brtags pa las kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: bdag tu brtags pa las kyang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable that it arises from the imagined self,

original: de ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir don gyi bya ba mi byed do //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir don gyi bya ba mi byed do //
translated: because that is permanent and does not perform the function of an object.

original: de ltar 'khor ba gang las 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba gang las 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that samsara arises from that.

original: gang du 'gag pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang du 'gag pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to analyze where it ceases,

original: dbang don zhes bya ba la @74b sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang don zhes bya ba la @74b sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The sense faculties and objects,” and so on.

original: dbang po ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: The sense faculties are the ripening consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i yul gyi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu las nus pa'i khyad par 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i yul gyi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu las nus pa'i khyad par 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The sense-fields of the eye, etc., which are related to the special potency of the result, i.e., the consciousness of a particular object such as form, etc., are to be inferred.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan mthong bas nges te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan mthong bas nges te /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained by the perception of another.

original: rang gi rnam pas dpag pa sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pas nus pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa gzugs kyi skye mched rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pas dpag pa sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pas nus pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa gzugs kyi skye mched rjes su dpag par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The sense-field of form, which possesses a special potency, is to be inferred by the consciousness of blue, etc., which is the inference of its own form.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dbang don gyi ngo bo kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba gang yin pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dbang don gyi ngo bo kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba gang yin pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The entity of the sense-faculty and object, which is such, is what arises from the consciousness of the store-consciousness and is called the actual consciousness.

original: de dag thams cad 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these are called the actual consciousness.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo phan tshun tha mi dad pas na tha dad min no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo phan tshun tha mi dad pas na tha dad min no //
translated: Since the nature of cause and result is not different from each other, they are not different.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kho na 'khor ba'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kho na 'khor ba'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: Only the active consciousnesses are called saṃsāra.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig 'khor zhes bya ba'i don du gzhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig 'khor zhes bya ba'i don du gzhag pa ni med do //
translated: There is no other entity that can be posited as the meaning of saṃsāra.

original: gang gi phyir kun tu 'khor bas na 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun tu 'khor bas na 'khor ba ste /
translated: Because it is completely cyclic, it is saṃsāra.

original: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan 'khor ba ni med de phyi'i don dag ni bems po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan 'khor ba ni med de phyi'i don dag ni bems po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Apart from consciousness, there is no other saṃsāra, because external objects are inanimate.

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa ni 'khor ba 'byung ba dang 'gag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa ni 'khor ba 'byung ba dang 'gag pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the arising and cessation of consciousness should be understood as the arising and cessation of saṃsāra.

original: da ni sngar bstan pa'i don bstan par byed pa gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems yang rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: da ni sngar bstan pa'i don bstan par byed pa gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems yang rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: Now, the nondual mind, which is taught to be the meaning of the above teaching, appears as different due to the distinctions of its aspects. How is that?

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: de ni rtag tu gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is always nondual by nature.

original: 'on kyang byis pa rnams la de'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa rnams la de'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to show its nature to the childish,

original: chu g-yos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽dper na / chu g-yos pa las de dang der //
analyzed: chu g-yos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dper na / chu g-yos pa las de dang der //
translated: he says, “Like waves in water, etc.”

original: rlabs ni tha dad dngos 'byung bzhin te /🔽ngo bor mthong ba nyid skad cig de la yang /🔽phyir yang mi g-yo gnyid log bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlabs ni tha dad dngos 'byung bzhin te / ngo bor mthong ba nyid skad cig de la yang / phyir yang mi g-yo gnyid log bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, waves arise from water as entities that are different from it.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa kun tu brtags pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis bdag nyid du tha dad pa'i ngo bor snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa kun tu brtags pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis bdag nyid du tha dad pa'i ngo bor snang ste /
translated: In the same way, consciousness appears as entities that are different from itself due to the differences in the aspects of the imagined.

original: skad cig de la gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dngos po gcig gi rang bzhin gnyis su @75a * //
analyzed: skad cig de la gnyis su med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to // dngos po gcig gi rang bzhin gnyis su @75a * //
translated: In that moment, it becomes nondual.

original: snang bar ci ltar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: snang bar ci ltar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In the same way, how can the nature of a single entity appear as two?

original: de ni gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That is not so, etc.”

original: rnam par shes pa de ni gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: That consciousness is the appearance of duality,

original: gnyis su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su mthong ba'o //
translated: the seeing of duality.

original: rigs pa'i spyod yul de ma yin te //
analyzed: rigs pa'i spyod yul de ma yin te //
translated: It is not the domain of reasoning.

original: don de ni rigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don de ni rigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: That object is not the domain of reasoning.

original: rigs pas bstan par mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs pas bstan par mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it cannot be shown by reasoning.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: skad cig la ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig la ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said “in an instant.”

original: ci ltar skad cig la ni brjod pa ni skad cig la bton pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar skad cig la ni brjod pa ni skad cig la bton pa'o //
translated: Just as in an instant, it is uttered in an instant.

original: sgra dang sgra brnyan ni bye brag gnyis su thos pa'i rigs pa ni med de /
analyzed: sgra dang sgra brnyan ni bye brag gnyis su thos pa'i rigs pa ni med de /
translated: There is no reasoning for hearing a sound and an echo as two different things.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the same here as well.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid snang ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid snang ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the nature of the appearance of the imagined nature is not real,

original: sgyu ma mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said “like a magician,” and so on.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: Just as a magician displays various things,

original: rnam pa du ma skad cig la ston pa na 'ga' zhig gsang ba'i gnas shes pa ni sgyu ma dang ldan pa'i skyes bu mthong na /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma skad cig la ston pa na 'ga' zhig gsang ba'i gnas shes pa ni sgyu ma dang ldan pa'i skyes bu mthong na /
translated: many things in an instant, when someone who knows the secret sees the person with the magic,

original: rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bor rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang gi ngo bor rnam par gnas so //
translated: Nature is the abiding of its own essence.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dbang gis byis pa rnams rnam pa'i ngo bo skad cig la snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnams kyi dbang gis byis pa rnams rnam pa'i ngo bo skad cig la snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, the nature of the aspects appears to the childish due to the power of consciousnesses.

original: mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can 'ga' zhig gis mthong na rang bzhin gnyis su med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can 'ga' zhig gis mthong na rang bzhin gnyis su med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is seen by some who have the nature of being wise, it is nondual by nature. This is the meaning.

original: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just this meaning,

original: sngo dang dmar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngo dang dmar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “blue, red, etc.”

original: ci ltar rtsangs pa sngo dang dmar por nges par snang ba'i dngos por bdag nyid ston cing yang dngos po gzhan du ston par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa byis pa rnams la kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du snang zhing /
analyzed: ci ltar rtsangs pa sngo dang dmar por nges par snang ba'i dngos por bdag nyid ston cing yang dngos po gzhan du ston par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa byis pa rnams la kun tu brtags pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du snang zhing /
translated: Just as a chameleon shows itself as an entity that appears as definitely blue or red and also shows itself as another entity, in the same way, consciousness appears to the childish as the nature of an imagined entity.

original: mkhas la ste mkhas pa rnams la ni gzhan yin te /
analyzed: mkhas la ste mkhas pa rnams la ni gzhan yin te /
translated: To the wise, however, it is different.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It appears as the nature of the consummate. This is the meaning.

original: yang au rgyan pa las 'di skad thos te /
analyzed: yang au rgyan pa las 'di skad thos te /
translated: Again, I heard this from the people of Oḍḍiyāna:

original: 'di ltar bdag cag gi yul gyi rtsangs pa gang ci 'dra ba'i gzugs ston cig byas na de bzhin du de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cag gi yul gyi rtsangs pa gang ci 'dra ba'i gzugs ston cig byas na de bzhin du de /
translated: “Whatever form of lizard is in our country, show us that form.”

original: 'dra ba ston ce'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba ston ce'o //
translated: They show us that form.

original: byis pa rnams la gzhan du snang zhing mkhas pa rnams la gzhan du snang zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la gzhan du snang zhing mkhas pa rnams la gzhan du snang zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention behind the statement, “It appears otherwise to fools, and it appears otherwise to the wise”?

original: smras pa 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: smras pa 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: 'di ltar shes pa ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su gnas @75b te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su gnas @75b te ;
translated: Thus, consciousness is of two kinds: the imagined nature and the perfect nature.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin log pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin log pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: The imagined nature is the opposite of the perfect nature.

original: de la gal te dus thams cad du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo de yin na de'i tshe 'ga' yang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te dus thams cad du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo de yin na de'i tshe 'ga' yang grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the imagined nature were to exist at all times, then no one would be liberated.

original: 'on te yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe sems can rnams thar pa rtsom pa'i don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe sems can rnams thar pa rtsom pa'i don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the nature of the perfected, then sentient beings would be devoid of the purpose of beginning the path to liberation.

original: de lta bas na dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa'i dbye bas byis pa dang mkhas pa rnams la de'i bdag nyid snang bar 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa'i dbye bas byis pa dang mkhas pa rnams la de'i bdag nyid snang bar 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the appearance of that nature to the childish and the wise, respectively, by way of the distinction of being with stains and being without stains.

original: da ni slob dpon gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of the master, it is said:

original: 'di yi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di yi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Its nature is such and such…”

original: rnam par shes pa 'di ni 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin du bzhed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di ni 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin du bzhed de /
translated: This consciousness is accepted to have such and such a nature.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba la sgrib par mi byed pas na dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba la sgrib par mi byed pas na dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is stainless because it does not obscure the vision of reality.

original: sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams med pa'i phyir rnam pa med cing ngo //
analyzed: sngon po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams med pa'i phyir rnam pa med cing ngo //
translated: It is without aspect because it lacks the aspects of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: sgra la sogs pas gzhan gyi rgyud la gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pas gzhan gyi rgyud la gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir brjod du med pa'o //
translated: It is inexpressible because it lacks the cause of expression in the continuum of another, such as sound.

original: sangs rgyas min pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas min pa ste /
translated: Not a Buddha,🔽that is, not a Buddha Bhagavat.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las ma gtogs pas na yang gzhan 'ga' zhig gis don dam pa'i ngo bo shes par mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las ma gtogs pas na yang gzhan 'ga' zhig gis don dam pa'i ngo bo shes par mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that no one else can know the nature of the ultimate.

original: yang ci'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kho nas mkhyen zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kho nas mkhyen zhe na /
translated: Why can only the Buddha Bhagavats know it?

original: tha mal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha mal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Ordinary people, etc.

original: ji ltar skye bo  tha mal pas rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor brtags pa rigs de dag bzhin du de'i ngo bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mi mkhyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar skye bo  tha mal pas rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor brtags pa rigs de dag bzhin du de'i ngo bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mi mkhyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of consciousness as it is imagined by ordinary people in terms of the natures of subject and object is not known by the Buddha Bhagavats.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i rab tu grags pa de nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo mkhyen te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i rab tu grags pa de nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo mkhyen te /
translated: The nature of consciousness as it is well known is known by them as the perfected nature.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das des mkhyen to //
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das des mkhyen to //
translated: That is known by the Bhagavat.

original: gang gi phyir rab tu grags pa de nyid ni gzhan dag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu grags pa de nyid ni gzhan dag gi ma yin no //
translated: Because that is well known, it is not the case for others.

original: ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kho nas mkhyen gyi gzhan dag gis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kho nas mkhyen gyi gzhan dag gis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does only the Omniscient One, the Buddha, the Blessed One, know, and not others?

original: lung dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lung dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “scripture, etc.”

original: lung dang bstan bcos la dris nas bdag cag smra ba 'ba' zhig tsam yin gyi thams cad rtogs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lung dang bstan bcos la dris nas bdag cag smra ba 'ba' zhig tsam yin gyi thams cad rtogs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Having asked about scripture and treatises, we say only what we have heard, not that we understand everything.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: mig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “eye, etc.”

original: ji ltar mig dang ldan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs yul nyid du dmus long rnams kyis brgyud @76a * //
analyzed: ji ltar mig dang ldan pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs yul nyid du dmus long rnams kyis brgyud @76a * //
translated: Just as the objects of form that are the domain of one who has eyes are the objects of the blind,

original: pas thos nas /
analyzed: pas thos nas /
translated: having heard about them through others,

original: mig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes smra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong ngo zhes smra ba bzhin no //
translated: they say, “The eye sees forms.”

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyis rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo mkhyen la gzhan dag gis de yongs su mi shes pa de lta yin na de'i don du sems pa ni don med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyis rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo mkhyen la gzhan dag gis de yongs su mi shes pa de lta yin na de'i don du sems pa ni don med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the Buddha knows the nature of consciousness, and others do not understand it, then it is pointless to think about it.

original: ye shes mig sman zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ye shes mig sman zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “eye ointment of wisdom, etc.”

original: ye shes mig sman khyad par gyis te mig gis so //
analyzed: ye shes mig sman khyad par gyis te mig gis so //
translated: by the special eye-ointment of intuition, by the eye.

original: gang gi phyir gnas skabs de ru ma 'ongs 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas skabs de ru ma 'ongs 'gyur te /
translated: because at that time, it will become future,

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas thob pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas thob pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: at the time of attaining the stage of the Joyous, etc.

original: gang gi gnas skabs la thub pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: gang gi gnas skabs la thub pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: at the time of which, the Lord of Sages,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhin du bdag cag gi sems kyi de nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhin du bdag cag gi sems kyi de nyid de /
translated: the Bhagavat Buddha, will see the reality of our mind,

original: yongs su grub pa don dam pa de thams cad mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa don dam pa de thams cad mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the perfected, the ultimate, as all.

original: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid phyi'i 'gro bar rnam par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid phyi'i 'gro bar rnam par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t the external world established as having a variety of natures?

original: ci ltar rnam par shes pa la de gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam par shes pa la de gzhag ce na /
translated: How can it be established in consciousness?

original: byis pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse-text says, “The childish, etc. ”

original: lung dang rigs pas len 'debs te /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas len 'debs te /
translated: They are taught by scripture and reasoning.

original: de la lung ni /
analyzed: de la lung ni /
translated: As for scripture,

original: khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: a sūtra says, “This triple world is mind-only. ”

original: rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Reasoning will be explained.

original: gang dang gang gi ni byis pa rmongs pas yang dang yang du kun brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa bsgoms pas de dang de'i rnam par shes pa bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du mdun na snang ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi ni byis pa rmongs pas yang dang yang du kun brtags pa'i rnam par shes pa bsgoms pas de dang de'i rnam par shes pa bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du mdun na snang ste /
translated: The consciousness of whatever is repeatedly imagined by the confused childish one appears in front, like a magical person, due to the power of the cultivation of that consciousness.

original: de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir phyi'i don ni med do //
analyzed: de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir phyi'i don ni med do //
translated: External objects do not exist, because they are of the same type.

original: ji ltar bsgoms pa'i stobs las 'di dag gi don 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgoms pa'i stobs las 'di dag gi don 'grub ce na /
translated: How is the meaning of these established by the power of cultivation?

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, three verses are stated to illustrate this with examples.

original: gos rnams bgos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gos rnams bgos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even though clothes are worn, etc.

original: gos rnams bgos kyang yan lag la goms pa ma tshang bas shin tu grang ba'i ba mos gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gos rnams bgos kyang yan lag la goms pa ma tshang bas shin tu grang ba'i ba mos gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: Even though clothes are worn, the body is harmed by intense cold due to the incompleteness of the practice of the limbs.

original: mig la mi gnod pa 'di ni ngo mtshar che'o /
analyzed: mig la mi gnod pa 'di ni ngo mtshar che'o /
translated: This is not harmful to the eyes, and this is amazing.

original: de lta bas na 'dir goms pa dang goms pa ma yin pa'i stobs las rjes su dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir goms pa dang goms pa ma yin pa'i stobs las rjes su dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here it should be analyzed by the power of practice and non-practice.

original: de bzhin du goms pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du goms pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Likewise, it is said, “by the power of familiarity, etc.”

original: goms pa'i stobs kyis ko pags mkhan la ko pags kyi dri nga bas shin tu gnod pa med kyi /
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs kyis ko pags mkhan la ko pags kyi dri nga bas shin tu gnod pa med kyi /
translated: By the power of familiarity, the smell of leather does not harm the leather worker at all.

original: gzhan dag la gnod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag la gnod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But it harms others. This is the meaning.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa'i @76b pags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa'i @76b pags pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of leather is it?

original: lag pas nyed pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lag pas nyed pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “by rubbing with the hands.”

original: lag pa gnyis kyis nyed pa na de la dri shin tu nga bar snang ngo //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis nyed pa na de la dri shin tu nga bar snang ngo //
translated: When it is rubbed with both hands, it appears to have a very bad smell.

original: lus dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lus dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “by those who possess a body, etc.”

original: lus dang ldan pa rnams kyis thog mar ni dang por te /
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa rnams kyis thog mar ni dang por te /
translated: Those who possess a body, at first, initially,

original: dug zos pas ni 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ba de nyid goms pa'i stobs kyis zos mthar ni bcud kyis len du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dug zos pas ni 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur ba de nyid goms pa'i stobs kyis zos mthar ni bcud kyis len du 'gyur te /
translated: by the power of familiarity, at the end of eating, it becomes a tonic.

original: de bzhin du bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam par shes pa nyid mdun na snang gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis rnam par shes pa nyid mdun na snang gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, by the power of meditation, consciousness itself appears in front, not an external object.

original: da ni sems las phyi rol du gyur pa 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu brtags nas dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems las phyi rol du gyur pa 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu brtags nas dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the cause of the elements that are external to mind, he says:

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The elements do not arise from causes.

original: kyang gi sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The word “also” is a particle.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyang gang las 'byung zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyang gang las 'byung zhes zer na /
translated: If one says, “From what do the elements arise?”

original: phyi rol du gyur pa'i rgyu gang las byung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol du gyur pa'i rgyu gang las byung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not arise from any external cause.

original: 'di ltar / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: 'di ltar / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: Thus, the various worlds arise from karma.

original: zhes las rnams las 'byung ba rnams skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes las rnams las 'byung ba rnams skye bar 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that the elements arise from karma.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: ci ltar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it illogical?

original: gang gi phyir 'byung ba rnams ni skye ba gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod na de dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'byung ba rnams ni skye ba gzhan gyi lus la gnas pa de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod na de dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the elements are asserted to be the effect of the body that arises from another cause, then they are not related to virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: gzhan yang las kyi bag chags gang la gnas she na /
analyzed: gzhan yang las kyi bag chags gang la gnas she na /
translated: Moreover, where is the latent potential of karma located?

original: las kyi bag chags sems gnas phyir /
analyzed: las kyi bag chags sems gnas phyir /
translated: The latent potential of karma is located in the mind.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says:

original: bag chags ni sems la gnas so //
analyzed: bag chags ni sems la gnas so //
translated: Latent impressions are located in the mind.

original: gal te sems la gnas pa yin na de'i tshe skye ba gzhan na yod pa'i 'byung ba rnams de'i skye ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te sems la gnas pa yin na de'i tshe skye ba gzhan na yod pa'i 'byung ba rnams de'i skye ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: If they are located in the mind, then the elements that exist in another birth are not the cause of that birth,

original: bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are interrupted.

original: gang du bag chags gnas pa der nges 'bras bu nyid byed do zhes grag go //
analyzed: gang du bag chags gnas pa der nges 'bras bu nyid byed do zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that the result is produced in the place where the latent impressions are located.

original: zhing la sa bon btab pas ri'i rtse mor 'bras bu skye ba ni med do //
analyzed: zhing la sa bon btab pas ri'i rtse mor 'bras bu skye ba ni med do //
translated: It is not the case that a seed planted in a field produces a fruit on the peak of a mountain.

original: de lta bas na bag chags kyi mthus rnam par shes pa nyid 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par mdun na snang gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bag chags kyi mthus rnam par shes pa nyid 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par mdun na snang gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, due to the power of latent impressions, consciousness itself appears in the aspect of elements, etc., in front of us. External objects do not exist.

original: gzhan yang dmigs pas 'byung ba rnams yod par rjes su rtogs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs pas 'byung ba rnams yod par rjes su rtogs te /
translated: Moreover, we understand that the elements exist because of their objects.

original: dmigs pa yang de'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang de'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: And the object is the aspect of that,

original: shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced from consciousness.

original: de lta bas na yang shes pa de nyid gnyi ga las grub pas 'byung ba'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa'i brtags pa yin par rigs kyi /🔽gnyi ga la ma grub pas phyi rol gyi don @77a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang shes pa de nyid gnyi ga las grub pas 'byung ba'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa'i brtags pa yin par rigs kyi / gnyi ga la ma grub pas phyi rol gyi don @77a * //
translated: Thus, since consciousness is established as both, it is reasonable that it is the transformation of the aspect of the elements.

original: yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: yin par mi rigs so //
translated: But since it is not established as both, it is unreasonable that it is an external object.

original: da ni las kyi bag chags kyi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni las kyi bag chags kyi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the aspect of the latent impressions of karma,

original: legs byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: legs byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “the aspect of good karma,” and so on.

original: legs pa'i las rnams ni skye ba gzhan la las kyi bag chags kyi rnam pa des rnam par rig pa zhi ba'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: legs pa'i las rnams ni skye ba gzhan la las kyi bag chags kyi rnam pa des rnam par rig pa zhi ba'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: The aspect of good karma is the aspect of the peace of cognition in another life.

original: gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa sems yid du 'ong ba'i skye bor skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa sems yid du 'ong ba'i skye bor skye'o //
translated: The aspect of form is the birth of a pleasant person.

original: de bzhin du rgyu de nyid kyis skye ba snga ma la gzhan gyi srog la mngon par zhen pa ni stag dang seng ge dom dang sbrul shin tu 'jigs par skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu de nyid kyis skye ba snga ma la gzhan gyi srog la mngon par zhen pa ni stag dang seng ge dom dang sbrul shin tu 'jigs par skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, due to that very cause, one who was attached to the life of another in a previous birth is born as a very frightening tiger, lion, bear, or snake. This is the meaning.

original: da ni 'dir de nyid kyi gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dir de nyid kyi gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate another reason for that,🔽he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text says:🔽If you say that the self is the aggregates,🔽then the self would arise and disintegrate.🔽

original: gal te 'byung ba rnams shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la brtags pa ma yin na de'i tshe de dag bem po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gar la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan la /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba rnams shes pa'i ngo bo nyid la brtags pa ma yin na de'i tshe de dag bem po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gar la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan la /
translated: If, as you say, the elements are not the nature of consciousness, then, because they are the nature of matter, how could they be the agent of other actions, such as dancing,

original: rkang pa lag pa'i g-yo ba la sogs //
analyzed: rkang pa lag pa'i g-yo ba la sogs //
translated: and the movement of the feet and hands?

original: ji ltar gzhan las byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan las byas par 'gyur //
translated: How could they be produced by another?

original: da ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba dang de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba dang de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to respond to the doubts of others and to refute them,

original: rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Wind” and so on.

original: gal te rlung las 'byung ba rnams kyis bya ba bskyed do //
analyzed: gal te rlung las 'byung ba rnams kyis bya ba bskyed do //
translated: If the elements produce the action of wind,

original: de lta yin na rlung gang las yin 'bad pa las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na rlung gang las yin 'bad pa las yin no zhe na /
translated: then from what is the wind? If you say it is from effort,

original: 'bad pa de yang gang las yin /
analyzed: 'bad pa de yang gang las yin /
translated: then what is the source of that effort?

original: gal te 'dod pa las yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa las yin na /
translated: If you say it is from desire,

original: de nyid ni khyod ni lam du nges par zhugs /
analyzed: de nyid ni khyod ni lam du nges par zhugs /
translated: then you are definitely on the path.

original: nges par ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nges par ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “ Definitely” means conceptualization.

original: lam de nyid du khyod zhugs te shes pa'i bya ba yin gyi rlung gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lam de nyid du khyod zhugs te shes pa'i bya ba yin gyi rlung gi ni ma yin no //
translated: You are definitely on that path, because the action is that of consciousness, not of wind.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'dod pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from consciousness, there is no object of desire.

original: de'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir gzhan las de ni 'byung bar mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir gzhan las de ni 'byung bar mi srid do //
translated: And because it is a quality of consciousness, it is impossible for it to arise from anything else.

original: re zhig 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i dpyad pa gzhag la /
analyzed: re zhig 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i dpyad pa gzhag la /
translated: For the time being, let us set aside the analysis of the cause of the elements.

original: de dag ni rtag tu rang bzhin 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni rtag tu rang bzhin 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: They are always changing by nature.

original: grangs can gyi gzhung gi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs can gyi gzhung gi dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to anticipate a critique of the Sāṃkhya school,

original: pha ma'i khu ba khrag dag las //
analyzed: pha ma'i khu ba khrag dag las //
translated: the root text states, “From the father’s semen and mother’s blood,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i pha ma ste /
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i pha ma ste /
translated: The father and mother possess a different shape, color, and so on.

original: pha ma gnyis dang 'brel pa'i khu khrag dag las khu chu dang zla mtshan dag las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i mgo bo dang / lag pa dang ldan pa'i ngo bo mi rnams 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: pha ma gnyis dang 'brel pa'i khu khrag dag las khu chu dang zla mtshan dag las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i mgo bo dang / lag pa dang ldan pa'i ngo bo mi rnams 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: From the semen and blood of the father and mother, which are connected to the two parents, a human being will emerge, possessing a head, arms, and so on, which are of a different nature than the semen and blood.

original: dbyibs dang kha dog gzhan dang ldan pa'i sa bon las mtshan nyid mi @77b mthun pa'i shing rnams dngos po ji ltar skye zhing 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog gzhan dang ldan pa'i sa bon las mtshan nyid mi @77b mthun pa'i shing rnams dngos po ji ltar skye zhing 'phel bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can things that have different shapes and colors, such as trees, arise and increase from seeds that have different characteristics?

original: rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams yongs su 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams yongs su 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that things that have a permanent nature undergo transformation.

original: 'di ltar khyod 'dod pa'i gtso bo chen po la sogs pa 'bras bu'i ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba brtags pa'i ngo bor mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod 'dod pa'i gtso bo chen po la sogs pa 'bras bu'i ngo bor yongs su 'gyur ba brtags pa'i ngo bor mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, it is not logical to imagine that the great principle that you assert and so on undergo transformation into the nature of an effect.

original: de ci bdag nyid thams cad yongs su 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ci bdag nyid thams cad yongs su 'gyur ram /
translated: In this regard, does the transformation of all of its nature or

original: 'on te phyogs gcig yin /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig yin /
translated: only a part of it?

original: bdag nyid thams cad yongs su 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad yongs su 'gyur na /
translated: If the transformation of all of its nature,

original: 'di ltar chen po la sogs pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du gtso bo yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chen po la sogs pa mi rtag pa de bzhin du gtso bo yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then just as the great principle and so on are impermanent, so too would the primal substance be.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig yin na de yang gang gi phyir phyogs gang yongs su gyur pa 'bras bu gsal ba dang ldan pa de bya ba med pa rgyu ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig yin na de yang gang gi phyir phyogs gang yongs su gyur pa 'bras bu gsal ba dang ldan pa de bya ba med pa rgyu ma yin pa /
translated: If only a part of it, then that part of it that is transformed into the manifest effect and possesses activity is not the cause, because it is not a nonmanifest cause.

original: phyogs gcig las byas pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbye bas khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig las byas pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbye bas khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: It is distinguished by the division of its nature into that which has activity and that which does not.

original: de bas na gtso bo de byed pa byed pa med pa gnyid kyis bya ba dang bya ba med pa sna tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gtso bo de byed pa byed pa med pa gnyid kyis bya ba dang bya ba med pa sna tshogs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the primal substance is the agent that is the cause of activity and inactivity, and it is the cause of the diversity of activity and inactivity.

original: sna tshogs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa yin no ;
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa yin no ;
translated: Because it is diverse, it is impermanent.

original: / rtag pa ni sna tshogs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: / rtag pa ni sna tshogs par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical for the permanent to be diverse,

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i nyes par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa'i nyes par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error of its nature being different would ensue.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu med na sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu med na sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that sound does not occur without a cause of appropriation,

original: kha las sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kha las sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Sound is not like that,” and so on.

original: sgra ni skyes bu'i 'bad pa'i rtsol ba la rag las pa gnas dang byed pa dang / rkan dang mchu sbyar ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rgyu 'di las lhan cig byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni skyes bu'i 'bad pa'i rtsol ba la rag las pa gnas dang byed pa dang / rkan dang mchu sbyar ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rgyu 'di las lhan cig byed pa yin te /
translated: Sound is dependent on the exertion of a person’s effort. It is the cause of the diversity of the place, the agent, the palate, lips, and so on. It is the simultaneous cause.

original: dngos dang dngos po med par snang ba na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med par snang ba na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when things and nonthings appear, one sees that they are concomitant and that they are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni yod na ni 'byung la de med na ni mi 'byung ba de'i phyir gal te nye bar len pa'i rgyu mi 'dod na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni yod na ni 'byung la de med na ni mi 'byung ba de'i phyir gal te nye bar len pa'i rgyu mi 'dod na de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, if they exist, they arise, and if they do not exist, they do not arise. Therefore, if you do not accept that they are the cause of appropriation, then

original: kha dang rdza rnga la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu med pa rnams las sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dang rdza rnga la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu med pa rnams las sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: sound would not arise from such things as the mouth, the drum, and so on, which are without cause.

original: de bzhin du dngos po rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba byed pa der mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i bya ba byed pa der mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, things would not perform mutually contradictory actions.🔽To demonstrate this, he says,

original: bya rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bya rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Birds, etc.”

original: bya rnams ni bya rnams te ;
analyzed: bya rnams ni bya rnams te ;
translated: Birds are birds.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du nam mkha' la 'gro'o //
translated: They fly in the sky as they wish.

original: snang ba'i lhan cig byed pas mig gi rnam par shes pas don mthong bar nus par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: snang ba'i lhan cig byed pas mig gi rnam par shes pas don mthong bar nus par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
translated: The eye consciousness is able to see objects through the cooperation of light.

original: de lta yin yang ji ltar 'ug pa rnams snang ba dang bral ba'i smag tu zas la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ji ltar mthong bar @78a * //
analyzed: de lta yin yang ji ltar 'ug pa rnams snang ba dang bral ba'i smag tu zas la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ji ltar mthong bar @78a * //
translated: In the same way, how do owls see things such as food in the darkness when there is no light?

original: 'gyur / khung na khung bur snang ba med par byi ba rnams kyis de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyur / khung na khung bur snang ba med par byi ba rnams kyis de bzhin no //
translated: In a hole, mice see in the absence of light.

original: bar du ma chod pa'i dngos po mig gis mthong ba yin na /🔽nya rnams kyis chu nang du ste /
analyzed: bar du ma chod pa'i dngos po mig gis mthong ba yin na / nya rnams kyis chu nang du ste /
translated: If the eye sees an object that is not obstructed,🔽then how do fish see in the water

original: rgya mtsho'i chus chod pa'i dngos po ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chus chod pa'i dngos po ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: an object that is obstructed by the water of the ocean?

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul so sor nges pa yin na /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i yul so sor nges pa yin na /
translated: If the object of the sense consciousnesses is determined,

original: sbrul rnams ni sbrul rnams te /
analyzed: sbrul rnams ni sbrul rnams te /
translated: then how do snakes,

original: mig gnyis kyis ji ltar thos pa dang mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gnyis kyis ji ltar thos pa dang mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: with their two eyes, hear and see?

original: de lta bu'i 'gal ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams ni /🔽dngos po rnams de bzhin du rnam pa du mar 'khor bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'gal ba gzhan dang gzhan rnams ni / dngos po rnams de bzhin du rnam pa du mar 'khor bar bstan pa ste /
translated: In this way, other contradictions

original: 'gal bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gal bar mthong ngo //
translated: are taught in many ways, and things are seen to be contradictory.

original: de lta bas na nye bar len pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar len pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, the cause of appropriation is inferred.

original: 'di ltar dngos po 'di dag gi dbye ba ni 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel ba dang rgyu'i dbye ba las yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po 'di dag gi dbye ba ni 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel ba dang rgyu'i dbye ba las yin no //
translated: Thus, the differentiation of things is due to the connection with contradictory properties and the differentiation of causes.

original: gal te yang dngos po rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu mi 'dod na de'i tshe 'ga' yang bye brag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po rnams kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu mi 'dod na de'i tshe 'ga' yang bye brag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that things have a cause that appropriates, then nothing would be differentiated.

original: bye brag med na yang sna tshogs pa bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag med na yang sna tshogs pa bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no differentiation, then the various would be undifferentiated.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi rgyur smra bar khas len pa thams cad bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi rgyur smra bar khas len pa thams cad bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Why would not all those who accept a cause of another aspect be happy or unhappy?

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu dang snang ba dang me long la sogs pa rnams kyis sa bon dang sdong bu dang bud shing gi byed pa rnams med kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu dang snang ba dang me long la sogs pa rnams kyis sa bon dang sdong bu dang bud shing gi byed pa rnams med kyang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, seeds, sprouts, and fuel would arise even without the activity of seeds, sprouts, and fuel, respectively, in a result, an appearance, a mirror, and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhar las byung ba'i rgyur smra ba bkag nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhar las byung ba'i rgyur smra ba bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the theory of a cause of another aspect,

original: sngar bstan pa nyid brtan par byed cing /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa nyid brtan par byed cing /
translated: the previously explained position is confirmed.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i dngos po las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i dngos po las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that apart from the entity of consciousness there is no other action,

original: gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The place, etc.”

original: goms pas dgra la phog pa'i skyes bus gnas dang gnas pa ma mthong ba'i 'phen la shes pa'i rtog pa ma rtogs par te /
analyzed: goms pas dgra la phog pa'i skyes bus gnas dang gnas pa ma mthong ba'i 'phen la shes pa'i rtog pa ma rtogs par te /
translated: A person who is skilled in striking an enemy through practice does not see a place and a stationed [target], but strikes without conceptualizing consciousness.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs par mi 'tshor bar phog pa ni mda' rnams 'bras bu dang bcas par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs par mi 'tshor bar phog pa ni mda' rnams 'bras bu dang bcas par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Without realizing the nature of consciousness, how could the arrows be successful?

original: chu yi rgyun ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chu yi rgyun ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The stream of water, etc.”

original: gal te chu'i rgyun dang 'dra bar 'byung ba rnam par rig pa ma yin par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te chu'i rgyun dang 'dra bar 'byung ba rnam par rig pa ma yin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the arising were not consciousness, like the stream of water,

original: de'i tshe gang cung zad bstan bcos gang gzung ba goms par ma byas kyang mi 'tshor te de nyid la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang cung zad bstan bcos gang gzung ba goms par ma byas kyang mi 'tshor te de nyid la gnas pa yin no //
translated: then at that time, one would not be able to strike even a little bit without realizing the treatise, but would remain right there.

original: 'di ltar sems las bstan bcos shor ba yang gzhan gyi rgyud las yang ci ltar gzung dgos zhes bya bar rigs /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems las bstan bcos shor ba yang gzhan gyi rgyud las yang ci ltar gzung dgos zhes bya bar rigs /
translated: In the same way, how could a treatise that is lost from the mind be held in the mind of another?

original: gang @78b 'gro ba bskyod pa'i rgyu dbang phyug yin par 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang @78b 'gro ba bskyod pa'i rgyu dbang phyug yin par 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that Īśvara is asserted to be the cause of the movement of the world,

original: ri bo rnams ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ri bo rnams ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “The mountains would not be high.”

original: gal te bya ba med na de ri bo rnams ni mtho bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bya ba med na de ri bo rnams ni mtho bar 'gyur /
translated: If there is no activity, the mountains would not be high.

original: de bzhin du rgya mtsho chen po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho chen po ste /
translated: Likewise, the great ocean

original: rgya mtsho gting dpag dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho gting dpag dka' ba'o //
translated: is difficult to fathom.

original: phra rab rnams ni 'dus pa yi ste /
analyzed: phra rab rnams ni 'dus pa yi ste /
translated: The subtle particles would not aggregate.

original: phra rab 'dus pa'i dngos por gyur pa gnyis 'dus pa dang gsum 'dus pa'i rim gyi ji ltar 'bras bur byed /
analyzed: phra rab 'dus pa'i dngos por gyur pa gnyis 'dus pa dang gsum 'dus pa'i rim gyi ji ltar 'bras bur byed /
translated: How could the result be produced by the aggregation of subtle particles, the aggregation of two subtle particles, the aggregation of three subtle particles, and so on?

original: gang gi phyir de rtag pa'i phyir rim mam cig car gyi don byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rtag pa'i phyir rim mam cig car gyi don byed par mi rigs so //
translated: Because he is permanent, it is illogical that he performs an action sequentially or simultaneously.

original: de lta bas na sna tshogs pa skye ba nyid kyi rgyu dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na sna tshogs pa skye ba nyid kyi rgyu dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because Īśvara is not the cause of the arising of the diversity,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he is also not the cause of destruction.

original: nus dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nus dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase “endowed with the capacity” is stated.🔽

original: dang gi sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The word “also” is a particle.

original: nus pa chen po dang ldan par 'bras bu byas na ni /
analyzed: nus pa chen po dang ldan par 'bras bu byas na ni /
translated: If one who possesses great power creates an effect,

original: de nyid smyon pa bzhin du yang ste /
analyzed: de nyid smyon pa bzhin du yang ste /
translated: then he is like a madman,

original: sna tshogs 'gag pa'i dus su bdag nyid kyi 'bad pa ji ltar 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'gag pa'i dus su bdag nyid kyi 'bad pa ji ltar 'jig par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: for how could he destroy his own effort at the time of the cessation of diversity?

original: de lta bas na dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa po nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa po nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that Īśvara, etc. are agents.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du mi 'dod na ji ltar sngags la nus pa yod ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du mi 'dod na ji ltar sngags la nus pa yod ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If one does not accept mere representation, how can a mantra have power?

original: khab long zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khab long zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, “A magnet, etc.”

original: khab long la sogs pas ni sbur long la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: khab long la sogs pas ni sbur long la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: “Magnet, etc.” includes a lodestone, etc.

original: 'dren pa ni lcags dang rtsva 'dren la de bzhin du sngags kyis dug zhi ba dang / sman gyis rims sel bar su zhig gis byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dren pa ni lcags dang rtsva 'dren la de bzhin du sngags kyis dug zhi ba dang / sman gyis rims sel bar su zhig gis byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Attraction” means that a magnet attracts iron and grass, and in the same way, a mantra pacifies poison and medicine cures a fever. Who does this?

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to conclude, he says,

original: de phyir ma rig sna tshogs pas //
analyzed: de phyir ma rig sna tshogs pas //
translated: Therefore, by the various non-cognitions,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: de'i phyir de dag thams cad gang cung zad sna tshogs pa'i dngos po phyi rol du snang ba de dag sems kyis sprul par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag thams cad gang cung zad sna tshogs pa'i dngos po phyi rol du snang ba de dag sems kyis sprul par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all of them, whatever things appear externally as various, are emanations of mind.

original: sems nyid goms pa'i stobs kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa snang ba las phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid goms pa'i stobs kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa snang ba las phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: By the power of the mind's cultivation, the various imagined natures appear, not external objects.

original: yang gang zhig ma rig pa'i sna tshogs ma rtogs pa de la bdag gis byar ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yang gang zhig ma rig pa'i sna tshogs ma rtogs pa de la bdag gis byar ci zhig yod /
translated: Moreover, what can I do for one who does not understand the various non-cognitions?

original: ci lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of person?

original: cog chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cog chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says the small bird, etc.

original: cog chung ni bya'i khyad par ro //🔽de'i sgra ni co ga'i sgra'o //
analyzed: cog chung ni bya'i khyad par ro // de'i sgra ni co ga'i sgra'o //
translated: The small bird is a particular bird.🔽Its sound is the sound of the small bird.

original: de'i sgra brnyan ni cog chung gi sgra brnyan te rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sgra brnyan ni cog chung gi sgra brnyan te rgya che ba'o //
translated: Its echo is the vast echo of the small bird.

original: cog chung gi sgra brnyan gyi gzhan cung zad 'di ltar mi shes te /🔽de bzhin du zhes @79a * //
analyzed: cog chung gi sgra brnyan gyi gzhan cung zad 'di ltar mi shes te / de bzhin du zhes @79a * //
translated: This small bird's echo is not known to be anything else.🔽Just so

original: bya ba'i dod do //
analyzed: bya ba'i dod do //
translated: is the equivalent of just as.

original: sems las phyi'i dod du mi 'dod na lung du 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: sems las phyi'i dod du mi 'dod na lung du 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you do not accept external objects as substitutes for mind, then you contradict scripture.

original: zad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text declares, “The yogi’s meditation on the totality of earth and so on.”

original: phyi'i don med na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zad par sgom pa ni sa la sogs pa sgom pa ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: phyi'i don med na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zad par sgom pa ni sa la sogs pa sgom pa ji ltar rigs /
translated: If external objects do not exist, how can yogis meditate on the totality of earth and so on?

original: gang gi phyir brtan pa'i rang bzhin dngos po rnams gzhan dang gzhan du gzhag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtan pa'i rang bzhin dngos po rnams gzhan dang gzhan du gzhag par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical to posit things that are by nature stable as different from each other.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi gzhung la zad par sgom pa grub pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi gzhung la zad par sgom pa grub pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir / des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate that in our own scriptures the meditation on the totality of earth and so on is established, the root text says,🔽“Therefore, the yogi’s meditation on the totality of earth and so on.”

original: des na ni rnam pa 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zad par sgom par rigs so //
analyzed: des na ni rnam pa 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zad par sgom par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, in this way, it is logical for yogis to meditate on the totality of earth and so on.

original: ci ltar sems 'di nyid shel bzhin du ni nor bu shel dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ci ltar sems 'di nyid shel bzhin du ni nor bu shel dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as this mind is like a crystal, so too is a crystal gem.

original: rnam pa du ma ni sa la sogs pa'i dngos po la khyab pa 'khrul pa goms pa de'i tshe zad par sgom par rigs kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma ni sa la sogs pa'i dngos po la khyab pa 'khrul pa goms pa de'i tshe zad par sgom par rigs kyi /
translated: When it is imbued with many aspects, such as the appearance of earth and so on, it is logical to meditate on the totality of earth and so on.

original: phyi'i don khas len pa'i rgyus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi'i don khas len pa'i rgyus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not due to accepting external objects.

original: ci ltar khyab ce na /🔽bag chags chu la til mar bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar khyab ce na / bag chags chu la til mar bzhin //
translated: How is it pervaded?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “Latent impressions are like oil in sesame seeds.”

original: ji ltar chu la til mar phyogs gcig tu btab pas thams cad du khyab pa de bzhin du bag chags kyi chu la sems kyis zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: ji ltar chu la til mar phyogs gcig tu btab pas thams cad du khyab pa de bzhin du bag chags kyi chu la sems kyis zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that just as oil pervades sesame seeds when oil is applied to one part, in the same way, the mind pervades the water of latent impressions.

original: de bzhin du sems tsam nyid du mos pa'i rnal 'byor pas ngo mtshar med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems tsam nyid du mos pa'i rnal 'byor pas ngo mtshar med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, in order to show that it is not surprising for yogins who are devoted to mind-only,

original: 'jig rten pa yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The world’s…” and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ngo mtshar rnams ni byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don la ngo mtshar du byed pa la ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ngo mtshar rnams ni byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol gyi don la ngo mtshar du byed pa la ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: The world’s wonders are not considered wonders by fools who take external objects to be wonders.

original: ngo mtshar nyid du mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo mtshar nyid du mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not considered to be wonders.

original: sa bon thams cad pa'i skra ni /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa'i skra ni /
translated: The hair of all seeds

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brjod de /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brjod de /
translated: is said to be the foundation consciousness.

original: 'di ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi sa bon nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi sa bon nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the seed of the evolving consciousnesses.

original: sa bon thams cad sa de las 'byung ba la sogs pa yod do //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad sa de las 'byung ba la sogs pa yod do //
translated: All seeds arise from that ground, etc.

original: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pas bsams te shes rab kyis rnam par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnal 'byor pas bsams te shes rab kyis rnam par nges par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the yogi should contemplate and ascertain with wisdom.

original: da ni gzhan gyi phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub par smra ba dgag pa'i phyir dris pa /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub par smra ba dgag pa'i phyir dris pa /
translated: Now, in order to refute the assertion that external objects are established by the valid cognition of direct perception, it is asked:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How? and so on.

original: ji ltar snang ba'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming gis snang ba thob pa gang yin pa de dag re zhig dngos 'di yod yin na ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba'i bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i ming gis snang ba thob pa gang yin pa de dag re zhig dngos 'di yod yin na ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The appearance of things like pots, cloth, etc., obtained through names, if they exist, are established.

original: de dag yod pa nyid du khyod kyis ji @79b ltar nges par gzung zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid du khyod kyis ji @79b ltar nges par gzung zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: How do you ascertain their existence? This is the question.

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu nas dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu nas dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to anticipate and refute the objections of others,

original: ae ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ae ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said Alas! and so on.

original: zhe na'i sgra ni gal te'i don to //
analyzed: zhe na'i sgra ni gal te'i don to //
translated: The word if means suppose.

original: gal te de rnams sems yin par rtogs na de'i tshe ae ma ste ngo mtshar ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de rnams sems yin par rtogs na de'i tshe ae ma ste ngo mtshar ba yin no //
translated: If you understand that they are mind, then, alas, they are amazing!

original: sems la rgyu med par khyed sdang bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: sems la rgyu med par khyed sdang bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right for you to be averse to mind without cause.

original: gang yin sems de nyid kyi rnam pa ci'i phyir mi 'dod dgos pa med pa'i phyi'i don gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang yin sems de nyid kyi rnam pa ci'i phyir mi 'dod dgos pa med pa'i phyi'i don gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: Why must you not accept that very mind itself has those aspects? What is the use of external objects that do not exist?

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don ni bag chags kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don ni bag chags kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because external objects are the result of habitual propensities.

original: gang gi tshe bag chags sems la gnas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bag chags sems la gnas pa de'i tshe /
translated: When habitual propensities reside in mind,

original: de nyid las 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid las 'bras bu 'byung ngo //
translated: then a result arises from that.

original: zhing la sa bon btab pas ri'i rtse mor 'bras bu mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhing la sa bon btab pas ri'i rtse mor 'bras bu mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when seeds are planted in a field, a result does not arise at the peak of a mountain.

original: gal te sems nyid don gyi rnam par snang na de'i tshe yang 'dzin pa nyid gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems nyid don gyi rnam par snang na de'i tshe yang 'dzin pa nyid gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If mind itself appears in the aspect of an object, then what is the nature of grasping?

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “consciousness,” and so on.

original: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization.

original: rnam par shes pa phyir byung nas yul rnams 'gul ba nas drangs nas ci 'dzin pa yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyir byung nas yul rnams 'gul ba nas drangs nas ci 'dzin pa yin nam /
translated: Or does consciousness emerge externally and then apprehend objects after it has been drawn back in?

original: gang gi phyir ma bzung na 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma bzung na 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Or else, if it does not apprehend them, how could it be apprehending?

original: gang gi phyir bag chags kyi mthus de'i rnam pa de yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bag chags kyi mthus de'i rnam pa de yin te /
translated: Because of the power of latent propensities, it has that aspect.

original: de bas na de'i rnam pa sems la skye ba nyid 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rnam pa sems la skye ba nyid 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the arising of that aspect in the mind is apprehending, but not anything else.

original: gzhan yang ci sems de thog ma nas yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba'i phyogs gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci sems de thog ma nas yod dam 'on te med ces bya ba'i phyogs gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, is the mind that exists from the beginning or not?

original: de la gal te thog ma nas yod na de'i rnam pa nyid sems las skyes pa yin na dus phyis 'byung ba'i yul gzung ba la dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de la gal te thog ma nas yod na de'i rnam pa nyid sems las skyes pa yin na dus phyis 'byung ba'i yul gzung ba la dgos pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If it exists from the beginning, then if its aspect arises from the mind, what need is there for it to apprehend an object that arises later?

original: gal te thog mar med la phyis byung bas yul 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thog mar med la phyis byung bas yul 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: If you say that it apprehends an object because it arises later,

original: de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de'i tshe don 'gag pa'i phyir de gang gis 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe don 'gag pa'i phyir de gang gis 'dzin pa yin /
translated: At that time, the object has ceased, so what is it apprehending?

original: lhan cig skyes pa yin na phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa med pas ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yin na phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa med pas ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur /
translated: If they were co-emergent, then since there would be no benefit to be received or benefactor, how could they be the entities of object apprehended and subject apprehender?

original: de lta bas na mngon sum gyis phyi'i don ma grub bo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum gyis phyi'i don ma grub bo zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that external objects are not established by direct perception.

original: gang zhig yang rjes su dpag pas phyi'i don grub par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang zhig yang rjes su dpag pas phyi'i don grub par 'dod de /
