translated: Now, if you assert that external objects are established by inference,

original: 'di ltar ji srid phyi'i don gyis rang dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa ma bskyed pa de srid du de'i rnam par ji ltar snang /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid phyi'i don gyis rang dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa ma bskyed pa de srid du de'i rnam par ji ltar snang /
translated: then, as long as external objects do not generate consciousness in their likeness, how could the aspect of that object appear?

original: de'i phyir don gyis bskyed pa nyid la don gzung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyis bskyed pa nyid la don gzung zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only that which is generated by the object that is called the apprehension of the object.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /🔽rmi lam la sogs pa @80a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te / rmi lam la sogs pa @80a * //
translated: But that is not so.

original: bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like dreams and so on, there is no invariable concomitance and no reversal.

original: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa las kyang ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa las kyang ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that external objects are not established by inference.

original: gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas ma grub kyang lung gis grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas ma grub kyang lung gis grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that although they are not established by direct perception and inference, they are established by scripture,

original: lung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent says, “Scripture, etc.”

original: lung ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung tshad mas phyi'i don yang dag par rtogs par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: lung ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung tshad mas phyi'i don yang dag par rtogs par grub pa yin te /
translated: Scripture is the speech of the Bhagavat Buddha, which is authoritative. It is established that it is the means of knowing external objects.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat has said, “The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.”

original: 'dir lan smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa /
translated: Here, the reply is:

original: mngon sum don la lung ci dgos //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum don la lung ci dgos // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What need is there for scripture with regard to the object of perception?

original: mngon sum gyi don gang yin pa de la lung gis dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don gang yin pa de la lung gis dgos pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What need is there for scripture with regard to the object of perception?

original: lung gi tshig kyang ga la zhe na /
analyzed: lung gi tshig kyang ga la zhe na /
translated: Where is there a statement of scripture?

original: mi snang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi snang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The reply is, “It does not appear.”

original: gang dbang po las 'das pa'i dngos po 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i don mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa de la lung gis gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs so //
analyzed: gang dbang po las 'das pa'i dngos po 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i don mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa de la lung gis gsungs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs so //
translated: That which is beyond the senses, such as the world beyond, is not the object of perception. One understands it by following the statements of scripture.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te phyi'i don yod na de mngon sum nyid kyis yongs su bcad pas lung gi tshig gis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don yod na de mngon sum nyid kyis yongs su bcad pas lung gi tshig gis ci zhig bya /
translated: If external objects exist, they are completely determined by direct perception itself. What is the use of the words of scripture?

original: 'on te med na de yang lung gi tshig gis ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on te med na de yang lung gi tshig gis ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But if they do not exist, they are not established by the words of scripture. This is the meaning.

original: de bas na de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: drang ba'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: drang ba'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because they have a different purport, etc.

original: lung gi tshig gis kyang phyi'i don yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: lung gi tshig gis kyang phyi'i don yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: External objects are not established by the words of scripture.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: drang ba'i don yin phyir yang ste //
analyzed: drang ba'i don yin phyir yang ste //
translated: Because they have a different purport.

original: 'di ltar drang ba'i don du bstan pa thams cad ni rnam pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar drang ba'i don du bstan pa thams cad ni rnam pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, all teachings that have a different purport should be explained in four ways.

original: de la dgongs pa ni gang la dgongs nas sgra sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dgongs pa ni gang la dgongs nas sgra sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Therein, the intention is that for which the words are employed.

original: skye bo gdul bya'i yul ni gang dag la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo gdul bya'i yul ni gang dag la bstan pa'o //
translated: The domain of beings to be trained is that for which they are taught.

original: 'bras bu ni gang la bstan pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gang la bstan pas grub pa'o //
translated: The result is that which is accomplished by the teaching.

original: rgyu na ni gang gis mngon par 'dod pa'i don brtags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu na ni gang gis mngon par 'dod pa'i don brtags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause is that by which the intended meaning is investigated.

original: yang 'dir ni dgongs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'dir ni dgongs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the intention is stated.

original: 'dir dgongs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: smras pa / kha cig gis bdag mthong ba po nyid dang / za ba po la sogs par 'dod pa de spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / kha cig gis bdag mthong ba po nyid dang / za ba po la sogs par 'dod pa de spang ba'i phyir /
translated: It is said: In order to abandon the assertion by some that the self is the seer, the experiencer, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams //
translated: the sense bases of form, etc.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa mdzad de /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa mdzad de /
translated: were taught by the Bhagavān.

original: 'di ltar yul so sor nges pa la dbang po rnams yid mthong ba po dang yul gang la gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul so sor nges pa la dbang po rnams yid mthong ba po dang yul gang la gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: Thus, when the sense faculties are determined in relation to their individual objects, where should the mind be placed among the sense objects?

original: bstan pa sems @80b kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: bstan pa sems @80b kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of mind is taught.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is said.

original: sems nyid la yul dang dbang po'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid la yul dang dbang po'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag gi phyi'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the nature of the sense objects and sense faculties is established in the mind itself, not in external objects.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: rang gi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said: one's own seeds, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rkyen gzhan gyi bag chags kyi nus pa'i khyad par sad par byas pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen gzhan gyi bag chags kyi nus pa'i khyad par sad par byas pas /
translated: Because the specific potency of the latent tendencies of other conditions is activated,

original: rang gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las de ma thag tu 'byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / dbang por brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las de ma thag tu 'byung ba mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / dbang por brjod do //
translated: The eye consciousness arises immediately from the store consciousness, which is its seed.

original: de bas na de nyid kyang sems yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyang sems yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is also mind.

original: bag chags kyi dbang gis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa yul gzugs kyi rnam par skyes pa yul du shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang gis sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa yul gzugs kyi rnam par skyes pa yul du shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called the eye faculty because it is the basis for the arising of the consciousness that perceives objects such as blue, yellow, etc., due to the influence of the latent impressions.

original: rnam par shes pa don dam par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas ji ltar bye brag tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don dam par tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas ji ltar bye brag tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since consciousness is ultimately non-different, how can it be differentiated by the distinction between faculties and objects?

original: 'di dag blo yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag blo yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, “These are to be understood as mind.”

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams phyi'i don nyid kyi dbang po dang yul gyi ngo bor gyur pa med do zhes blos nges par bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams phyi'i don nyid kyi dbang po dang yul gyi ngo bor gyur pa med do zhes blos nges par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the eye, form, etc. are not external objects that exist as faculties and objects.

original: don dam par sems la cha shas med mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam par sems la cha shas med mod kyi /
translated: Although consciousness is ultimately partless,

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas mkhas pas dbang po dang yul gyi sgo nas cha shas su sems la brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas mkhas pas dbang po dang yul gyi sgo nas cha shas su sems la brtags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wise one, on the basis of the conventional truth of the world, has analyzed the mind into parts in terms of the sense faculties and their objects.

original: don dam par ni yang /
analyzed: don dam par ni yang /
translated: But ultimately,

original: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Here, there is no eye,” etc.

original: 'di la ni sems te ;
analyzed: 'di la ni sems te ;
translated: Here, there is no mind.

original: mig ni dbang por brtags pa de med do //
analyzed: mig ni dbang por brtags pa de med do //
translated: The eye, imagined as a sense faculty, does not exist.

original: gzugs min ni yul du brtags pa mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs min ni yul du brtags pa mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Nor is form, imagined as an object, tenable.

original: snang ba med cing yid byed med pa ni lhan cig byed par brtags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med cing yid byed med pa ni lhan cig byed par brtags pa med pa'o //
translated: Nor is there any appearance, nor any mental activity, imagined as a cooperating condition.

original: gang gi tshe bag chags kyi dbang gis brtags pa'i rnam pa 'khrul pa'i sems las byung ba de'i tshe kun rdzob tu thams cad yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bag chags kyi dbang gis brtags pa'i rnam pa 'khrul pa'i sems las byung ba de'i tshe kun rdzob tu thams cad yod pa yin no //
translated: When, due to the power of habitual tendencies, the mind arises in the aspect of an error, then everything exists conventionally.🔽But ultimately, not even the slightest thing exists.

original: don dam par ni chung zad kyang med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par ni chung zad kyang med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Like a dream.”

original: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi ngo bo don med pa las don gyi rnam par 'khrul pa'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi ngo bo don med pa las don gyi rnam par 'khrul pa'i sems skye ste /
translated: Thus, the mind arises from the unrealized object in a dream, in the aspect of an unrealized object.

original: de'i tshe don yod pa'i rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe don yod pa'i rnam par snang ngo //
translated: At that time, it appears in the aspect of an existent object.

original: gang gi tshe yang sad pa de'i tshe chung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang sad pa de'i tshe chung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But when one awakens, there is not even the slightest existent object.

original: gang gi tshe thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam yin la phyi'i don med na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sdig pa'i grogs po bsten pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba nges par ji ltar grub ce na /🔽bzang dang ngan pa'i @81a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam yin la phyi'i don med na dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sdig pa'i grogs po bsten pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba nges par ji ltar grub ce na / bzang dang ngan pa'i @81a * //
translated: When everything is representation-only and there are no external objects, how is it that the performance of good and bad actions is definitely established from reliance on a spiritual teacher and a bad friend?

original: grogs bsten las //
analyzed: grogs bsten las //
translated: From reliance on good and bad friends,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: bzang dang ngan pa'i grogs bstan pa las te /
analyzed: bzang dang ngan pa'i grogs bstan pa las te /
translated: From reliance on good and bad friends,

original: bzang po dang bzang po ma yin pa dang 'brel bas sems can gyi rgyud la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de gzhan gyi sems kyi dbang gis byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bzang po dang bzang po ma yin pa dang 'brel bas sems can gyi rgyud la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de gzhan gyi sems kyi dbang gis byung ba yin no //
translated: from association with good and bad people, the difference in the performance of good and bad actions in the mental continuum of sentient beings arises by the power of the mind of another.

original: gang gi tshe srog chags rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang sdig pa'i grogs po'i spyod pa bslab par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe srog chags rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang sdig pa'i grogs po'i spyod pa bslab par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When living beings wish to train in the conduct of a spiritual teacher or a sinful friend,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then, by the power of the consciousness of a spiritual teacher or a sinful friend, the aspects of virtue and nonvirtue arise.🔽This is the meaning.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de yang 'byung pos gzung stsogs bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang 'byung pos gzung stsogs bzhin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like the possession of spirits, etc.

original: dper na 'byung pos gzung ba rnams sems kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi khrag la sogs pa 'dren par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na 'byung pos gzung ba rnams sems kyi dbang gis sems can rnams kyi khrag la sogs pa 'dren par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, it is like the possession of spirits, by the power of the mind, draws out the blood, etc., of living beings. This is also like that.

original: gang gi tshe thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam yin na /
translated: When everything is mere representation,

original: ra lug la sogs pa shan pas gsod ce na /
analyzed: ra lug la sogs pa shan pas gsod ce na /
translated: why do butchers, etc., kill sheep, etc.?

original: nye ba'i rim pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nye ba'i rim pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because of proximity, etc.

original: ra lug rnams gzhan gyi lus dang nye ba'i rim pas gsad par ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ra lug rnams gzhan gyi lus dang nye ba'i rim pas gsad par ni mi 'dod de /
translated: It is not maintained that sheep and goats are killed by the proximity of another's body,

original: de dag skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are momentary.

original: gang gi phyir phung po rnams skad cig re rer gyur pa 'jig pa la rgyu med pa yin no //

original: de bzhin du yi dvags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi dvags zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The yakṣas are born from moisture, but not

original: 'dir yang las sna tshogs pas chu bo gcig la yang rnag tu 'brub cing de bzhin du bshad gci rnyog pa dang ldan @83a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang las sna tshogs pas chu bo gcig la yang rnag tu 'brub cing de bzhin du bshad gci rnyog pa dang ldan @83a * //
translated: Here also, due to various karmas, the same river appears as pus to the hungry ghosts, as urine and excrement to the animals, and as a pure river to humans.

original: na ; phyis dang gcin 'dres pa'i rnyog pa dang ldan par yi dvags kyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: na ; phyis dang gcin 'dres pa'i rnyog pa dang ldan par yi dvags kyis mthong ngo //
translated: Later, the hungry ghosts see the river as filled with a mixture of feces and urine.

original: de bzhin du chu bo de nyid la mi yis chu bo dri ma med par mthong ba dang ni 'thung ba yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu bo de nyid la mi yis chu bo dri ma med par mthong ba dang ni 'thung ba yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, humans see the river as a pure river and drink from it.

original: 'di dag thams cad phyi'i don yin na 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad phyi'i don yin na 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: If all of these are external objects, there is a contradiction.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: dge min dge zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dge min dge zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “unwholesome and wholesome, etc.”

original: mi dge ba dang dge ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam pa las kyi bag chags kyis bsgos pas ni de dang de'i las kyis bsgos pas phyi'i don stong pa rnam par shes pa gal te 'di nyid la 'jug na /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang dge ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam pa las kyi bag chags kyis bsgos pas ni de dang de'i las kyis bsgos pas phyi'i don stong pa rnam par shes pa gal te 'di nyid la 'jug na /
translated: If consciousness, empty of external objects, enters into this, i.e., the appearance of the results of unwholesome and wholesome karma, due to being imbued with the latent tendencies of karma,

original: de'i tshe 'di dag thams cad la 'gal ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dag thams cad la 'gal ba med pa yin no //
translated: then at that time there is no contradiction in all of this.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig du mar ci ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig du mar ci ltar snang zhe na /
translated: How can consciousness appear as one and many?🔽The verse states:

original: ae ma'o yul ni sna tshogs pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ae ma'o yul ni sna tshogs pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Amazing! The variety of objects

original: ae ma'o ni ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: ae ma'o ni ngo mtshar ro //
translated: Amazing! means “astonishing.”

original: rnam par shes pa 'di yul gyi rnam pa nyid sna tshogs rnams te tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di yul gyi rnam pa nyid sna tshogs rnams te tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: This consciousness is the variety of the aspects of the objects themselves, which are different.

original: dus gcig la ni du ma ru ste /
analyzed: dus gcig la ni du ma ru ste /
translated: At one time, it is many,

original: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: following the variety of conceptualizations.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rol mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rol mo'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states:🔽Like the sound of a musical instrument,

original: ji ltar rol mo'i tshogs kyi sgra bzhin te rol mo'i tshogs kyi sgra dal ba dang drag pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas sna tshogs pa'i rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rol mo'i tshogs kyi sgra bzhin te rol mo'i tshogs kyi sgra dal ba dang drag pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas sna tshogs pa'i rtog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba de bzhin du /
translated: Like the sound of a musical instrument, which follows the variety of conceptualizations through the distinctions of slow and fast, etc.,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is the meaning of “consciousness.”

original: da ni don med pa don byed par mi rigs pa ni 'dir tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni don med pa don byed par mi rigs pa ni 'dir tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, the unreasonableness of a nonexistent object performing a function is taught here in three verses.

original: gal te don yod don byed nyid //
analyzed: gal te don yod don byed nyid //
translated: If the object exists, it does not perform a function.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is meant by the above passage.

original: gal te phyi'i don gyis don gyi bya ba byed par gyur pa dang / de med na yang de ru mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don gyis don gyi bya ba byed par gyur pa dang / de med na yang de ru mi 'gyur na /
translated: If external objects perform the function of objects, and if they do not exist, then it would not be so,

original: de'i tshe khyod kyi rtsod pa 'jug par rigs na /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyod kyi rtsod pa 'jug par rigs na /
translated: then it would be right for you to argue.

original: gang gi phyir phyi'i don gyi stong pa la don byed par snang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi'i don gyi stong pa la don byed par snang ngo //
translated: But because external objects are empty, they appear to perform functions.

original: gang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said “another person,” and so on.

original: gzhan skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis se'u ni bal po se'u la sogs pa zos pas gzhan gyi kha nas chu 'dzag 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gzhan skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis se'u ni bal po se'u la sogs pa zos pas gzhan gyi kha nas chu 'dzag 'gyur te ;
translated: When another person eats a mango, for example, saliva flows from the mouth.

original: rlan gyis khyab par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rlan gyis khyab par gyur pa yin no //
translated: It becomes saturated with moisture.

original: gal te yang don gyis don byed par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang don gyis don byed par gyur pa yin na /
translated: If external objects perform the function of objects,

original: de'i tshe gang dag bal po se'u za ba de nyid kyis rlan 'dzag pa'i bya ba byed par rigs kyi yang don gzhan gyis gzhan gyi bya ba byed pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang dag bal po se'u za ba de nyid kyis rlan 'dzag pa'i bya ba byed par rigs kyi yang don gzhan gyis gzhan gyi bya ba byed pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: then it would be right that the very person who eats the mango would perform the function of the flow of saliva, but it is not right that another object performs the function of another.

original: de lta bas na don byed yod pas don @83b byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na don byed yod pas don @83b byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of “non-existent” is that it does not perform a function.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “at night, etc.”

original: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis grus za ba la gzhan 'ga' zhig gis dris pa na ste /
analyzed: skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis grus za ba la gzhan 'ga' zhig gis dris pa na ste /
translated: When someone is eating a pomegranate, if someone else asks,

original: khyod ci za zhes dris pa na de la gal te se'u za zhes smras na ste /
analyzed: khyod ci za zhes dris pa na de la gal te se'u za zhes smras na ste /
translated: “What are you eating?” if he says, “I’m eating a pomegranate,”

original: bal po se'u za'o zhes smras na de'i tshe thos pas rlan gyis bya ba'i 'gyur ba ci mi bskyed dam /
analyzed: bal po se'u za'o zhes smras na de'i tshe thos pas rlan gyis bya ba'i 'gyur ba ci mi bskyed dam /
translated: then, when he hears the word “pomegranate,” does he not experience a change in his mental continuum?

original: de lta bas na don byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it does not perform a function.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽rmi lam du bde ba thob pa'i rgyu med las te /
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rmi lam du bde ba thob pa'i rgyu med las te /
translated: he says, “in a dream, etc.”🔽In a dream, is it not the case that semen is emitted without a cause for the attainment of pleasure,

original: 'dod pa'i bud med dang phrad pa med par yang khu ba shor ba 'byung ba min nam ci /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bud med dang phrad pa med par yang khu ba shor ba 'byung ba min nam ci /
translated: without the contact with a desired woman?

original: de bas na don yod pas don byed par ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don yod pas don byed par ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not established that the existent performs a function.

original: gang zhig rmi lam du yod pa'i nga rgyal de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig rmi lam du yod pa'i nga rgyal de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the pride of one who is in a dream,

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In a dream, etc.”

original: gal te 'ga' zhig rmi lam du mthong ba'i don la yod par 'dzin pa ni goms pa'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig rmi lam du mthong ba'i don la yod par 'dzin pa ni goms pa'i stobs kyis te /
translated: If someone were to apprehend the object seen in a dream as existent, it is by the power of habituation,

original: sngon goms pa'i bag chags kyi nus pas yod pa de dag dpe 'dis sel te /
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i bag chags kyi nus pas yod pa de dag dpe 'dis sel te /
translated: by the power of the latent potentialities of prior habituation.

original: dper na gzhon nu ma sbrum ma bu skyes pa ni 'di ltar rmi lam du mthong ba de ni 'di ltar rigs ldan min te /
analyzed: dper na gzhon nu ma sbrum ma bu skyes pa ni 'di ltar rmi lam du mthong ba de ni 'di ltar rigs ldan min te /
translated: For example, a young woman who is not pregnant sees in a dream that she has given birth to a child.

original: rigs pas 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pas 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not logical that she has given birth to a child, because it is not related to reality.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam gyi don yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam gyi don yod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “The object seen in a dream does not exist” is similar.

original: gzhan du na gang gzhon nu ma nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan du na gang gzhon nu ma nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Otherwise, she would not be a young woman,

original: bu yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and she would see the child.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make this point clearer,

original: khang pa'i nang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khang pa'i nang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In a house, etc.”

original: dpe 'dis kyang rmi lam du mthong ba'i dpe'i don med par ston te /
analyzed: dpe 'dis kyang rmi lam du mthong ba'i dpe'i don med par ston te /
translated: This example also shows that the object seen in a dream does not exist.

original: dper na khang pa'i nang du ni khang pa'i nang ste /
analyzed: dper na khang pa'i nang du ni khang pa'i nang ste /
translated: For example, in a house, the inside of the house is seen in a dream,

original: dus yun ring po dang lam dang ri dang / de bzhin du yul rnams kyang cig car rnam pa tha dad de /
analyzed: dus yun ring po dang lam dang ri dang / de bzhin du yul rnams kyang cig car rnam pa tha dad de /
translated: and the road, the mountain, and likewise the various countries are seen simultaneously,

original: so so'i dngos po rnams kyi rmi lam du mthong ba bskyed pa de'i tshe rmi lam mthong ba yod min zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so so'i dngos po rnams kyi rmi lam du mthong ba bskyed pa de'i tshe rmi lam mthong ba yod min zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the individual things are seen in a dream. At that time, the seeing of the dream does not exist. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams phyi rol du gyur pa bkag nas rnam par rig pa gzhan yang yul gyi dngos po yin pa dgag pa'i phyir /🔽rnam par rig pa'ang rnam rig gis //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams phyi rol du gyur pa bkag nas rnam par rig pa gzhan yang yul gyi dngos po yin pa dgag pa'i phyir / rnam par rig pa'ang rnam rig gis //
translated: Thus, having refuted external form, etc., in order to refute the other cognition that is the object,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Cognition is not cognized by cognition,” and so on.

original: rnam par rig pa'ang rnam par rig par gzhan gyi don min te yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'ang rnam par rig par gzhan gyi don min te yul ma yin no //
translated: Cognition is not cognized by cognition, i.e., it is not an object.

original: gal te yang 'ga' zhig yin par 'dod nas de'i tshe de'i grub pa'i mtha' ni dus gcig pa nyid du @84a * //
analyzed: gal te yang 'ga' zhig yin par 'dod nas de'i tshe de'i grub pa'i mtha' ni dus gcig pa nyid du @84a * //
translated: If it is asserted that it is something, then at that time its tenet is that it is simultaneous.

original: 'gyur ro // rgyud gcig pa nyid du 'dod na nges par rags pa'i gnas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // rgyud gcig pa nyid du 'dod na nges par rags pa'i gnas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you assert that there is a single continuum, then it would definitely attain the state of a gross object.

original: nges par ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nges par ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “Definitely” means “conceptually.”

original: rags pa'i dngos po bzhin du yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo'i gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rags pa'i dngos po bzhin du yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo'i gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would attain the state of an object and a subject, like a gross object.

original: de gnyis yul dang yul can du mi rigs te /
analyzed: de gnyis yul dang yul can du mi rigs te /
translated: Those two are not reasonable as object and subject.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid kyi yul ni ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid kyi yul ni ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the object of a condition of observation is an entity.

original: de yang 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable because a long time has passed since it ceased.

original: 'das ma thag pa ni de'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa ni de'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
translated: The immediately preceding is the condition of immediate antecedence, not the condition of observation, because it has just passed.

original: gzhan du na mig gi dbang po yang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mig gi dbang po yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the eye faculty would also be that.

original: skad cig gnyis pa de med pa'i phyir ji ltar yul nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa de med pa'i phyir ji ltar yul nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since that second moment does not exist, how could it be an object? This is the meaning.

original: gzhan yang rags pa'i gnas thob 'gyur ni brtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan yang rags pa'i gnas thob 'gyur ni brtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, if it attained the state of a gross object, it would be a conceptual consciousness. This is the meaning.

original: de lta mod kyi gzhan sems dus mnyam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir de'i yul nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gzhan sems dus mnyam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir de'i yul nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, it is the object of that knowledge, because it apprehends the simultaneous mind of another.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The mind of another, etc.

original: gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa'i yul rnal 'byor ba'i sa gang shes pa'ang de yang shes pa kho na min te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la sogs pa'i yul rnal 'byor ba'i sa gang shes pa'ang de yang shes pa kho na min te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The object of the mind of another, etc. is not known by the yogi, because it is not known.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rang gi sems kyis mos pa bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis mos pa bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like the imagination of one’s own mind.

original: 'di ltar rang gi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi bdag nyid de /
translated: Thus, it is one’s own mind.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyi sems kyis 'das pa khong du chud snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyi sems kyis 'das pa khong du chud snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
translated: The thought that one understands the past by one’s own mind is mere conceit.

original: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this is just like that.

original: gzhan yang dus mnyam du 'dzin to zhes smras pa de la yang skad cig ma yin pa'i ji ltar dus mnyam zhes bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus mnyam du 'dzin to zhes smras pa de la yang skad cig ma yin pa'i ji ltar dus mnyam zhes bya /
translated: Moreover, you say that it apprehends the simultaneous mind of another. But how can it be simultaneous if it is momentary?

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyi sems kyang gnyis su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyi sems kyang gnyis su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the mind of another is not twofold.

original: de ji ltar yul gyi rang bzhin nyid yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar yul gyi rang bzhin nyid yin /
translated: How can it be the nature of an object?

original: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa phyogs gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i shes pa phyogs gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nondual cognition is not one-sided,

original: kun du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is all-pervading.

original: 'di ltar sems tsam la gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems tsam la gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is said that one abides in mind-only.

original: 'di ltar phyi'i don med na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid gzung ba med par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i rang bzhin grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i don med na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid gzung ba med par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa don dam pa'i rang bzhin grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, if external objects do not exist, because there is no object and subject, the nondual mind itself is said to be without an object, and is established as the ultimate nature. This is the meaning.

original: gal te brjod par bya ba ma yin la gzung bar bya ba don dam par yin na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ston par mdzad cing /
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba ma yin la gzung bar bya ba don dam par yin na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ston par mdzad cing /
translated: If it is not an object of expression, and is the ultimate object, how is it that the Lord taught it,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'dzin par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'dzin par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: and how is it that the bodhisattvas do not apprehend it?

original: kun rdzob bden shes thams @84b cad la //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden shes thams @84b cad la //
translated: He says, “All those who know the conventional truth,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gang chung zad kun rdzob dang ldan pa'i shes pa thams cad la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang chung zad kun rdzob dang ldan pa'i shes pa thams cad la /
translated: and so on.🔽All those who have some knowledge of the conventional

original: mkhas pa dang ni gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: mkhas pa dang ni gzhan dag gis //
translated: and the wise

original: gzung ba dang ni ston pa la //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni ston pa la //
translated: And in the teaching,

original: mtshungs pa kho nar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa kho nar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: they function in exactly the same way,

original: mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
translated: not in a different way.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes ni ma yin te /
translated: But not in the case of the knowledge of the ultimate,

original: de brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is inexpressible.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: kun rdzob kyis ston par byed pa dang / bstan par bya ba'i tha snyad du 'jug gi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyis ston par byed pa dang / bstan par bya ba'i tha snyad du 'jug gi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: The conventional functions in the teaching and the taught, but not the ultimate.

original: da ni chos la bdag med pa mthong bas rnal 'byor ba rnams snang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chos la bdag med pa mthong bas rnal 'byor ba rnams snang ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the result of the vision of the yogi of the selflessness of phenomena,

original: stong nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: stong nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Emptiness,” and so on.

original: dang po ru ni snga ma ru'o //
analyzed: dang po ru ni snga ma ru'o //
translated: “First” means “previously.”

original: chos thams cad phyi'i gzugs la sogs pas stong ngo zhes gang gi tshe de kho na nyid mthong ba skyes pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: chos thams cad phyi'i gzugs la sogs pas stong ngo zhes gang gi tshe de kho na nyid mthong ba skyes pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the yogi sees reality, he sees that all phenomena are empty of external forms and so on.

original: mi snang ba'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi snang ba'i 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: At that time, it is not only the result of nonappearance,

original: gang ji srid snang ba kho na'i 'bras chen yin te /
analyzed: gang ji srid snang ba kho na'i 'bras chen yin te /
translated: but also the great result of appearance,

original: de las skyes pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de las skyes pa ma yin no ;
translated: because it is not born from that.

original: / gang gi phyir chos la bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa thob pa 'di rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir chos la bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa thob pa 'di rnal 'byor pa /
translated: Because of seeing the selflessness of phenomena, one attains fearlessness.

original: 'jig rten gzhan bzhin 'jigs pa med de 'khor ba pa bzhin du 'jigs pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan bzhin 'jigs pa med de 'khor ba pa bzhin du 'jigs pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This yogi is fearless like one in another world, fearless like a transmigrator.

original: gal te yang stong pa nyid mthong ba des 'chi ba'i chos las ma 'das pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yang stong pa nyid mthong ba des 'chi ba'i chos las ma 'das pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if one sees emptiness, is one not beyond the phenomena of death?

original: de lta bas na yang de ji ltar 'jigs pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na yang de ji ltar 'jigs pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: So how can one be fearless?

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Death, etc.

original: gang bdag nyid kyi 'chi ba dang ni skye ba nyid /
analyzed: gang bdag nyid kyi 'chi ba dang ni skye ba nyid /
translated: One’s own death and birth

original: sprul pa 'dra ba ni sprul pa'i skyes bu lta bur bzhed de /
analyzed: sprul pa 'dra ba ni sprul pa'i skyes bu lta bur bzhed de /
translated: are like an emanation, like an emanated person.

original: de la ji ltar na rnam pa gang gis kyang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med ces bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de la ji ltar na rnam pa gang gis kyang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med ces bya ba'i don to ;
translated: In that case, how can there be no fear of death?

original: / lam thob pa la'ang 'jigs pa yod na lam tshol ba ni nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: / lam thob pa la'ang 'jigs pa yod na lam tshol ba ni nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there is fear even in attaining the path, then the search for the path is lost.

original: 'di dag las kyi sprul nyid du //
analyzed: 'di dag las kyi sprul nyid du //
translated: These are just emanations.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: gang mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa des 'di dag las kyi sprul pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni ma yin no zhes sa gsum po yang shes pa yin /
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa des 'di dag las kyi sprul pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bor grub pa ni ma yin no zhes sa gsum po yang shes pa yin /
translated: The yogi who abides in the path of seeing knows that these are emanations of karma and not established as his own nature.

original: gal te phyir yang 'jigs 'gyur na ste /
analyzed: gal te phyir yang 'jigs 'gyur na ste /
translated: If one is afraid again,

original: 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa de ltar yin na /
analyzed: 'khor ba pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa de ltar yin na /
translated: if the fear of the suffering of cyclic existence is like that,

original: bdag cag 'dra ba de kho na nyid ma mthong bas lam 'dis spang bar 'dod pa ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir nyams zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mthong @85a * //
analyzed: bdag cag 'dra ba de kho na nyid ma mthong bas lam 'dis spang bar 'dod pa ngal ba 'bras bu med pa'i phyir nyams zhes bya ba'i don to // mthong @85a * //
translated: then those like us, who have not seen reality, desire to abandon it by this path. The meaning of “deterioration” is that it is fruitless.🔽The yogi who abides in the path of seeing

original: ba'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor bas bdag nyams par rtog pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor bas bdag nyams par rtog pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: has no reason to think that he has deteriorated.🔽To demonstrate this, it is said,

original: yan lag mchog ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yan lag mchog ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The supreme limb, etc.

original: 'di ltar yan lag mchog ni ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yan lag mchog ni ste /
translated: Thus, the supreme limb

original: mgo bo gnyis pa dang / de bzhin mig ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: mgo bo gnyis pa dang / de bzhin mig ni gsum pa ste /
translated: is the second head and the third eye,

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist.

original: gnyis po de dag med na skyes bu su zhig bcad pa dang phyung bar dogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis po de dag med na skyes bu su zhig bcad pa dang phyung bar dogs par 'gyur /
translated: If those two do not exist, then what person would fear being cut or pierced?

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis med pas de'i sdug bsngal gyis ji ltar gnod par dogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis med pas de'i sdug bsngal gyis ji ltar gnod par dogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, the yogi/nī abiding in the path of seeing, because of the non-existence of the imagined nature, how could he/she fear being harmed by its suffering?

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam la gnas pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam la gnas pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the yogi/nī abiding in the path of seeing has abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa ma yin te /
translated: He/she has not abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: de ltas blo dang ldan pas yul 'di rnam par nges //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltas blo dang ldan pas yul 'di rnam par nges // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the wise should ascertain this object.

original: de ltas ni sngar gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de ltas ni sngar gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Therefore, by the previously explained process, the wise, the learned,

original: yul 'di rnam par nges pa ni phyi'i don med par rnam par nges pa yin no //🔽blo dang ldan pa ni mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: yul 'di rnam par nges pa ni phyi'i don med par rnam par nges pa yin no //🔽blo dang ldan pa ni mkhas pa'o //
translated: should ascertain this object, the non-existence of external objects.

original: gal te yang lhag pa'i dri ma dang 'dres pa rnam par bsgoms pas kyang ni lhag pa'i sgra ni 'byung po la sogs pa la brjod do //
analyzed: gal te yang lhag pa'i dri ma dang 'dres pa rnam par bsgoms pas kyang ni lhag pa'i sgra ni 'byung po la sogs pa la brjod do //
translated: Even though it is cultivated mixed with the remaining stains, the word “remaining” refers to the bhutas, etc.

original: de nyid ni dri ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni dri ma ste /
translated: That itself is a stain.

original: lhag pa'i dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i dri ma rnams so //
translated: The remaining stains.

original: 'dres pa ni phan tshun 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni phan tshun 'dres pa'o //
translated: Mixed means mutually mixed.

original: bsgoms pas kyang ste zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pas kyang ste zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: Even though it is cultivated, it is still overwhelmed.

original: de bzhin du yang shin tu dag pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri mas nam yang dri ma ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang shin tu dag pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri mas nam yang dri ma ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, because it is extremely pure, it is never stained by the stains of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not go, that is, it does not proceed.

original: ci lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bur zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sprin dum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sprin dum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “like a cloud fragment in the sky,” etc.

original: ci ltar nam mkha' ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: ci ltar nam mkha' ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The sky is the sky.

original: sprin gyi dum bu ni sprin gyi chas ma dag pas dri ma can nyid du de mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sprin gyi dum bu ni sprin gyi chas ma dag pas dri ma can nyid du de mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the impurity of a fragment of a cloud, it is not the case that it is not pure.

original: de bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas blo dang ldan pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas blo dang ldan pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: So too, it is not for one who is endowed with the mind that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa thams cad du med na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnam pa thams cad du med na /
translated: If objects such as form do not exist in any way,

original: 'di de yin zhes don nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ci ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: 'di de yin zhes don nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ci ltar skye zhe na /
translated: how does a consciousness that has the aspect of ascertaining an object, “This is that,” arise?

original: 'dir ni mang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, what is the use of saying much?

original: 'dir ni ste phyogs snga ma la mang du smras pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'dir ni ste phyogs snga ma la mang du smras pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Here, in the former position, what is the use of saying much?

original: gal te khyi dang ri bong rta @85b mgor skyes pa'i rva rnams 'ga' zhig gis bsgoms na de'i tshe bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis med pa'i ngo bo yang mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te khyi dang ri bong rta @85b mgor skyes pa'i rva rnams 'ga' zhig gis bsgoms na de'i tshe bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis med pa'i ngo bo yang mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If someone meditates on the horns of a rabbit or the tail of a cow, then through the power of meditation, the nature of what does not exist is seen.

original: sbal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sbal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: A frog, etc.

original: sbal pa ni chu na gnas pa'i srog chags kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: sbal pa ni chu na gnas pa'i srog chags kyi bye brag go //
translated: A frog is a type of water-dwelling animal.

original: de gal te 'ga' zhig gis 'di lta bu'i tshul du bsgoms na de'i tshe sgom pa goms pas de bzhin du snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gal te 'ga' zhig gis 'di lta bu'i tshul du bsgoms na de'i tshe sgom pa goms pas de bzhin du snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If someone meditates in this way, then at that time, through the cultivation of meditation, it appears in that way.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: ral pa'i thod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ral pa'i thod ces bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said, “with the distinction of a skull-garland, etc.”

original: khang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “a house, etc.”

original: khang pa mun pa dang bcas pa'i nang du de dang de brtags pas te /
analyzed: khang pa mun pa dang bcas pa'i nang du de dang de brtags pas te /
translated: In a dark house, by investigating that and that,

original: mi ma yin pa la sogs pa brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa la sogs pa brtags pa'o //
translated: investigating non-humans, etc.

original: 'jigs pa ni 'jigs pas non pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni 'jigs pas non pa'o //
translated: Fear is being overcome by fear.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /🔽rang sems nges par snang ba ni /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na / rang sems nges par snang ba ni /
translated: What is it like?

original: zhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: zhes smos pa ste /
translated: It is said, “the appearance of one’s own mind.🔽”

original: skye bo'i 'jigs pa'i don byed pa dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye bo'i 'jigs pa'i don byed pa dang ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said, “having the meaning of making fear for people.🔽”

original: byis pa ni byis pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa ni byis pa ste /
translated: A child is a fool.

original: mthong ba min nam ci /
analyzed: mthong ba min nam ci /
translated: Is it not seen?

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “very much, etc.”

original: shin tu 'jigs pa'i gnod sbyin gyi gzugs rang gis te /
analyzed: shin tu 'jigs pa'i gnod sbyin gyi gzugs rang gis te /
translated: Having drawn the form of a yakṣa, extremely frightening, by himself,

original: bdag nyid kyis bris nas dben pa ni skye bo med pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis bris nas dben pa ni skye bo med pa'i phyogs so //
translated: in a solitary place, in a place without people,🔽alone, without a companion, thinking, “This yakṣa will surely seize me,”

original: gcig pu ni grogs med par nges yang gnod sbyin 'dis bdag 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes sems pas ri mo mkhan 'jigs min nam ci ste /
analyzed: gcig pu ni grogs med par nges yang gnod sbyin 'dis bdag 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes sems pas ri mo mkhan 'jigs min nam ci ste /
translated: how could the painter not be afraid?

original: ci 'jigs pa thob par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci 'jigs pa thob par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What fear will not be obtained?

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: sdong dum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sdong dum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “stump” and so on.

original: 'ga' zhig snang ba mi gsal ba'i phyogs su ring po na sdong dum dang thag pa mthong ba la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig snang ba mi gsal ba'i phyogs su ring po na sdong dum dang thag pa mthong ba la /
translated: In a place where appearances are unclear, seeing a stump and a rope in the distance,

original: sdong du ma la rkun ma dang thag pa la sbrul yin no zhes brtags pa ste /
analyzed: sdong du ma la rkun ma dang thag pa la sbrul yin no zhes brtags pa ste /
translated: one imagines, “The stump is a thief, the rope is a snake.”

original: 'ga' zhig tu skye bo du ma lam nas 'gro ba na 'di dang 'di yin no zhes brtags pas glo bur du ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu skye bo du ma lam nas 'gro ba na 'di dang 'di yin no zhes brtags pas glo bur du ste /
translated: In some cases, when many people are traveling on a path, by the examination, “This is it, that is it,” suddenly,

original: rgyu med par 'jigs pa thob pa ma yin nam ste /
analyzed: rgyu med par 'jigs pa thob pa ma yin nam ste /
translated: without cause, fear is obtained, is it not?

original: ci 'jigs par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci 'jigs par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the fear?

original: de bzhin du yang dag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the same way, he says, “Unreal imagination,” etc.

original: yang dag min nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag min nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
translated: Unreal imagination is the objects, forms, etc.

original: yul rnams ji ltar gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: yul rnams ji ltar gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: How are the objects?

original: rang rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “One’s own conceptualization,” etc.

original: rang gi rtog pa nyid ni bzo bo ste /🔽ri mo mkhan @86a * //
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa nyid ni bzo bo ste / ri mo mkhan @86a * //
translated: One’s own conceptualization is the artist.

original: dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dang 'dra ste /
translated: He is like a painter.

original: des bris zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des bris zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is the one who draws.

original: byis pa thams cad ni blang ba dang dor ba mi shes pas /
analyzed: byis pa thams cad ni blang ba dang dor ba mi shes pas /
translated: All fools do not know what to adopt and what to abandon.

original: ci'i phyir byis pa'i skye bo yul rnams kyis bcom zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byis pa'i skye bo yul rnams kyis bcom zhe na /
translated: Why are foolish people destroyed by objects?

original: rang gi nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “By one’s own faults,” etc.

original: gang gi tshe sems yul gyi rnam pa'i bag chags yin par khong du ma chud pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems yul gyi rnam pa'i bag chags yin par khong du ma chud pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the mind is not understood to be the habitual tendency of the aspect of the object,

original: rang bdag nyid kyi nyes pas bcom zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bdag nyid kyi nyes pas bcom zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then one is destroyed by one’s own faults.

original: sgra brjod pas kyang yul rnams snang ba min nam zhe na /
analyzed: sgra brjod pas kyang yul rnams snang ba min nam zhe na /
translated: But don’t the objects appear because of the expression of the word?

original: nyin dang mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse states, “Day and night, etc.”

original: nyin dang mtshan mo mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: Day and night are the same, meaning they are similar.

original: long bas sngon mthong ba'i don nam nangs zhes bya ba'i sgra thos nas /
analyzed: long bas sngon mthong ba'i don nam nangs zhes bya ba'i sgra thos nas /
translated: The blind person hears the sound of dawn, “The sun has risen,”

original: snang ba dang ni bcas pa ste //
analyzed: snang ba dang ni bcas pa ste //
translated: and “together with light.”

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba dang ldan pa'i skyes bus don mthong ba de bzhin du long bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mthong ba dang ldan pa'i skyes bus don mthong ba de bzhin du long bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that just as a person who sees things sees objects, so too the blind person, this is the meaning.

original: da ni yul dang dus la sogs pa yang gzhan du snang ba 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yul dang dus la sogs pa yang gzhan du snang ba 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that even place, time, etc. are mistaken appearances,

original: yul dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the verse states, “Place, time, etc.”

original: ji ltar rmi lam na yul dang dus la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du snang ba nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa'i shes pa bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na yul dang dus la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan du snang ba nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa'i shes pa bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Just as in a dream, due to the appearance of place, time, etc. as other things, mistaken consciousness is produced.

original: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs la yang skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs la yang skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, it is produced in the waking state as well, this is the meaning of “also.”

original: 'di ltar dub pa ni lam ring pos skyo bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dub pa ni lam ring pos skyo bar ro //
translated: Here, “exhausted” means tired from a long journey.

original: lam nye ba la ring ba ru ni sems pa yin te /🔽de bzhin yid 'ong dang bral bas //
analyzed: lam nye ba la ring ba ru ni sems pa yin te / de bzhin yid 'ong dang bral bas //
translated: The path is thought of as long when it is near.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: And likewise, when separated from what is pleasing.

original: de bzhin ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: de bzhin ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: And likewise means for what reason.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod ldan ni 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i skyes bu nyin gcig ste /🔽chu tshod grangs dang mnyam pa la ni chu tshod sum cu'i tshad ni rang bzhin yin na yang lo skor brgya dang 'dra bar sems te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod ldan ni 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i skyes bu nyin gcig ste / chu tshod grangs dang mnyam pa la ni chu tshod sum cu'i tshad ni rang bzhin yin na yang lo skor brgya dang 'dra bar sems te /
translated: For the one who is desirous, the person who is attached to sense objects, one day🔽is thought of as being like a hundred years,

original: lo brgyar gyur par ro //
analyzed: lo brgyar gyur par ro //
translated: a hundred years having become one day.

original: dus gang la zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang la zhe na /
translated: In what time?

original: yid du 'ong ba dang bral ba'i ste /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang bral ba'i ste /
translated: When separated from what is pleasing.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dang bral ba thob pas ma 'brel zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dang bral ba thob pas ma 'brel zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: when separated from the object that is desired.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don med na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa dang sems can gyi don ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi don med na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa dang sems can gyi don ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: When external objects do not exist, how do the bodhisattvas engage in generosity and so on and how do they benefit sentient beings?

original: de nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says:

original: de kho na nyid don dam pa mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid dang de 'dra ba ni brtags pa'i don gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du 'jug gi de bzhin @86b du ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid don dam pa mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' de nyid dang de 'dra ba ni brtags pa'i don gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du 'jug gi de bzhin @86b du ni dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who sees reality, the ultimate, engages in the conventional expressions of generosity and so on, which are the objects of investigation, but does not apprehend them in that way.

original: don dam pa rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he realizes the ultimate.

original: don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that meaning extensively, he says:

original: sna tshogs 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: These various things are seen as like a picture,🔽by the wise, who see reality.

original: 'di dag ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: These are taught in the manner previously explained.

original: byang chub sems dpas sna tshogs 'di dag thams cad ri mo bzhin du mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sna tshogs 'di dag thams cad ri mo bzhin du mthong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva sees all these various things as like a picture.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not see them as having the nature of the ultimate.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa'i sna tshogs pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa'i sna tshogs pa zhe na /
translated: What kind of various things?

original: rnam rtog tshon gyis bris pa ni ste bris pa'i sgras ni rgyu mtshan bshad do //
analyzed: rnam rtog tshon gyis bris pa ni ste bris pa'i sgras ni rgyu mtshan bshad do //
translated: They are painted with the colors of conceptual thought. The word “painted” explains the reason.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: 'di ltar tshon gyi rgyu mtshan gyis ri mo snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshon gyi rgyu mtshan gyis ri mo snang la /
translated: Thus, by the reason of the color, the picture appears.

original: de bzhin du rtog pa'i tshon gyi rgyu mtshan gyis sna tshogs pas snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtog pa'i tshon gyi rgyu mtshan gyis sna tshogs pas snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Likewise, by the reason of the color of the thought, the variety appears.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba la yang 'gro ba 'di dag gis 'khrul pa bskyed do zhe na /🔽ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba la yang 'gro ba 'di dag gis 'khrul pa bskyed do zhe na / ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But, if one sees reality, one will generate error in these beings.

original: ae ma'o ni ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: ae ma'o ni ngo mtshar ro //
translated: A la la! is a wonder.

original: sna tshogs ni ngo mtshar te gzhan du ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni ngo mtshar te gzhan du ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The variety is a wonder, not seen elsewhere.

original: sna tshogs pa ni rnam pa du ma khams gsum po 'di dag go //🔽mnyam dang mi mnyam mtho dang dma' dang rtogs te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni rnam pa du ma khams gsum po 'di dag go // mnyam dang mi mnyam mtho dang dma' dang rtogs te /
translated: The variety is the many aspects of these three realms.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i blo la 'khrul brgyas pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i blo la 'khrul brgyas pa'o //
translated: The yogi's mind is deluded by the high and low, the even and uneven.

original: 'di dag thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba 'dir bdag cag mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba 'dir bdag cag mnyam pa ste /
translated: In this beginningless cyclic existence, we are equal.

original: ci'i 'gro ba ru skyes pa'am /
analyzed: ci'i 'gro ba ru skyes pa'am /
translated: In what transmigration are we born?

original: mi mnyam pa ste dmyal ba'i 'gro bar ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ste dmyal ba'i 'gro bar ro //
translated: Uneven means in the transmigration of hell.

original: yang dma' ba ni dud 'gro dang / yi dvags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dma' ba ni dud 'gro dang / yi dvags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Again, low means animal, hungry ghost, and so on.

original: mtho ba ni lha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ba ni lha la sogs pa'o //
translated: The high is gods and so on.

original: yang dag don gyi sgrub pa ni don dam pa'i ngo bo la brten nas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo shes kyang ni shes pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang dag don gyi sgrub pa ni don dam pa'i ngo bo la brten nas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo shes kyang ni shes pas kyang ngo //
translated: The accomplishment of the true meaning is based on the ultimate nature, and even though the imagined nature is known by knowledge, it is not truly known.

original: ji ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi blo 'khrul par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi blo 'khrul par byed ce na /
translated: How does the mind of yogins become deluded?🔽It is said:

original: sems kyi nam mkha'i dkyil du bris pa yi /
analyzed: sems kyi nam mkha'i dkyil du bris pa yi /
translated: Painted in the center of the sky of the mind,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: sems nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: The mind is like the sky.

original: de'i dkyil ni rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dkyil ni rgya che ba'o //
translated: Its center is vast.

original: de la bris pa lta bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bris pa lta bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said to be like a painting there.

original: brdzun pa'i kun tu rtog pas sa rnams gsum po 'di dag bsdus lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i kun tu rtog pas sa rnams gsum po 'di dag bsdus lta bu zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By false imagination, these three realms are included.

original: brdzun pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pas bsdus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brdzun pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pas bsdus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: False means included by affliction.

original: kun brtags pa de bden pa ma yin par bstan pa'i rigs pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa de bden pa ma yin par bstan pa'i rigs pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another reasoning that the imagined is not true,🔽it is said:

original: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If a thing is imagined by mind,

original: gal te ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: gal te ni gang gi phyir gyi don to //
translated: “If” means “because.”

original: gang gi phyir gal te dngos po dngos yin na de'i tshe don dam pa'i ngo bo nyin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te dngos po dngos yin na de'i tshe don dam pa'i ngo bo nyin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if a thing is a thing, then it is not understood to be different, because of the nature of the ultimate.

original: de ji ltar chos la bdag med pa rtogs nas dngos po de nyid @87a * //
analyzed: de ji ltar chos la bdag med pa rtogs nas dngos po de nyid @87a * //
translated: How, having understood the selflessness of phenomena, can that thing

original: phyis ni ci'i phyir dngos po med par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyis ni ci'i phyir dngos po med par 'gyur /
translated: later become a non-thing?

original: don dam pa la ngo bo gnyis ni med do //
analyzed: don dam pa la ngo bo gnyis ni med do //
translated: There is no duality in the ultimate.

original: 'o na gang la dngos po'i tha snyad du bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang la dngos po'i tha snyad du bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it that is designated as a thing?

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “just as it is.”

original: gnyis med pa'i sems la de bzhin nyid kyi sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis med pa'i sems la de bzhin nyid kyi sgrar brjod do //
translated: The nondual mind is called “thusness.”

original: de yang brtan ngo bo'i phyir gang gi tshe gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de yang brtan ngo bo'i phyir gang gi tshe gzhan pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: And that is not different, because of the nature of stability. When it is not different,

original: de'i dngos po'i sgra'i tha snyad du rigs kyi brtags pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i sgra'i tha snyad du rigs kyi brtags pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it is reasonable to designate it as a thing. The meaning is that it is not imaginary.

original: kun du brtags pa rnams kyi ming la sogs pa'i ming yang dngos po med do zhe na /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa rnams kyi ming la sogs pa'i ming yang dngos po med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the names, etc. of the imagined are also unreal things,

original: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The false thing, etc.”

original: gang 'di chos brtags pa brdzun pa'i dngos po ming dang rigs stsogs yon tan ni /
analyzed: gang 'di chos brtags pa brdzun pa'i dngos po ming dang rigs stsogs yon tan ni /
translated: The false thing, i.e., the imagined dharma, is the name, class, etc., i.e., the qualities.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par du mthong ba des nam mkha' la ri mo bris pa ni nam mkha'i dkyil du ri mo bris lta bur ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par du mthong ba des nam mkha' la ri mo bris pa ni nam mkha'i dkyil du ri mo bris lta bur ro //
translated: The one who sees it as a special quality is like one who draws a picture in the sky, i.e., in the middle of the sky.

original: de yang phyin ci log gis dub pa yin no //🔽yon tan dang ldan pa yon tan la 'jug gi / gang gi tshe yon tan can med na de'i tshe gang gi yon tan yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log gis dub pa yin no // yon tan dang ldan pa yon tan la 'jug gi / gang gi tshe yon tan can med na de'i tshe gang gi yon tan yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, that is the exhaustion of error.

original: de ni nye bar sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de ni nye bar sdud par byed de /
translated: The one who has the qualities engages in the qualities, but when there is no one who has the qualities, then whose qualities are they? This is the meaning.🔽He summarizes this:

original: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: de'i phyir ni sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: Therefore, by the previously stated reason.

original: sna tshogs rang bzhin rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: sna tshogs rang bzhin rnams ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos rnams so //
translated: The various natures are the dharmas of the natures of grasped and grasper.

original: rang bzhin ngo bo med pa yin te de dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin ngo bo med pa yin te de dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is devoid of the nature of intrinsic reality, which is to say, it is free from that.

original: yang gang gis gzhan du ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin du yongs su rtogs par byed pa de ni dam pa'i don las log ste /
analyzed: yang gang gis gzhan du ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin du yongs su rtogs par byed pa de ni dam pa'i don las log ste /
translated: Moreover, one who realizes it as other than that, as the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, is turned away from the ultimate.

original: don dam pa yongs su shes pa la mkhas par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa yongs su shes pa la mkhas par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one becomes skilled in the thorough knowledge of the ultimate.

original: de ltar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag nas 'ga' zhig de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'bad par mi bya ba ston par byed pas /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag nas 'ga' zhig de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'bad par mi bya ba ston par byed pas /
translated: Having thus presented the characteristics of the ultimate, in order to show that no one should strive to actualize it, he says:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If someone thinks, etc.

original: gang du stong pa nyid kyi sgrar bstan pa der gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du stong pa nyid kyi sgrar bstan pa der gnyis su med pa'i sems nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Wherever the term emptiness is taught, one should understand it to be the nondual mind itself.

original: yang kun brtags pa'i sgrar bstan pa der ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yang kun brtags pa'i sgrar bstan pa der ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Moreover, wherever the term imagined is taught, it is the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de la gal te kun brtags pa thams cad du med pa kho nar gyur la /
analyzed: de la gal te kun brtags pa thams cad du med pa kho nar gyur la /
translated: If all the imagined were absolutely nonexistent,

original: stong pa nyid yang gal te yod par gyur na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yang gal te yod par gyur na /
translated: and emptiness were existent,

original: de'i tshe skye ba dang ni 'jig pa dag 'bad pa med par rang nyid thob ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba dang ni 'jig pa dag 'bad pa med par rang nyid thob ste /
translated: then arising and destruction would be obtained without effort,

original: rnal 'byor pas 'bad pa @87b med par rang nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas 'bad pa @87b med par rang nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
