translated: and the yogi would obtain it without effort.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid yod la kun brtags pa med pa de lta bu yin na 'bad pa dang bral bas lus can rnams grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid yod la kun brtags pa med pa de lta bu yin na 'bad pa dang bral bas lus can rnams grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if emptiness existed and the imagined did not exist, then embodied beings would be liberated without effort.

original: de ltar ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: But that is not so.

original: mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽ci srid rtogs pas sgro btags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po rtags pa dngos po med pa /
analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ci srid rtogs pas sgro btags pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po rtags pa dngos po med pa /
translated: As it is said, “As long as one does not know . . . ”

original: rigs pa dang lung sngon du 'gro ba'i rnal 'byor bas mi shes pa de de srid med pa tsam gyis de ldog par ni rigs so //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung sngon du 'gro ba'i rnal 'byor bas mi shes pa de de srid med pa tsam gyis de ldog par ni rigs so //
translated: As long as one does not know through the yoga preceded by reasoning and scripture that the imagined entity of grasped and grasper is nonexistent, it is not reasonable that it is eliminated by mere nonexistence.

original: gnyen pos sgom pa med par de ldog pa ni med do //
analyzed: gnyen pos sgom pa med par de ldog pa ni med do //
translated: And without the antidote, meditation, it is impossible to reverse it.

original: de lta bas na ldog pa med na ni bstan pa'i ngo bo yang stong pa nyid des bsgribs pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na ldog pa med na ni bstan pa'i ngo bo yang stong pa nyid des bsgribs pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if there is no reversal, then the nature of the teaching is also obscured by emptiness and cannot be attained.

original: gsal ba ma yin na de bas na ci ltar don dam par 'grub par 'gyur //🔽gzhan yang / 'di dag 'ga' yang bye brag med //
analyzed: gsal ba ma yin na de bas na ci ltar don dam par 'grub par 'gyur // gzhan yang / 'di dag 'ga' yang bye brag med //
translated: If it is not clear, then how can it be ultimately established?🔽Moreover, it is said:

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: None of these are distinct.

original: 'di kun brtags pa 'di ni stong pa zhes 'di gnyis ji srid 'ga' zhig gis bye brag ma mthong ba de srid kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du stong pa nyid med pa'i bdag nyid 'thob bo zhes gzhan dag rgol bas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di kun brtags pa 'di ni stong pa zhes 'di gnyis ji srid 'ga' zhig gis bye brag ma mthong ba de srid kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du stong pa nyid med pa'i bdag nyid 'thob bo zhes gzhan dag rgol bas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: As long as no one sees a distinction between these two, emptiness and the imagined, the imagined nature is not attained as having the nature of emptiness.

original: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to respond to others’ objections, it is said:🔽The dependent is not the imagined.

original: gzhan dbang nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gis sems la brten pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dbang nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gis sems la brten pa ste /
translated: The dependent is dependent on other minds.

original: stong pa nyid dang brtags pa yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba skyes pa de'i tshe de gnyis kyi dbye ba shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang brtags pa yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba skyes pa de'i tshe de gnyis kyi dbye ba shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the yogi sees emptiness and the correct and incorrect imagined, then he knows the distinction between the two.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang la ngo bo gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang la ngo bo gnyis te /
translated: Thus, the dependent has two natures:

original: kun brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the imagined and the perfected.

original: de la kun brtags pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the imagined is the superimposition of the nature of object and subject.

original: yongs su grub pa ni yang des stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni yang des stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfected is said to be empty of that.

original: de la gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas kun brtags pa brtag tu med par rig pas dpyad cing de'i gnyen por 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo yang bsgoms pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas kun brtags pa brtag tu med par rig pas dpyad cing de'i gnyen por 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo yang bsgoms pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the yogi, having analyzed the imagined with the knowledge that it does not exist, cultivates the perfected nature as its antidote,

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo mthong bas stong pa nyid yang dag pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo mthong bas stong pa nyid yang dag pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he sees emptiness correctly, seeing the perfected nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ma gtogs par gzhan stong pa nyid ces bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ma gtogs par gzhan stong pa nyid ces bya ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Apart from the perfected nature, there is no other so-called emptiness.

original: kun brtags pa ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the imagined is false.

original: yang dag par mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya bas don dam pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya bas don dam pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the ultimate is established as not being seen correctly.

original: don de nyid tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji ltar zhes bya ba la @88a * //🔽la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don de nyid tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstan par bya ba'i phyir / ji ltar zhes bya ba la @88a * // la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This very point is taught by the following verse.🔽How do yogis enter into this emptiness?

original: stong pa nyid 'di la rnal 'byor pa rnams ji ltar 'jug ces dri ba la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di la rnal 'byor pa rnams ji ltar 'jug ces dri ba la /
translated: The answer is:

original: rang bzhin gsum ni mthong bas so //🔽zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum ni mthong bas so // zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: By seeing the three natures.

original: gang gi tshe kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo'i sems mthong bar gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo'i sems mthong bar gyur na /
translated: When the mind, which is the entity of the three natures, the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected, is seen,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin gsum mthong ba'i rgyus te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin gsum mthong ba'i rgyus te /
translated: then, by the cause of seeing the three natures,

original: sngar bstan pa'i rim pas stong pa nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rim pas stong pa nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: one enters into emptiness by the process previously explained.

original: sems kyi ngo bo gsum po stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig mthong bar gyur pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo gsum po stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig mthong bar gyur pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not only the entity of the mind, which is the emptiness of the three natures, that is seen.

original: ji srid de mthong bas ni rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo gang gi tshe sems mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ji srid de mthong bas ni rang bzhin gsum gyi ngo bo gang gi tshe sems mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: When one sees the mind,

original: de mthong bas ni chos kun la //🔽ril por 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: de mthong bas ni chos kun la // ril por 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur //
translated: one sees all dharmas.🔽One turns away from the grasping of the totality.

original: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: One turns away from the adherence to the one.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gcig la tha dad mthong ba med //
analyzed: gcig la tha dad mthong ba med //
translated: one does not see difference in the one.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And so on.

original: rang gi ngo bo gcig la tha dad pa mthong ba ni med do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gcig la tha dad pa mthong ba ni med do //
translated: One does not see difference in the one essence.

original: de bas na tshul gsum du gsal bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de bas na tshul gsum du gsal bar snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the three modes appear clearly.

original: 'on kyang bag chags 'jug pa'i nus pa yis te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bag chags 'jug pa'i nus pa yis te /
translated: However, by the power of the entry of predispositions,

original: bag chags kyi nus pa'i mthus de gnyis las te gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo gsal bar snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bag chags kyi nus pa'i mthus de gnyis las te gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo gsal bar snang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: by the power of the capacity of the predispositions, the imagined nature appears clearly from the other two, from the dependent and the real natures. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyi ma'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyi ma'i gnas skabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the subsequent state, he says,

original: kun brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The imagined, etc.

original: gzung ba'i dngos po dgag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung ba'i dngos po dgag pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to refute the apprehended object,

original: kun brtags don ni nub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun brtags don ni nub pa'i phyir //
translated: the imagined object disappears.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mi gsal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not manifest.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin las dang por gzhan gyi dbang ni rab tu gsal bar mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin las dang por gzhan gyi dbang ni rab tu gsal bar mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the nature of the perfected, the dependent is first seen to be manifest. This is the meaning.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig gsal zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig gsal zhe na /
translated: In what way is it manifest?

original: rang bzhin snga nas ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin snga nas ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because the nature was not seen before.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: snga nas ma mthong ba ni kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: snga nas ma mthong ba ni kun brtags pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Not seen before means in the imagined state.

original: gang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba de'i ngo bos g-yo ba bzhin te /
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo ma mthong ba de'i ngo bos g-yo ba bzhin te /
translated: Because the nature was not seen, it moves with that nature,

original: mi brtan pa'i ngo bo lta bur gsal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i ngo bo lta bur gsal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: as if with an unstable nature. It is manifest, this is the meaning.

original: da ni mthong ba'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mthong ba'i lam bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the path of seeing, he says:

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In stages, etc.

original: rim pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rim pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The stages are the stages taught previously.

original: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: By the reasoning that there is no apprehender because there is no apprehended object.

original: de nyid kyi ste gzhan gyi dbang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa snang ba bzlog pa ste spangs pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ste gzhan gyi dbang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa snang ba bzlog pa ste spangs pas so //
translated: By the reversal, i.e., by the abandonment, of the appearance of the aspect of the apprehension of that very dependent nature.

original: gnyis dang bral ba ni stong @88b pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis dang bral ba ni stong @88b pa nyid do //
translated: The freedom from duality is emptiness.

original: de nyid ni gzhan dbang ste bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan dbang ste bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: That very dependent nature is to be taught,

original: snying ga ru ni 'od gsal skyes te /
analyzed: snying ga ru ni 'od gsal skyes te /
translated: and so it is born in the heart as clear light.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i ngo bo bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i ngo bo bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it generates the nature of clarity by way of the perfected nature.

original: skad cig la de mthong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig la de mthong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is seen in an instant:🔽He also says,

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de yang gang gi tshe mngon du ma byas na glog bzhin du mi brtan phyir /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe mngon du ma byas na glog bzhin du mi brtan phyir /
translated: When it is not manifested, it is like a flash of lightning, and so it is unstable.

original: skad cig la ni 'gro zhing 'ong ste /
analyzed: skad cig la ni 'gro zhing 'ong ste /
translated: It goes and comes in an instant.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it goes and comes.

original: 'dir rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause here?

original: thams cad ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: All means at all times.

original: thog ma med dus kyi gnyis po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis po'o //
analyzed: thog ma med dus kyi gnyis po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis po'o //
translated: The two from beginningless time are the two, the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: gang gi tshe kun du bslang ba de'i tshe gnyis po de nyid kyis bslad phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun du bslang ba de'i tshe gnyis po de nyid kyis bslad phyir te /
translated: When it is aroused, at that time it is disturbed by those two.

original: skad cig la 'ong zhing 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig la 'ong zhing 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it comes and goes in an instant.

original: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning, he says,

original: gnyis gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyis gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Dwelling in the two,” and so on.

original: gnyis gnas ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis gnas ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis so //
translated: Dwelling in the two is the two, the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: gnyis med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis med pa ni stong pa nyid kyi gnas so //
translated: Non-dual is the dwelling of emptiness.

original: rjes su 'byung ba ni res 'ga' rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'byung ba ni res 'ga' rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Arising is sometimes following.

original: ji srid ni stong pa nyid de'i dbus ma ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi dbus so //
analyzed: ji srid ni stong pa nyid de'i dbus ma ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi dbus so //
translated: For as long is the middle of that emptiness. The middle of the two, the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: brtan par ma byas ni dngos po brtan par ma byas pa de srid yang dang yang du der 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtan par ma byas ni dngos po brtan par ma byas pa de srid yang dang yang du der 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not stabilized is not stabilized as a thing. The meaning is that for as long as that, again and again, one goes there.

original: da ni brtan pa nyid na /
analyzed: da ni brtan pa nyid na /
translated: Now, when it is stabilized,

original: brtan par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brtan par gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “When it becomes stabilized,” and so on.

original: gang gi tshe sa brgyad par stong pa nyid brtan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sa brgyad par stong pa nyid brtan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When, on the eighth ground, emptiness becomes stabilized, at that time,

original: mun pa'i 'jug pa'i gnas skabs nyid ni yod ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mun pa'i 'jug pa'i gnas skabs nyid ni yod ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the state of the occurrence of darkness does not exist.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'od zer stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'od zer stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “like the sun with its thousand rays,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'od zer stong ldan ni nyi ma shar bas mun pa'i 'jug pa la gnas pa'i skabs med pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid yin te de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'od zer stong ldan ni nyi ma shar bas mun pa'i 'jug pa la gnas pa'i skabs med pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid yin te de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the sun, with its thousand rays, has no opportunity to remain in the state of the occurrence of darkness, in the same way, emptiness, being incompatible with it, has no opportunity to remain in the state of the occurrence of existence.

original: da ni stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du dngos po med pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad du dngos po med pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to completely refute the non-existence of emptiness,

original: gnas skabs de yang mi shes pas te /
analyzed: gnas skabs de yang mi shes pas te /
translated: he says, “That state is also not known by those like us.”

original: gnas skabs gsum yod pa de'i phyir yang sgra smos so //
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum yod pa de'i phyir yang sgra smos so //
translated: Since that state exists in the three times, he mentions the word “state.”

original: de lta bas na gnas skabs de yang gnas skabs gang yin pa la stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas skabs de yang gnas skabs gang yin pa la stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that state is also called “emptiness” in any state.

original: bdag cag 'dra bas mi shes kyi sangs rgyas nyid kyis mkhyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag cag 'dra bas mi shes kyi sangs rgyas nyid kyis mkhyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is known by the Buddha himself, not by those like us.🔽One should not follow non-existence

original: 'jig rten grags pa nyid bzhin du //🔽med pa'i rjes su 'brang mi bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten grags pa nyid bzhin du //🔽med pa'i rjes su 'brang mi bya //
translated: in accordance with what is known in the world.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i bstan par grags pa ni don cung zad kyang med ces @89a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i bstan par grags pa ni don cung zad kyang med ces @89a * //
translated: The teaching of the Lokayatas, which is known as the teaching of materialism, is said to be completely meaningless.

original: smra ste / de stong pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smra ste / de stong pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not emptiness.

original: gang gi stong pa nyid ni chos kyi sgras bstan te /
analyzed: gang gi stong pa nyid ni chos kyi sgras bstan te /
translated: The emptiness of that is indicated by the word dharma.

original: chos can las chos nyid ni gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can las chos nyid ni gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The reality of a thing is not different from the thing itself.

original: da ni mtha' med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mtha' med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that it is limitless, he says:

original: de yi dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yi dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The emptiness of that is not a non-entity.

original: dngos por rtog pa'i mtha'i g-yeng ba spang ba'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid de dngos po med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos por rtog pa'i mtha'i g-yeng ba spang ba'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid de dngos po med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In order to eliminate the distraction of the extreme of conceptualizing an entity, one should understand that its emptiness is not a non-entity.

original: dngos po med par rtog pa'i mtha'i g-yeng ba spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med par rtog pa'i mtha'i g-yeng ba spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the distraction of the extreme of conceptualizing a non-entity,

original: tha snyad don te /
analyzed: tha snyad don te /
translated: one should understand that it is conventionally meaningful.

original: kun rdzob tu yod par yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod par yang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood to exist superficially.

original: don dam pa rtogs na /
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs na /
translated: When the ultimate is realized,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: in phenomena that are essenceless,

original: gang zhig yod dang med pa yin //
analyzed: gang zhig yod dang med pa yin //
translated: what can be said to exist or not exist?

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Thus he says:

original: mtha' gnyis med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “without the two extremes” is this.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i sbyor ba med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i sbyor ba med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the application of existence and nonexistence is not without a basis,

original: gcig kyang gzugs par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig kyang gzugs par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: one should not form the notion that it is nonexistent.🔽To demonstrate this, he says,

original: khyod dran zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyod dran zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “You should remember . . . ”

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la /
translated: Thus, in regard to something,

original: khyod dran ma byed ces brjod na ste /
analyzed: khyod dran ma byed ces brjod na ste /
translated: if one says, “Do not remember this,”

original: khyod dngos po 'di dran par byed ces smra ba'o //
analyzed: khyod dngos po 'di dran par byed ces smra ba'o //
translated: one is saying, “You should remember this thing.”

original: de'i phyir dgag dbye ni dngos po ste med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir blos mchog tu dpyod pas dran pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag dbye ni dngos po ste med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir blos mchog tu dpyod pas dran pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the exclusion of negation is not without a basis, it is remembered by the mind that investigates the highest.

original: de ltar de bzhin med pa'i sgras /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin med pa'i sgras /
translated: In this way, through the word “nonexistent,”

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yod par khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yod par khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: one should understand that it exists because it is not without a basis.

original: de lta bas na yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis spangs ba ni dbu ma'i lam du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis spangs ba ni dbu ma'i lam du shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of the two conceptions of existence and nonexistence should be understood as the middle way.

original: gal te dgag par bya ba mi 'byung bar grub pa yin na yang de'i phyir dngos po'i stobs kyis kun brtags pa de yod par grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dgag par bya ba mi 'byung bar grub pa yin na yang de'i phyir dngos po'i stobs kyis kun brtags pa de yod par grub bo zhe na /
translated: If it is established that the object of negation does not occur, then because of that, the imagined is established as existing by the power of things.

original: rnam par rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽rnam par rtog pa ni sgra'i rnam par rtog pa las bag chags kyi dbang gis /
analyzed: rnam par rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rnam par rtog pa ni sgra'i rnam par rtog pa las bag chags kyi dbang gis /
translated: He says, “Conceptualization,” and so on.🔽Conceptualization is the arising of the cognition of objects from the conceptualization of sound due to the power of latent propensities.

original: rnam par rtog pa las don rnams shes pa ni dran pa'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa las don rnams shes pa ni dran pa'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: The cognition of sound is the arising of the cognition of memory.

original: don gyi blo las rnam rtog kyang ste de las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: don gyi blo las rnam rtog kyang ste de las byung ba yin no //
translated: Conceptualization also arises from the cognition of the object, because it arises from that.

original: gnyi ga rnam rtog chos yin phyir te /
analyzed: gnyi ga rnam rtog chos yin phyir te /
translated: Because both are conceptualized phenomena.

original: sgra dang don gyi rnam par rtog pa dag rnam par rtog pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra dang don gyi rnam par rtog pa dag rnam par rtog pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the conceptualizations of sound and object are conceptualized phenomena.

original: yod pa gang yin med gang yin //
analyzed: yod pa gang yin med gang yin //
translated: What exists and what does not exist?

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽med pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang brtag par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to // med pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang brtag par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rten ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rten ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should not even conceptualize nonexistence, he says, “What is the basis,” and so on.

original: rten ni gang zhig ni kun brtags pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rten ni gang zhig ni kun brtags pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The basis is the imagined nature, etc.

original: med pa nyid kyang bsgoms @89b pas med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yod par 'gyur te 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang bsgoms @89b pas med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir yod par 'gyur te 'gro ba yin no //
translated: If non-existence is cultivated, it becomes existent, because it does not occur when it is non-existent.

original: gal te de bzhin du 'dod pa na de'i tshe yang de bzhin yod pa nyid kyang 'thob ste /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin du 'dod pa na de'i tshe yang de bzhin yod pa nyid kyang 'thob ste /
translated: If you accept that in the same way, then existence is also attained in the same way.

original: 'di ltar med pa nyid bsgoms pas yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du yod pa yang bsgoms pas med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir med pa nyid kyang thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa nyid bsgoms pas yod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du yod pa yang bsgoms pas med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir med pa nyid kyang thob pa yin no //
translated: Just as non-existence becomes existent through the cultivation of non-existence, in the same way, existence also becomes non-existent through the cultivation of existence, because it does not occur when it is existent.

original: de dag thams cad kun brtags pa'i dngos po las len pa la yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kun brtags pa'i dngos po las len pa la yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of these are taken to exist from the imagined entity.

original: gang gi tshe kun du brtags pa rtag tu med pa'i phyir de'i tshe rten med pas brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun du brtags pa rtag tu med pa'i phyir de'i tshe rten med pas brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When the imagined is always non-existent, then, since there is no basis, the dependent does not exist.

original: da ni nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to summarize, he says:

original: de bzhin yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Existence as it is,” etc.

original: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa dang bde sdug la sogs med par bzhed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa dang med pa dang bde sdug la sogs med par bzhed de /
translated: Likewise, existence and nonexistence, pleasure and pain, etc. are not accepted.

original: dngos po med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “nonexistent thing” is the meaning of “nonexistent.”

original: gang gi phyir gang chung zad yod pa de dag thams cad ltos pas grub pa yin te skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang chung zad yod pa de dag thams cad ltos pas grub pa yin te skyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because whatever exists, all of that is established by dependence, the meaning of “arisen.”

original: 'di ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'di ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is this like?

original: ring thung la sogs bye brag bzhin //
analyzed: ring thung la sogs bye brag bzhin //
translated: Like the distinctions of long and short, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says this.

original: 'di ltar thung du med na ring po'i bdag nyid yod par mi 'grub la /
analyzed: 'di ltar thung du med na ring po'i bdag nyid yod par mi 'grub la /
translated: Thus, if short does not exist, the nature of long is not established.

original: ring po med na thung du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ring po med na thung du yang de bzhin no //
translated: If long does not exist, short is also like that.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “person,” etc.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu ni skyes bu rnams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu ni skyes bu rnams te /
translated: Thus, a person is persons.

original: sdug bsngal zhi ba la bde ba zhes bya ba rang gi rtog pas brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi ba la bde ba zhes bya ba rang gi rtog pas brtags pa yin no //
translated: The pacification of suffering is called “pleasure,” which is imagined by one’s own thought.

original: bde ba nyams pa sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: bde ba nyams pa sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: The deterioration of pleasure is pain.

original: de'i phyir gnyis po 'di ni ltos pas yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis po 'di ni ltos pas yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are by dependence.

original: ltos pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ltos pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is this:

original: 'di ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rigs pas kun rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ltos pa las kun du byung bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rigs pas kun rags pa dang phra ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ltos pa las kun du byung bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should understand that all gross and subtle entities arise in dependence, by the reasoning of pleasure and pain, etc.🔽Thus,

original: 'di ltar / gcig nyid la ni ma ltos par //🔽gzhan dag khong du chud ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / gcig nyid la ni ma ltos par // gzhan dag khong du chud ma yin te /
translated: Without depending on one,🔽The other is not understood.

original: gnyis par shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis par shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Without the other, the one is not understood.🔽This is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: ltos pa med par dngos po 'ga' zhig 'ba' zhig tu yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ltos pa med par dngos po 'ga' zhig 'ba' zhig tu yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Without depending on something else, an entity does not exist by itself.

original: gzhan du na thams cad rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na thams cad rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, everything would be permanent.

original: 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba bkag pas sems gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo dbu ma'i lam yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i g-yeng ba bkag pas sems gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo dbu ma'i lam yin par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, by refuting the distraction of the conception of entity and nonentity, it is shown that the middle path is the nature of the nondual mind.

original: 'di ltar ming dang rnam par rtog pa rgya cher dgag pa'i phyir /🔽gzhan sel ba yi zhes bya ba la @90a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming dang rnam par rtog pa rgya cher dgag pa'i phyir / gzhan sel ba yi zhes bya ba la @90a * //
translated: Thus, in order to extensively refute names and conceptualization,

original: sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “the exclusion of other,” etc.

original: gzhan sel ba ni rigs mi mthun pa gzhan sel ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba ni rigs mi mthun pa gzhan sel ba'o //
translated: The exclusion of other is the exclusion of other heterogeneous things.

original: spyod yul rnam par ma dpyad par te /
analyzed: spyod yul rnam par ma dpyad par te /
translated: The domain is not analyzed,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul rnam par ma dpyad par ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul rnam par ma dpyad par ro //
translated: i.e., the domain of the particular is not analyzed.

original: bstan pa la sogs sgrub pa yis te /
analyzed: bstan pa la sogs sgrub pa yis te /
translated: The establishment of the teaching, etc.

original: sgra brjod pa dang / nyan pa dang dran pa la sogs pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: sgra brjod pa dang / nyan pa dang dran pa la sogs pa'i rgyus /
translated: is the cause of the expression of sound, hearing, memory, etc.

original: kha cig 'khrul pa yang dag bskyed de /
analyzed: kha cig 'khrul pa yang dag bskyed de /
translated: Some generate error.

original: dngos po med pa spyi'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa'i shes pas don med pa la don du mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa spyi'i mtshan nyid 'khrul pa'i shes pas don med pa la don du mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the unreal universal, which is the object of erroneous cognition, is conceived as a real object.

original: sgra'i shes pa tshad mar gyur pa la 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa tshad mar gyur pa la 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How can one say that the cognition of sound is erroneous when it is valid?

original: yi ge tshig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yi ge tshig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “the letters, words,” etc.

original: yi ge ni aa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ni aa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The letters are a, ā, etc.

original: tshig ni yi ge'i sbyor ba ste bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ni yi ge'i sbyor ba ste bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa'o //
translated: Words are the application of letters, such as pot, cloth, chariot, and so on.

original: ngag ni lha sbyin ba lang dkar po la dbyug pas rgyob ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag ni lha sbyin ba lang dkar po la dbyug pas rgyob ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Speech is, for example, “Devadatta, strike the white cow with a stick.”

original: rtags rnams kyi skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning ngo //
analyzed: rtags rnams kyi skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning ngo //
translated: The genders of nouns are masculine, feminine, and neuter.

original: tshig ni gcig gi tshig dang gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: tshig ni gcig gi tshig dang gnyis kyi tshig dang mang po'i tshig rnams so //
translated: The numbers of words are singular, dual, and plural.

original: bya ba ni 'chang ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'chang ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Actions are holding and so on.

original: byed pa ni las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni las la sogs pa'o //
translated: Agents are karma and so on.

original: 'brel pa ni bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Relations are the relation of action and agent and so on.

original: de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni /
translated: All of these

original: brdzun phyir rjod par byed ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun phyir rjod par byed ma yin te /
translated: are not expressive because they are false.

original: rjod par byed pa ma yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ma yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood to be nonexpressive.

original: 'di ltar rim gyis brjod pa na gang gi tshe 'jig pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar rim gyis brjod pa na gang gi tshe 'jig pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when one expresses them gradually, at the time of destruction,

original: brjod par bya ba'i don med pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i don med pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because the expressed meaning does not exist, they are not expressive.

original: tha mi dang pa dang 'dus pa'i ngo bor mi dmigs te /
analyzed: tha mi dang pa dang 'dus pa'i ngo bor mi dmigs te /
translated: The collection of syllables is not perceived as a different entity from the syllables, nor is the collection of syllables perceived as the nature of the syllables.

original: gang gi phyir 'dus pa ni gcig yin pa'i phyir rim gyis brjod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus pa ni gcig yin pa'i phyir rim gyis brjod pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the collection is one, the syllables would not arise in sequence.

original: de'i cha shas kyi rdul phra rab dngos por yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i cha shas kyi rdul phra rab dngos por yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The subtle particles of the parts of the syllables do not exist as entities.

original: de dag rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist as substances.

original: sgra las logs shig pa'i yi ge dmigs pa ni med de /
analyzed: sgra las logs shig pa'i yi ge dmigs pa ni med de /
translated: The syllables are not perceived as separate from the sounds.

original: de dag mtha' yas pa'i phyir 'di tsam zhes yongs su chad pa med pas thub pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mtha' yas pa'i phyir 'di tsam zhes yongs su chad pa med pas thub pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are infinite, there is no definite limit of “just this much,” and therefore there is no end.

original: sgra las don rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra las don rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is not understood from the sounds.

original: gang gi phyir dang don gyi tha snyad ni lag pa'i tha snyad dang brda dang dran pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dang don gyi tha snyad ni lag pa'i tha snyad dang brda dang dran pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conventions of meaning are used like the conventions of the hands, signs, and memory.

original: brdzun pa'i yi ge la brten pas tshig dang ngag dang rtags la sogs pa bden pa nyid kho na brdzun zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i yi ge la brten pas tshig dang ngag dang rtags la sogs pa bden pa nyid kho na brdzun zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The words, speech, and signs, etc., which are based on false syllables, are truly false. This is the meaning.

original: da ni zhar la byung ba'i @90b sgra'i bstan bcos mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni zhar la byung ba'i @90b sgra'i bstan bcos mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the irrationality of the treatise on grammar, he says:

original: tshigs bcad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: A verse, etc.

original: ji srid rkang pa lnga 'am gsum gyis don rtogs par gyur na /
analyzed: ji srid rkang pa lnga 'am gsum gyis don rtogs par gyur na /
translated: As long as the meaning is understood through five or three lines,

original: de srid tshigs su bcad pa ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: de srid tshigs su bcad pa ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: why not accept that as a verse?

original: rjod byed brjod bya la ltos nas te /
analyzed: rjod byed brjod bya la ltos nas te /
translated: The expression depends on the expressed,

original: de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is primary.

original: 'on te mi 'dod na de'i tshe rkang pa bzhi par nges pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dod na de'i tshe rkang pa bzhi par nges pa ni /
translated: But if that is not accepted, then the certainty of four lines

original: mkha' 'gro'i dam tshig bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro'i dam tshig bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: would be like the dakinis’ vow,

original: rang gi 'dod pas brtags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas brtags par 'gyur ro //
translated: which is imagined by oneself.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi brda sgra dang don la ma ltos par rang gi 'dod pas brtags par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi brda sgra dang don la ma ltos par rang gi 'dod pas brtags par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The symbols of yogis are imagined by themselves, without depending on words and meanings.

original: de bzhin du lci pa dang yang ba la sogs pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lci pa dang yang ba la sogs pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, heavy and light, etc., should be understood.

original: brda sprod pa rab tu brtags pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba nyon mongs shing don med pa'ang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brda sprod pa rab tu brtags pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba nyon mongs shing don med pa'ang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the application of words is a source of affliction and is meaningless, he says:

original: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Dharma, etc.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig lag pa'i tha snyad dang brda dang dran pa'i dbang gis chos rnams gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig lag pa'i tha snyad dang brda dang dran pa'i dbang gis chos rnams gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as some people, by the power of convention, symbol, and memory, apprehend the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi yun ring por byung ba bya kar na la sogs ba rtsoms pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi yun ring por byung ba bya kar na la sogs ba rtsoms pas /
translated: Therefore, the application of words is a source of affliction, because of the composition of the Karandavyūha Sūtra, etc., over a long period of time in the past.

original: sgra rnams sbyor ba nyon mongs la ste /
analyzed: sgra rnams sbyor ba nyon mongs la ste /
translated: The application of words is a source of affliction.

original: sgra sbyor ba dka' ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba dka' ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: The application of words is a difficult subject.

original: 'jig rten pa dag ci phyir btsud //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag ci phyir btsud //
translated: Why do worldly people engage in it?

original: 'di ni sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says: This is the nose, etc.

original: yang gang mi shes pa 'gal zhig 'dri ste /
analyzed: yang gang mi shes pa 'gal zhig 'dri ste /
translated: Moreover, he asks a question that is contrary to what he himself does not understand.

original: sna gang yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: sna gang yin zhes zer ba la /
translated: What is the nose?

original: des kyang sna ni 'di yin no zhes gsal bar brjod pa de tsam gyis de la don go ba skye'o //🔽mgo bo bskor bar gyur pa yi //
analyzed: des kyang sna ni 'di yin no zhes gsal bar brjod pa de tsam gyis de la don go ba skye'o // mgo bo bskor bar gyur pa yi //
translated: When he says that, the other person clearly states: The nose is this. Just by that, the meaning is understood by him.🔽The head is turned around.

original: lag ngar bkug pa'i lag pa yis //
analyzed: lag ngar bkug pa'i lag pa yis //
translated: With a hand that is a bent arm,

original: sna bzung nas 'di sna yin no zhes /
analyzed: sna bzung nas 'di sna yin no zhes /
translated: Grasping the nose, one thinks, “This is the nose.”🔽

original: dres la su zhig ston par byed /
analyzed: dres la su zhig ston par byed /
translated: When the nose is apprehended, who shows it by saying this is the nose?

original: 'di ltar na sa'i sgra brjod pas don rtogs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar na sa'i sgra brjod pas don rtogs na /
translated: If the meaning is understood by expressing the word earth,

original: na si ka'i sgra brjod pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: na si ka'i sgra brjod pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod //
translated: what is the need to express the word na?🔽In order to show that one should not respect the study of meaningless words,

original: dgos pa med pa'i sgra'i bstan bcos la mngon par zhen pa ni dpyod pa med pa la gus par bya ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i sgra'i bstan bcos la mngon par zhen pa ni dpyod pa med pa la gus par bya ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: sgra yi bdag nyid 'jig rten pa //
analyzed: sgra yi bdag nyid 'jig rten pa //
translated: The worldly who are the nature of words,🔽by knowing the difference in arranging words,

original: sgra dgod pa'i khyad par shes pas bdag nyid dang de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'jig rten pa /
analyzed: sgra dgod pa'i khyad par shes pas bdag nyid dang de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'jig rten pa /
translated: the worldly who are the nature of words, and those who follow them,

original: bdag nyid gus par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid gus par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: will not respect themselves.

original: de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the example of that,🔽it is said:

original: brag gi dkyil gyi gab tshe bzhin //
analyzed: brag gi dkyil gyi gab tshe bzhin //
translated: Like a treasure in the middle of a rock.

original: brag gi dkyil gyi gab tshe ni gab tshe'o //
analyzed: brag gi dkyil gyi gab tshe ni gab tshe'o //
translated: A treasure in the middle of a rock is a treasure.

original: de yang gang gi tshe gser gyis bkang ba bdag gis thob snyam du 'ga' zhig sems nas de'i tshe gus pas spos dang me tog gis mchod de /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe gser gyis bkang ba bdag gis thob snyam du 'ga' zhig sems nas de'i tshe gus pas spos dang me tog gis mchod de /
translated: When someone thinks, If I obtain it filled with gold, at that time they respectfully make offerings of incense and flowers.

original: phyis @91a * //🔽phye ba dang nang na snying por gyur pa'i dngos po chung zad med par shes nas gus pa ma yin pa chen pos 'dor ba de bzhin du ji srid brda'i tha snyad kyi don yongs su shes pa ma skyes pa de srid du sam skri ta'i skad la
analyzed: phyis @91a * // phye ba dang nang na snying por gyur pa'i dngos po chung zad med par shes nas gus pa ma yin pa chen pos 'dor ba de bzhin du ji srid brda'i tha snyad kyi don yongs su shes pa ma skyes pa de srid du sam skri ta'i skad la
translated: Later,🔽when one opens it and sees that there is not the slightest thing inside that is substantial, one discards it with great disrespect.

original: gus par byed kyi /
analyzed: gus par byed kyi /
translated: Likewise, as long as the understanding of the meaning of a linguistic convention has not arisen, one is respectful of the Sanskrit language.

original: ji srid yang brda'i dbang gis don rtogs pa de'i tshe gus par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sngar ni sgra brdzun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid yang brda'i dbang gis don rtogs pa de'i tshe gus par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to // sngar ni sgra brdzun pa'i phyir /
translated: But when one understands the meaning by the power of a linguistic convention, at that time one is not respectful. This is the meaning.

original: rjod par byed pa ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Previously, it was shown that it is not an expression because the sound is false.

original: da ni bden pa yin du chug na yang rjod par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bden pa yin du chug na yang rjod par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that even if it were true, it is not an expression,

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Another is not a result,” and so on.

original: gzhan rgyu ma yin pa dang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas gzhan ni 'bras bur gyur pa ma yin pa dang / de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzhan rgyu ma yin pa dang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pas gzhan ni 'bras bur gyur pa ma yin pa dang / de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa /
translated: Another is not a result because it is not a cause and it is not of the same nature.

original: 'brel pa med phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa med phyir mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical because there is no relation.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa ni gnyis te /
translated: For there are two kinds of relations:

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'o //
translated: identity and origination.

original: de la de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not identity, because

original: ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are different in nature.

original: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it origination, because

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow that there would be no condition of immediate antecedence.

original: de lta bas na 'brel pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'brel pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no relation, there is no expression and expressed.

original: 'dir de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The sword, etc.

original: ral gri ni gcod pa ste /
analyzed: ral gri ni gcod pa ste /
translated: The sword is the cutter.

original: gzhan la ste skyes bu la sogs pa la brgyab pa yis /
analyzed: gzhan la ste skyes bu la sogs pa la brgyab pa yis /
translated: By striking another, i.e., a person, etc.,

original: gzhan dag shing la sogs pa gcod par byed dam ci zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag shing la sogs pa gcod par byed dam ci zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: does it cut another, i.e., wood, etc.?

original: da ni kha cig sgra dang don la bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid yod do snyam pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni kha cig sgra dang don la bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid yod do snyam pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to eliminate the notion that some have that the relation of the expressed and expression is characterized by the relation of the produced and producer in regard to sound and meaning, he says:

original: ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Not produced” and so on.

original: phal cher 'bras bu'i bya ba byed pa'i nus pa rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: phal cher 'bras bu'i bya ba byed pa'i nus pa rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mthong ste /
translated: For the most part, the capacity to perform the action of the effect is not seen to follow or reverse along with the cause and effect.

original: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a seed and a sprout.

original: yang gang zhig bya ba dang bral ba'i dngos po bya ba byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba dang sgra tha mal pa'i dbye bas des ni gang yang thob med de /
analyzed: yang gang zhig bya ba dang bral ba'i dngos po bya ba byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba dang sgra tha mal pa'i dbye bas des ni gang yang thob med de /
translated: Moreover, whatever thing is devoid of action is devoid of the capacity to perform an action. By the division of ordinary sound, it does not obtain anything at all.

original: mi bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not generate, is the meaning.

original: de ni rtag pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is a permanent thing.

original: 'on te dngos po gang gis dngos po gang zhig skyed ce na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po gang gis dngos po gang zhig skyed ce na /
translated: But if it is asked, “By what thing is what thing generated?”

original: dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “By a non-thing” and so on.

original: dngos po gang zhig 'dir sngar ma skyes pa phyis rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba de ltar gyur pa'i dngos pos yang dngos po rab tu bskyed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig 'dir sngar ma skyes pa phyis rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis skye ba de ltar gyur pa'i dngos pos yang dngos po rab tu bskyed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Whatever thing is not produced here before, later is produced by the power of causes and conditions. By that thing becoming so, a thing is fully generated, is the meaning.

original: 'on te don med na sgra @91b mi 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te don med na sgra @91b mi 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: But if the object does not exist, then the word does not apply.

original: sgra 'jug pa las rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir ji ltar 'brel pa med pa yin /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa las rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir ji ltar 'brel pa med pa yin /
translated: Therefore, since the word applies due to the existence of a reason, how can there be no relation?

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that the word is applied due to the power of what is desired to be expressed.

original: gal te sgra rang gi rgyu las skye mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te sgra rang gi rgyu las skye mod kyi /
translated: Even if the word arises from its own cause,

original: brda sprod pas 'dod pa'i don sbyor bar byed pa'i don rgyu de dang lhan cig sbyor ba dang sbyor par byed pa'i dngos po'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: brda sprod pas 'dod pa'i don sbyor bar byed pa'i don rgyu de dang lhan cig sbyor ba dang sbyor par byed pa'i dngos po'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid do zhe na /
translated: the meaning of the word is applied to the object that the grammarians desire, and the meaning is related to that cause. The nature of the relation is that which connects.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “the nature of the thing,” etc.

original: dngos po'i ni bskyed pa'i bya ba byed pa rdzogs na dngos po'i rang bzhin min te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ni bskyed pa'i bya ba byed pa rdzogs na dngos po'i rang bzhin min te /
translated: When the activity of producing the thing is complete, the nature of the thing is not the thing itself,

original: gzhan skad cig ma'i ngo bo ni sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan skad cig ma'i ngo bo ni sbyor bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because the nature of another moment is not that which connects.

original: dngos po'i dus na dngos mid phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po'i dus na dngos mid phyir te /
translated: Because at the time of the thing, the non-thing does not exist.

original: bskyed par bya ba yod pa'i dus na skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba yod pa'i dus na skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause that is accepted as the producer itself ceases when the produced exists.

original: de nyid phyir na 'das pa'i dngos ni de nyid phyir ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na 'das pa'i dngos ni de nyid phyir ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the past entity is not a cause, because it is momentary.

original: 'byung ba zhes ni brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes ni brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is said to be an element,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means it is not a verbal object.

original: gzhan yang bskyed par bya ba dang / bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po brtags pa yin na ni /🔽de nyid phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bskyed par bya ba dang / bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po brtags pa yin na ni / de nyid phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, if the produced and the producer are imagined to be

original: de nyid phyir na ste sngar bshad pa'i skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo la gzhag nas skyob pa ni sangs rgyas te 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na ste sngar bshad pa'i skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo la gzhag nas skyob pa ni sangs rgyas te 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha, who is the protector, is said to be an element,

original: 'byung ba kun ni gzugs la sogs pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba kun ni gzugs la sogs pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the principal cause of form, etc.

original: nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa yin //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa yin //
translated: He is skilled in etymologies.

original: sgra'i don rnam par bcad pa nas pa dang ldan pas rab tu gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don rnam par bcad pa nas pa dang ldan pas rab tu gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the word is stated by the addition of the syllable pa.

original: kha cig gzhan skyed par byed par 'dod kyi 'byung ba chen po ni ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig gzhan skyed par byed par 'dod kyi 'byung ba chen po ni ma yin no zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say that it is the other that produces, not the great elements.

original: gzhan yang sgra'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate the object of the conceptual thought of sound,🔽he states:

original: gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: One hundred is not the cognition of one.

original: gcig ni dang po la'o //
analyzed: gcig ni dang po la'o //
translated: One is the first.

original: brgya'i blo skye min no //
analyzed: brgya'i blo skye min no //
translated: One hundred is not the cognition of one.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa nas brtsams te brgya rdzogs kyi par de la yang re re la yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa nas brtsams te brgya rdzogs kyi par de la yang re re la yang med de /
translated: In the same way, beginning with the second up to the completion of one hundred, there is no cognition of one hundred in each.

original: de bzhin yang brgya'i sgra las 'dus pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa dngos po yod pa brgya'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa la 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin yang brgya'i sgra las 'dus pa'i ngo bo tha dad pa dngos po yod pa brgya'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa la 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word one hundred is the conceptual thought of the object of one hundred, which is the nature of error in the mind.

original: gal te sgra nyams pas kyang don rtogs par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te sgra nyams pas kyang don rtogs par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Even if the sound is impaired, the meaning is understood.

original: 'di ltar yang rtags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sam skri ta'i skad des don khyad par can nyid rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /🔽mtho ris @92a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rtags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sam skri ta'i skad des don khyad par can nyid rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na / mtho ris @92a * //
translated: Thus, the Sanskrit language endowed with the characteristics and so on causes the special meaning to be understood.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one says “heaven,” and so on,

original: mtho ris dang sa 'og la sogs pa ma mthong ba dang / bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis lag pa'i tha snyad dang brdas de'i bdag nyid rtogs 'gyur na /
analyzed: mtho ris dang sa 'og la sogs pa ma mthong ba dang / bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis lag pa'i tha snyad dang brdas de'i bdag nyid rtogs 'gyur na /
translated: if one understands the nature of that by the convention of the hand and the sign in regard to seeing and not seeing heaven, the underworld, and so on, and seeing and not seeing a pot, and so on,

original: mtho ris dang bum pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: mtho ris dang bum pa la sogs pa'i tshig tu brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: what is the point of expressing the words “heaven” and “pot,” and so on?

original: de la dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dgos pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: What is the purpose of that?

original: don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that very meaning, he says,

original: glang po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: glang po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “If one says ‘elephant’ and so on,” and so forth.

original: tshig la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sam skri tas sa srung gi bu dang lha'i bu mo khyad par gyi khyad par can glang po dang bud med yin la sgra nyams pas de bzhin du yang glang po nyid dang bud med rtogs te /
analyzed: tshig la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i sam skri tas sa srung gi bu dang lha'i bu mo khyad par gyi khyad par can glang po dang bud med yin la sgra nyams pas de bzhin du yang glang po nyid dang bud med rtogs te /
translated: By means of Sanskrit endowed with words and so on, the son of the earth-goddess and the daughter of the gods, special and special-distinctive, are understood as elephant and woman, respectively. But by means of a defective pronunciation, elephant and woman are understood in the reverse order.

original: de las snga na med blo med de skye ba med do //
analyzed: de las snga na med blo med de skye ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no prior cognition, i.e., no arising.

original: mtho ba la mngon par zhen pa 'ba' zhig gis mchog tu skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtho ba la mngon par zhen pa 'ba' zhig gis mchog tu skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one is born as the highest only by the mere adherence to the exalted.

original: da ni nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to summarize, he says:

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Seeing, etc.

original: gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid mthong nas /
analyzed: gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid mthong nas /
translated: Having seen the particular characteristic of another,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan rang gi rnam par rtog pa smras te /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid gzhan rang gi rnam par rtog pa smras te /
translated: one speaks of the universal characteristic of another's conceptualization.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa thos pas rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs so //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa thos pas rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs so //
translated: Having heard the teaching of the universal characteristic, one understands the particular characteristic.

original: de ltar smyon pa bzhin te smyon pa lta bu'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan bstan pas gzhan mthong zhing gzhan thos pas gzhan rtogs te bdag nyid khong du chud ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar smyon pa bzhin te smyon pa lta bu'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan bstan pas gzhan mthong zhing gzhan thos pas gzhan rtogs te bdag nyid khong du chud ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, like a madman, the world, which is like a madman, sees other things, hears other things, and understands other things, because of being taught by others. The meaning is that it does not understand itself.

original: shin tu smyon pa dang chos mthun par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu smyon pa dang chos mthun par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the similarity to a madman,

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes pa'i sgra'i don ni gal te 'ga' zhig smyon par gyur nas bdag smyon pa yin no zhes shes pa'i phyir ji ltar smyon par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes pa'i sgra'i don ni gal te 'ga' zhig smyon par gyur nas bdag smyon pa yin no zhes shes pa'i phyir ji ltar smyon par 'gyur /
translated: he says “himself,” etc. The meaning of the word “if” is that if someone were to become a madman, how could he become a madman, because he knows “I am a madman”?

original: 'on kyang rang rig pa'i ye shes la gang 'khrul pa de smyon pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang rig pa'i ye shes la gang 'khrul pa de smyon pa zhes brjod do //
translated: However, that which is deluded with respect to the self-knowing gnosis is called a “madman.”

original: de lta bu'i smyon nad kyis smyon pa lta bur mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i smyon nad kyis smyon pa lta bur mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he sees like a madman who is afflicted with such a madness.

original: zhar la byung ba nye bar bsdus nas /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba nye bar bsdus nas /
translated: Having summarized the digression,

original: da ni rang bzhin gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the nature of the three natures,

original: yul sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “object,” etc.

original: yul sogs nges pa'i rnam par ni //
analyzed: yul sogs nges pa'i rnam par ni //
translated: The form of the object, etc.

original: stsogs pa smos pas ni dus nges pa'i rnam pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas ni dus nges pa'i rnam pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the form of the object in terms of time.

original: ji ltar 'gro ba gsum po 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi mthus rnam par rig pa snang ba ni gsal bar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba gsum po 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi mthus rnam par rig pa snang ba ni gsal bar ro //
translated: The appearance of consciousness, due to the power of the instinct for nescience, is clear in the three realms of desire, form, and the formless.

original: de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyi dbang rnam par rig par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gzhan gyi dbang rnam par rig par gyur pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the other-dependent, which is the nature of error, is the transformation of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir ni rgyu de nyid kyis kun brtags pa'i dri ma dang @92b bral na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ni rgyu de nyid kyis kun brtags pa'i dri ma dang @92b bral na /
translated: Therefore, when one is separated from the defilement of the imagined,

original: de ni rnam par rig pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rig pa 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: consciousness does not become erroneous.

original: gal te 'di ltar dus thams cad du ma 'khrul pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar dus thams cad du ma 'khrul pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is so that it is not erroneous at all times,

original: ci'i phyir rnam par rig pa mthong par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par rig pa mthong par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why is consciousness not seen?

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: thams cad grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad grol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all would be liberated.

original: gzhan nyid dang ma bral na de bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang ma bral na de bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not different, it would not be thusness.

original: da ni rang bzhin gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to analyze the nature of the three natures,

original: glang po'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: glang po'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
translated: two verses beginning with “like an elephant” are stated.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis glang po gcig sprul pa la /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis glang po gcig sprul pa la /
translated: A magician conjures up an elephant.

original: sgyu ma'i glang po la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pas kun btags pa'i rang bzhin la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po la grangs ji lta ba bzhin du mkhas pas kun btags pa'i rang bzhin la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The wise should understand the imagined nature, etc., to be like the number of illusory elephants.

original: 'di ltar don dam par don stong pa'i glang po la glang po'i don du snang ba skye ba 'dis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par don stong pa'i glang po la glang po'i don du snang ba skye ba 'dis ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the ultimate, empty object, the appearance of an elephant as an elephant, should be understood as the imagined nature.

original: de bzhin du don snang ba ni de don ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don snang ba ni de don ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the appearance of an object is not that object.

original: 'on kyang don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skye'o //
translated: Nevertheless, consciousness arises in the aspect of the object.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood as the dependent nature.

original: gzhan yang gzung ba'i dngos po brdzun don yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzung ba'i dngos po brdzun don yin te /
translated: Moreover, the false object of the apprehended is

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po de'i dngos po ni gnas su gyur pa ste rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po de'i dngos po ni gnas su gyur pa ste rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: The reality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is the basis, the support.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de yang dngos po med par gyur na /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de yang dngos po med par gyur na /
translated: And when that apprehended object and apprehending subject are non-existent,🔽the wise, endowed with wisdom, should know it as the perfected nature.

original: mkhas pa shes rab dang ldan pas yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab dang ldan pas yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bas na de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de ltar yang dag mthong bas sngar //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag mthong bas sngar //
translated: Thus, by seeing the perfect,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: de ltar ni sngar gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni sngar gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Thus, by the previously stated method,

original: sgyu ma'i glang po bzhin du yang dag par mthong bas dang por don du 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i glang po bzhin du yang dag par mthong bas dang por don du 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: by seeing the perfect, like an illusory elephant, first the grasping of the object is reversed.

original: rnal 'byor ba des de ma thag tu gzhan dbang de'i rnam pa ni bag chags kyi dbang gis de'i sems las byung ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba des de ma thag tu gzhan dbang de'i rnam pa ni bag chags kyi dbang gis de'i sems las byung ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Immediately after that, the yogī should know that the form of that other-dependent is produced from his mind by the power of the latent impressions.

original: dus ji snyed cig ce na /
analyzed: dus ji snyed cig ce na /
translated: For how long a time?

original: rnam pa de yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa de yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse that begins with “In that way” and so on.

original: de'i ni gzhan gyi dbang gis sems bdun pa'i bar du rnam pa de'i rnyog pa yang ste dri ma dang ldan par 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i ni gzhan gyi dbang gis sems bdun pa'i bar du rnam pa de'i rnyog pa yang ste dri ma dang ldan par 'jug go //
translated: In that way, the dependent mind engages with the stains, that is, the defilements, up to the seventh stage.

original: yang phyi nas sa brgyad pa la bag chags ldog pas rgyu log pas 'bras bu ldog go zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'di ste /
analyzed: yang phyi nas sa brgyad pa la bag chags ldog pas rgyu log pas 'bras bu ldog go zhes bya ba'i rigs pa 'di ste /
translated: Moreover, later, on the eighth stage, the habitual tendencies are stopped. The reason is that the cause is stopped, and so the result is stopped. This is the principle.

original: don gyi dngos po med mthong bas te rtsa ba dang bcas par 'don pa'i phyir ro //🔽don gyi rnam pa gzhan gyi dbang gis sems ldog par 'gyur ro zhes @93a * //
analyzed: don gyi dngos po med mthong bas te rtsa ba dang bcas par 'don pa'i phyir ro // don gyi rnam pa gzhan gyi dbang gis sems ldog par 'gyur ro zhes @93a * //
translated: Because one sees the nonexistence of the entity of the object, one uproots it together with its root.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind is stopped by the aspect of the object, the dependent nature.

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du srid pa yongs su 'dzin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the bodhisattva takes up existence for the sake of sentient beings, he says,

original: sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: “The mind” and so on.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i 'brel bas rtag tu 'khor ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i 'brel bas rtag tu 'khor ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the connection with the connate view of a self and so on, one always possesses the dharmas of saṃsāra.

original: rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo lta bur sems mthong na yid ldog pas yongs su grub pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de phyir yang 'khor bar 'khor bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo lta bur sems mthong na yid ldog pas yongs su grub pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de phyir yang 'khor bar 'khor bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the mind is seen to be like a potter’s wheel, the mind turns away from the mind. Therefore, the bodhisattva does not again revolve in cyclic existence, because he is a perfected being.

original: 'khor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba ma yin no //
translated: He does not revolve in cyclic existence.

original: 'on kyang sems can gyi don du thabs la mkhas pa'i dbang gis yang dag par skye ba 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can gyi don du thabs la mkhas pa'i dbang gis yang dag par skye ba 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the meaning is that he is born again through the power of skill in means for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gnyis su med pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
