analyzed: gnyis su med pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of the yogi who abides in nonduality,

original: ri mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ri mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “like a painting,” and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa'i yul la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i yul la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yin te /
translated: This is the characteristic of the yogi who abides in the object of nonduality.

original: ri mor bris pa'i skyes bu bzhin du g-yo ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: ri mor bris pa'i skyes bu bzhin du g-yo ba med pa yin te /
translated: He is motionless like a person painted in a picture,

original: de kho na nyid la bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he observes the activity of reality.

original: rdzas kyi bdag nyid phung po lnga po mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi bdag nyid phung po lnga po mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: He is without conceptual thought because he does not observe the five aggregates that are the nature of substances.

original: yul 'ga' la 'dod pa med pas na 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yul 'ga' la 'dod pa med pas na 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: It is desireless because it does not desire any object.

original: 'khor ba kun brtags pa'i ngo bo ni de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir dang / de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir des mya ngan las 'das pa mi len cing 'khor ba 'dor ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'khor ba kun brtags pa'i ngo bo ni de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir dang / de dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir des mya ngan las 'das pa mi len cing 'khor ba 'dor ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Since the imagined nature of cyclic existence does not exist in reality, and since nirvana, which is characterized by freedom from that, is not perceived, it does not take up nirvana and does not abandon cyclic existence in the least.

original: gang gi phyir lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa don gzhan rdzas su yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa don gzhan rdzas su yod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical for nirvana with and without remainder to be different things that exist substantially.

original: gang gi phyir lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang lam gyi gnas skabs gsum ma gtogs par don gzhan du gyur pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang lam gyi gnas skabs gsum ma gtogs par don gzhan du gyur pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni med do //
translated: Nirvana with remainder is not a different thing from the three states of suffering, origin, and path.

original: lhag ma med pa de yang don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa de yang don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical for nirvana without remainder to be a different thing.

original: 'di ltar lhag ma ni phung po rnams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhag ma ni phung po rnams te /
translated: The remainder is the aggregates.

original: de dang thal ba gang la yod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de dang thal ba gang la yod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de ni lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: And nirvana that is associated with that and with the consequence is the nirvana without remainder.

original: yang de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rten yang slar 'byung ba'i phung po'i tshogs med pa'i phyir gang zhig dngos por gyur pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: yang de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rten yang slar 'byung ba'i phung po'i tshogs med pa'i phyir gang zhig dngos por gyur pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Moreover, therefore, since there is no collection of aggregates that arise again, there is no nirvana that is an existent.

original: gzhan yang gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa tha dad par gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa tha dad par gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if nirvana were different from form, etc.,

original: de'i de @93b rnam par gzhan pa gang gis rtogs par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de'i de @93b rnam par gzhan pa gang gis rtogs par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: by what other aspect would it be realized?

original: shes pa gzhan gyis rang bzhin ngo bo nges par gzung na ni de'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis rang bzhin ngo bo nges par gzung na ni de'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were ascertained as a nature by another cognition, it would not be its nature.

original: 'on te nges par gzung na ni de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du 'dus byas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te nges par gzung na ni de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du 'dus byas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were ascertained, then it would be conditioned like form, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma nyid ma yin no /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig ma nyid ma yin no /
translated: For that very reason, it is not momentary.

original: de lta bas na mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po de len par rnal 'byor pa su zhig byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po de len par rnal 'byor pa su zhig byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, what yogi would take that which is nirvana as a thing?

original: don dam pa la gnas na de la sems can gyi don bya bas dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: don dam pa la gnas na de la sems can gyi don bya bas dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If one abides in the ultimate, what is the purpose of working for the welfare of sentient beings there?

original: smon lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: smon lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “due to the power of former prayers,” etc.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: There is no conceptualization of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: 'on kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus srid pa gsum gyi sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus srid pa gsum gyi sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir 'byung ngo //
translated: However, due to the power of former prayers, he arises in order to work for the welfare of sentient beings in the three worlds.

original: ci lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bur zhe na /
translated: What is he like?

original: nyi ma bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyi ma bzhin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “like the sun,” etc.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'jig rten gyi mun nag smag sel bar byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'jig rten gyi mun nag smag sel bar byed pa'i phyir 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the orb of the sun arises in order to dispel the darkness and gloom of the world,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba'i phyir byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattvas arise in order to dispel the darkness of ignorance in the world.

original: da ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstan pa la 'jug go zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstan pa la 'jug go zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the Bhagavān Buddhas engage in teaching based on conventional truth, he says:

original: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān taught that the fruits of actions are established in the world.

original: yang gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa kho na don dam pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa po'i skyes bu'i las kyi 'bras bu ni mtho ris dang dmyal ba la sogs pa skyob pas gsungs pa de yang rtog
analyzed: yang gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa kho na don dam pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byed pa po'i skyes bu'i las kyi 'bras bu ni mtho ris dang dmyal ba la sogs pa skyob pas gsungs pa de yang rtog
translated: Again, because nonduality alone is the ultimate, therefore, the Bhagavān taught that the fruits of actions of the person who performs virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are the realms of high status, hell, and so on.

original: pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: Those are of the nature of🔽imagination.

original: brtags pa kho nar khong du chud par bya'o //🔽las 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brtags pa kho nar khong du chud par bya'o // las 'bras bu 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: They should be understood as only imagined.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji snyed bstan pa de snyed kun rdzob kyi 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji snyed bstan pa de snyed kun rdzob kyi 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Not only are the fruits of actions so, in order to demonstrate that all that the Bhagavān taught is the engagement of conventional truth, he says:

original: chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Dharma and so on.

original: de la chos ni dge ba'i bya ba rnams ni mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ni dge ba'i bya ba rnams ni mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Therein, dharma is the nonforgetting of virtuous actions.

original: chos min de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: chos min de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Adharma is the opposite of that.

original: dka' thub ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Austerity is the patience of not minding suffering.

original: gtong ba ni don du gnyer ba la lus la sogs pa ster ba'o //
analyzed: gtong ba ni don du gnyer ba la lus la sogs pa ster ba'o //
translated: Giving is the bestowal of one's body, etc. to those in need.

original: bsdams pa ni lus dang sems mi dge ba las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: bsdams pa ni lus dang sems mi dge ba las ldog pa'o //
translated: Restraint is the turning away of body and mind from evil.

original: des bsdams pa ni gnyen pos dka' ba las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: des bsdams pa ni gnyen pos dka' ba las ldog pa'o //
translated: That which is restrained is the turning away from evil by means of the antidote.

original: dul ba ni sems nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dul ba ni sems nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Gentleness is the calming of the mind.

original: dud 'gro ni ba lang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro ni ba lang la sogs pa'o //
translated: Animals are cows, etc.

original: dmyal ba ni mtshams med pa na gnas pa la sogs pa'o //🔽sbyin @94a * //
analyzed: dmyal ba ni mtshams med pa na gnas pa la sogs pa'o // sbyin @94a * //
translated: Hell beings are those who dwell in the Avici hell, etc.

original: pa la sogs pa la gegs byed pa'i las kyis zas skom dang bral ba'i yul gnas pa ni yi dvags so //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa la gegs byed pa'i las kyis zas skom dang bral ba'i yul gnas pa ni yi dvags so //
translated: Pretas are those who dwell in places devoid of food and drink due to the karma of obstructing the giving, etc. of food and drink.

original: phung po lngas bsdus pa ni mi'o //
analyzed: phung po lngas bsdus pa ni mi'o //
translated: Humans are those comprised of the five aggregates.

original: mtho ris na gnas pas na lha'o //
analyzed: mtho ris na gnas pas na lha'o //
translated: Gods are those who dwell in the higher realms.

original: 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elements are earth, etc.

original: 'byung ba las gyur ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elemental derivatives are form, etc.

original: phung po ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates are form, feeling, etc.

original: khams ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sense spheres are the eye, etc.

original: thub pas sems can la rjes su bstan pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thub pas sems can la rjes su bstan pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The Sage’s teaching to sentient beings is the teaching.

original: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Teacher is the Lord Buddha.

original: nyan thos ni sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'o //🔽de dag ni kun rdzob tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos ni sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'o // de dag ni kun rdzob tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: The disciples are Śāriputra and so on.🔽They are taught conventionally.

original: de dag thams cad kun rdzob yin par bstan gyi /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kun rdzob yin par bstan gyi /
translated: All of them are taught to be conventional,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not ultimately. This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das don dam pa kho na 'ba' zhig ci'i phyir bstan par mi mdzad par kun rdzob tu dgos pa ci zhig yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don dam pa kho na 'ba' zhig ci'i phyir bstan par mi mdzad par kun rdzob tu dgos pa ci zhig yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Why does the Lord not teach only the ultimate? What is the need for the conventional?

original: dang po'i las can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dang po'i las can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The beginner,” and so on.

original: dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la dad pa dang ldan pa ni dang po'i las can no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang por bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la dad pa dang ldan pa ni dang po'i las can no zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has faith in the teaching of the Lord at the beginning is called a beginner.

original: dang po'i las can 'jig rten pa de don dam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la gzhug pa'i phyir thabs ni kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: dang po'i las can 'jig rten pa de don dam pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la gzhug pa'i phyir thabs ni kun rdzob ste /
translated: In order to introduce the beginner, the worldly person, to the nondual gnosis of the ultimate, the method is the conventional.

original: 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis skas la 'dzeg pa'i rigs pas gsungs kyi /
analyzed: 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis skas la 'dzeg pa'i rigs pas gsungs kyi /
translated: The perfect Buddha, the Transcendent Lord, has taught this by the method of climbing a ladder.

original: yang kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo yod par grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang kun rdzob kyi rang gi ngo bo yod par grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, the existence of the nature of the conventional is not established.

original: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Thus, etc.”

original: de ltar ni kun rdzob pa'i dngos po thams cad byis pas brjod pa dang 'dra ba de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa mthar ni thams cad 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni kun rdzob pa'i dngos po thams cad byis pas brjod pa dang 'dra ba de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa mthar ni thams cad 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Thus, all things of the conventional, like the expressions of the childish, are not the nature of reality. In the end, everything is destroyed,

original: rnam par dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir blo la gnas pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir blo la gnas pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: because they cannot withstand analysis. The meaning is that they do not remain in the mind.

original: de bzhin du brjod par bya min te brjod par bya ba min zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du brjod par bya min te brjod par bya ba min zhes bstan to //
translated: Likewise, they are not to be expressed. The meaning is that they are not to be expressed.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir dpyad du med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir dpyad du med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the nature of apprehendeds and apprehenders cannot withstand analysis, the meaning is that they are not to be analyzed.

original: cung zad gzhan yang ste don dam pa gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad gzhan yang ste don dam pa gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Also, something else: the meaning is that the ultimate is clear.

original: da ni de kho na nyid la rab tu gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de kho na nyid la rab tu gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the one who is well-established in reality,

original: de la nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “There, space,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dpyad du med pa cung zad med pa'i go 'phang la gnas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dpyad du med pa cung zad med pa'i go 'phang la gnas pa /
translated: Thus, he who is established in the state of the inexpressible, the unanalyzable, and the non-existent,

original: de ni nam mkha' gsal ba'i dngos po byang chub sems dpas bdag nyid ni gang zag go //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' gsal ba'i dngos po byang chub sems dpas bdag nyid ni gang zag go //
translated: that bodhisattva, the clear light of space, is the self.

original: @94b stong pa nyid ni des stong pa nyid de de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: @94b stong pa nyid ni des stong pa nyid de de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is the characteristic of reality.

original: stong pa nyid ni gsal bar byed pa ni 'jig rten rnams la rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gsal bar byed pa ni 'jig rten rnams la rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The clear light of emptiness is the illumination of the world, meaning the illumination of the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: gang khams dang skye mched bstan pa de ni bdag nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang khams dang skye mched bstan pa de ni bdag nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: That which is taught as the elements and sense bases is the emptiness of the self.

original: gang gi phyir bdag nyid mthong ba po la sogs par 'ga' zhig 'dod pas yang gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag nyid mthong ba po la sogs par 'ga' zhig 'dod pas yang gang gi tshe /
translated: Because the self is asserted to be the seer and so on, then when

original: mig la sogs pa yul la so sor nges pa nyid khong du chud pa de'i tshe bdag gang zag gi stong pa nyid grub pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yul la so sor nges pa nyid khong du chud pa de'i tshe bdag gang zag gi stong pa nyid grub pa'o //
translated: When one understands that the eye, etc. are individually determined with respect to their objects, then the emptiness of the self of the person is established.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dmigs pa chos la bdag med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dmigs pa chos la bdag med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the objects of the eye, etc. were not empty of the self of the person, then the selflessness of dharmas would not be established.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: gang zhig mi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gang zag stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid ni gnyis su med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig mi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gang zag stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid ni gnyis su med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: because the emptiness of the person, which is the nature of the human being, etc. is the emptiness of the non-dual.

original: 'di ltar sems nyid gang gi tshe gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba de'i tshe gang zag dang chos la bdag med par grub par gyur pa'i phyir 'di la rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems nyid gang gi tshe gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba de'i tshe gang zag dang chos la bdag med par grub par gyur pa'i phyir 'di la rtsod pa med do //
translated: Thus, when the mind itself is seen as having a non-dual nature, then the emptiness of the self of the person and of dharmas is established, and so there is no dispute about this.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa med pas bde bar gnas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa med pas bde bar gnas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the stage of maturation, by abandoning the obscurations of the afflictions and of the knowable, abides in the bliss of the absence of afflictions. Two verses on the analysis of the absence of afflictions.

original: ji skad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is meant by this?

original: nyan thos kyi lam gyi gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas nyon mongs pa spangs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam gyi gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas nyon mongs pa spangs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi dmigs so //
translated: The śrāvaka path is the realization of the selflessness of persons, and by eliminating the afflictions, the faults of attachment and so on are not observed.

original: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di la shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas gnyi ga mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di la shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas gnyi ga mi dmigs so //
translated: Similarly, on this bodhisattva path as taught, by eliminating the obscurations of knowledge and the afflictions, both are not observed.

original: gzhan gyi lam la brten pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis nye bar bcom par mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lam la brten pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis nye bar bcom par mthong ste /
translated: Seeing that all beings who rely on other paths are destroyed by the distinctions of attachment and so on,

original: bzhad gad bzhin te khrel bgad dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpas mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzhad gad bzhin te khrel bgad dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpas mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva sees them as if laughing, as if smiling.

original: 'go ba ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'go ba ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of destruction is it?

original: zhi ba spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba spangs pa yin te /
translated: It is the abandonment of peace.

original: zhi ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa'i dgra las rgyal bar ma byas pas zhi ba spangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyis nyon mongs pa'i dgra las rgyal bar ma byas pas zhi ba spangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Peace is not making victory over the enemy of the afflictions through samādhi. The meaning is that peace is abandoned.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Likewise, it is said, “By himself, etc.”

original: sngon gyi skye ba nyams su myong bas de gzung ba'i ro gcig dngos te lam gzhan bzung bas ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyis dran nas gang gi sems par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba nyams su myong bas de gzung ba'i ro gcig dngos te lam gzhan bzung bas ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyis dran nas gang gi sems par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: The bodhisattva remembers by the identity of the taste of the object grasped in the experience of former lives, and by the identity of the taste of the object grasped in the other path.

original: gdon mi za bar ngo mtshar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽chos @95a * //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar ngo mtshar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // chos @95a * //
translated: The meaning is that he is certainly amazed.

original: la bdag med pa yin na chos 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: la bdag med pa yin na chos 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: If there is no self in phenomena, then since one does not perceive any phenomena,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rtsom pa don med par 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rtsom pa don med par 'gyur ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: is it not the case that the bodhisattva’s practice of generosity and so on is meaningless?

original: gal te 'di kun stong nyid yin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'di kun stong nyid yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If all this is emptiness, etc.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba 'di'i phyir lan 'debs so ;
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba 'di'i phyir lan 'debs so ;
translated: The word “his” is the reason for the reply.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' gang gi phyir //
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' gang gi phyir //
translated: The bodhisattva, for whose sake

original: bya ba lhag ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba lhag ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: there is no remainder of action,

original: don byas pa dgos pa byas pa'i phyir 'gro ba stong pa mthong ba yin pa de'i chos kyi rtsom pa don med pa bden zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don byas pa dgos pa byas pa'i phyir 'gro ba stong pa mthong ba yin pa de'i chos kyi rtsom pa don med pa bden zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the purpose has been accomplished, the purpose has been fulfilled, one sees the emptiness of beings. The meaning of the statement “the beginning of his Dharma is meaningless” is that it is true.

original: 'di mos pa spyod pa'i gnas skabs na bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i stobs kyis sa brgyad pa la sogs pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de stong pa nyid la gnas pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di mos pa spyod pa'i gnas skabs na bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i stobs kyis sa brgyad pa la sogs pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de stong pa nyid la gnas pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: at the stage of practice through belief, the bodhisattva who has attained the eighth stage and so on, by the power of having accumulated the collection of merit, gives rise to the abiding in emptiness.

original: de lta mod kyi sdig pa spong bar mi byed dam zhe na /🔽de tshe sdig pa'i rtsom pa yang //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sdig pa spong bar mi byed dam zhe na / de tshe sdig pa'i rtsom pa yang //
translated: But is it not the case that he does not abandon evil?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “At that time, even the composition of evil…”

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid lta ba la gnas pa de'i tshe sdig pa'i rtsom pa ni sdig pa byed pa'i rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid lta ba la gnas pa de'i tshe sdig pa'i rtsom pa ni sdig pa byed pa'i rtsom pa'o //
translated: The composition of evil is the composition of the performance of evil.

original: de yis shin tu mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yis shin tu mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “that is not at all reasonable” is that it is not reasonable at all.

original: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pas bsgribs pas bsod nams ma yin pa la 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pas bsgribs pas bsod nams ma yin pa la 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, because of being obscured by the afflictions and secondary afflictions rooted in the perishable collection view, one engages in demerit.

original: yang gang zhig chos la bdag med pa mthong ba dang ldan pa de dag mi dge ba rtsom par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang gang zhig chos la bdag med pa mthong ba dang ldan pa de dag mi dge ba rtsom par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But how could those who possess the vision of the selflessness of phenomena engage in nonvirtue?

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: chang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Because they are empty-handed, etc.”

original: 'di ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig lag pa stong pa'i phyir chang  pa mi 'chang ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir bya ba la mi 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig lag pa stong pa'i phyir chang  pa mi 'chang ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir bya ba la mi 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, just as a person does not carry an empty vessel because his hands are empty, so the bodhisattva does not engage in action because he realizes the selflessness of phenomena. This is the meaning.
